product: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I've got to be honest, I'm blown away by the sound quality of these cheap earbuds. I downloaded the Baseus app and fooled around with the different sound settings, settling on creating a custom EQ. I admit I'm not a big bass guy but the app also has a "mega bass" setting which I activated and it added volume and a little thump that passed my limited bass comfort. The EQ (and bass) also added volume which is important since these clips rest close to your ear but not in the ear. I use the Shanling M0 Pro (2nd gen) which I've been using with wired Grado headphones in the gym. I didn't feel stupid with the big phones on my head since, afterall, the tennis pros and Lebron James come out wearing big phones. With several earlier buds the bluetooth connection on the Shanling did stumble and stutter a bit which I realized was not the buds but the player. The Baseus buds struggled the least, which leads me to conclude the bluetooth connection is probably stronger. As far as comfort, the 1st ime I tried them, 2 hours later I was in the shower sudsing up my head when you guessed it, I still had them on. I highly recommend these buds.

product: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I'm a big fan of Baseus earbuds. These things are amazing. I gave my last one to my elderly uncle who refuses to get a hearing aid... These are pretty loud and don't crack on high volume. The bass is pretty good given they're open ear.. they're extremely comfortable and very light weight. Battery life is long enough to last all night.. I sleep with them on.

product: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Product had great sound and comfort but did not fit my ears well. I love how you can use the app to tune them as you'd like but due to the fit I will unfortunately send them back.

product: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds
review_text: This review is for Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-ear Headphones. (in case this review is lumped together with other models they sell)They sound great in quiet environments because the overall output levels can't get very loud, made worse by lower bass response than many other open ear designs.In a quiet environment they have a very clean output that sounds pretty good if you aren't playing anything with much low frequency content.  I don't mean it doesn't match basshead expectations, I mean there's country music that you will be disappointed with the lack of strong bass.  It gets more disappointing if you specifically listen to decaf/rebassed tracks or anything that plays below about 32Hz... levels roll off pretty quickly below that, being absent below 22 or 23Hz.Pressing the open ear transducers to close off the open ear gap doesn't help much.  They are about as good as they are gonna get in their natural positions.They are good for most music.Their bluetooth range is pretty impressive.Battery endurance is super good due to truncated bass response below about 30Hz.  Usually I am seeing 12-14 hours on a single full charge, running down to 15-20% remaining.  This is a mix of music, YouTube, calls, and idle time in my work day.Comfort is really good: I can put them over my ears at 7AM and take them off at 9PM without ear fatigue or discomfort.  That beats my AfterShokz models which are bone conduction for comfort, though sound clarity is superior with these Baseus headphones.A breeze above 15mph makes phone calls disappointing, but below that or indoors they are actually great for calls.I will be buying a different set in the near future and giving these to a friend that mostly stays indoors.  Not for me, as I spend a lot of time outside in a windy state.I tried all supported Codecs, and leave them connected by LDAC or AptX HD.  These are good enough to tell the difference between higher bit rate codecs and SBC easily.My biggest issue is that they don't get loud enough for use in a noisy city street, and secondary they roll off the bass output above the bottom end of typical modern country, R&B, or Hip Hop music tracks.I am not looking for extra bass, only balanced bass that accurately plays evenly down to what an organ or bass drum should sound like.So, tldr: good soundfield recreation if you are okay with truncated bass spectrum and lower total output in trade for excellent battery endurance.

product: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Very reasonable. Loud and clear! I mostly wear one at a time at work and one is good enough to hear music clearly and the outside noise. When both are in, I cant hear anything outside unless the volume is very low. Great earphones for the price. I would definitely purchase these again. As a matter of fact, I tried ordering 3 more pairs for Christmas gifts but the order was delayed and wouldn't arrive on time. I was unfortunately, forced to cancel. I'll try again after the New Year of 2026!

product: Baseus Eli Sport 2 Open-Ear Headphones Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I purchased these based on a New York Times Wirecutter recommendation. I'm used to bone conducting headsets, so this form factor was different. They were a little awkward to put on, but only slightly - I likely would have gotten used to it in time. I appreciated that they had physical buttons, making it easy to play/pause, fast-forward and so on (although the buttons could be a little larger). It's not clear if there's a way to turn them off without putting them in the case. The intention is clearly to carry the case around with you at all times - a little awkward, as the case isn't tiny.These didn't interfere with my glasses and I had no significant issues with comfort for long-term wear, at least not from a couple days of use. (I'm practically always listening to podcasts and audiobooks, so I wear a Bluetooth headset all day long). Wearing them around other people may be off-putting: although these are open-ear headsets, so you can still hear normally, it LOOKS like you have headphones in your ears, so people may assume you aren't listening.My only major issue is battery life. The listing is proud to claim 45 hours of battery life... but that's talking about the charge in the case, not in the earpieces. Supposedly the earpieces should last 8 hours. I didn't measure it very scientifically, but my impression was that they lasted about 2-3 hours. Even if I'm wildly mistaken, they definitely wouldn't last more than 5 hours. So these are only useful if you're putting them in the case and letting them recharge multiple times a day. That's not how I use Bluetooth headsets: I leave them on all day so I can play audio anytime, and often for long periods of time. These are fine for a workout, but not for all-day use.

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: Pretty good for the price. They stay in when working in the yard, and mute the chainsaw noise quite well. Base is good but with a name like Baseus, I kinda expected a bit more low end. Comfortable and a nice, long battery life have been my experience. Overall excellent built quality and the app is useful and intuitive. If the Soundcore Liberty 5 Pros were out, I'd have went that way, but I'm not disappointed with these earbuds.

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: The Inspire XP1 earbuds deliver excellent sound with Bose tuning and Dolby Spatial Audio. Their adaptive noise cancellation creates a quiet, comfortable experience wherever you are, and the ergonomic fit ensures long-lasting comfort.With clear calls thanks to a 6-mic AI system and robust battery life, these earbuds are a solid pick for premium audio on the move.

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: The Baseus Inspire XP1 earbuds are amazing! The adaptive noise cancelling works flawlessly, blocking out background noise without hurting sound quality. Music is crystal clear, with rich bass and balanced highs. Super comfortable fit, even for long use, and the battery lasts impressively long. Great build quality too‚Äîdefinitely worth it!

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I‚Äôve been using these earbuds for a few weeks now, and I‚Äôm really impressed. The sound quality is clear with solid bass, and they connect instantly to my phone every time. The charging case feels sturdy and compact, easy to carry in my pocket.The battery life is excellentI can use them for hours without worrying about recharging. The green indicator light is helpful, and the case charges quickly through USB-C.They fit comfortably in my ears and don‚Äôt fall out even when I‚Äôm walking or working out. For the price, these are an amazing value. Idefinitely recommend for anyone looking for reliable wireless earbuds

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I‚Äôve been using the Baseus Inspire XP1 for a while now, and I‚Äôm really impressed! The sound quality is excellent ‚Äî deep bass, clear vocals, and crisp highs. The noise cancelling works surprisingly well, blocking out most background noise even in busy places.They‚Äôre super comfortable to wear for long periods, and the fit feels natural and secure. I also love how clear the call quality is ‚Äî the 6-mic system really makes a difference. Battery life is fantastic too; I can go days without recharging.Overall, these earbuds easily compete with much more expensive brands. Highly recommended for anyone looking for great sound, comfort, and long battery life!

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: Overall, very solid buds. Their sound, battery, controls, feel, fit, and in app support is all very solid.Let‚Äôs start with the pros.Sound quality is clean with an emphasis on the low and on highs, so a bit of a V Shape tuning. The mids are also very present and vocals sound nice and detailed with these buds. I couldn‚Äôt complain about their sound signature since it also comes with other presets that work very well.The fit is nice and snug since the design is made to fit the ear, with a slight protruding bump. Comes with 3 different eartips (one already on the buds).Controls are a better touch to them. They are touch control and can be customized. 3 taps and long press are present, so 4 different control types are there.ANC and transparency are a bang for your buck. ANC is up there for the AirPod Pro 2‚Äôs and their transparency is also good enough to still stay aware of your surroundings. It‚Äôs not the clearest but definitely great.Their case and earbuds themselves feel premium and worth their price. I love the magnet on them since Baseus products usually have a strong magnet to them.Now for the cons.Sound quality is great, superb even, but the classics bass thump is lacking a bit. I was very disappointed to find out that there wasn‚Äôt a bass boost like most other Baseus products have. The XH1‚Äôs have it, and so it was mildly surprising to see these didn‚Äôt have it.Fit is good, but it could definitely be better. With light use and not as heavy a move, they wouldn‚Äôt fall out, but if I were to exercise, these would most likely slip. The limited use of 3 eartips definitely does not help.App Support could also be better. The Dolby Audio isn‚Äôt the best and custom EQ doesn‚Äôt provide the same experience as it does compared to the other standard EQ presents we can choose from. They sound quieter and a bit more flat. Also, as mentioned the above, the lack of bass boost button is upsetting.Overall, my experience with these have been positive so far and will keep testing them out.

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: To prefice, for 100$ these are great. Definitely worth the price. They sound really good overall, nothing is emphasised throughout the frequency raise. If anything, it has a little too much treble but not enough to cause listening fatigue. Because of this as well as the punchy, smooth bass and relaxed midrange everything sounds very nice and clear. Zero complaints really. The earbuts themselves are nice and compact, they feel premium, and connectivity is easy and quick. Definitely feels like they'll last for years to come.

product: Baseus Inspire XP1 Adaptive Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I didn't expect much when I first ordered.But now I'm using it for a month, it actually has a really good quality! Sound is clear, and it's really lightweight and fit into my ear perfectly. it doesn't hurt at all even when you use it in bed. It connects to any phones really easily! ( tried on both iphone and androids. Works great! )

product: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Have you ever felt the gut rumbling (sub) bass?  As in with a few 18" subwoofers going low and everything just rumble?  Now imagine hearing the same bass but without feeling it.  It's quite surreal and surreal is the best way to describe it when you are wearing this item and it hits the low bass.  You just don't feel it in your gut.  So revelation no. 1, yes, you can hear low bass, and no. 2, the BP1 Pro is pretty good.The item came nicely packaged, unlike the many cheap imports in plain plastic bags or cardboard boxes, it has a properly printed box with Hi-Res Audio (Wireless) label displayed prominently.  In addition, there is a bass label, too.  Never seen that before.  It also displays 55-hours battery life, -50dB adaptive hybrid ANC (active noise cancellation), IP55 splash resistant.  All very good characteristics for a set of true wireless in-ear earbuds.  And let's not forget the obligatory AI product association with 6-mic AI clear calls.  This item simply check all the boxes.  And that's just what's printed on the box!  The many functions aside, it also meets all the certifications as well, according to all the certification labels on the box, not to mention recycling directions.  All in multiple languages.  In fine print, it also boasts 58ms dual channel ultra low latency,  Something about bass boost and treble balance "tuned by Baseus App".  I might have to look into that but, spoiler alert, it already sounds very good.  It shows 10 minutes rapid recharge for 2-5 hours of play time and can seamlessly connect to two different devices.  Then there's a symbol for not including an AC adapter, and another that indicates it will support 2-5W chargers.  Inside the box, you will find the charging case with the ear buds in them, extra sets of ear tips for different ear cannel sizing, and an USB-A to USB-C charge cord.  True to advertisement, charging was indeed fast using a higher powered USB-C charger.  It went from pulsating green to solid green in no time to which I interpret as being fully charged.  Opening the lid starts the pairing process and putting them in your ear you can hear your paired device audio output.  They fit perfectly in my ears out of the box and are quite comfortable with the included tips.  Don't even have to swap tips, bonus!  And I already raved about the bass that it can hit low.  The treble is good, too, not shrilly, but very pleasant.  The mids aren't forward but not too laid back either.  So far with the music I've tried, it's at least a b+ tier sound to my ears, easily beat the Air Pod Pro and even possibly be on par with the Moon Drop Space Travel.  More comparisons will be necessary and I'll update with any further discoveries.  The build quality and material used also means it will be quite durable.I chose to pair it with my Android phone running current up to date version with Developer Mode enabled.  It even displays its name properly (unlike many cheap devices that use weird names).  Even with Developer mode enabled, however, LDAC CODEC option is still grayed out.  Sad face.  I thought I saw somewhere in the description that it had LDAC support.  I'll have to check with one of the AI models and see if it can be un-grayed out.  Maybe download the app will help.

product: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I seldom write reviews, but I can't pass up this one . I was pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. The sound quality is on par with much higher-priced brands, delivering clear highs, solid bass, and an overall balanced profile that makes music and calls sound great. The companion app is refreshingly straightforward‚Äîthe controls are simple and intuitive, without the clutter you find in some other brands. On top of that, the earbuds fit my ears perfectly, staying comfortable even during long use.Overall, an excellent value that easily exceeds expectations.

product: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds
review_text: First ImpressionsThis initial review is mostly for sound only. I am referencing these to my Technics AZ Series, which to this day, by far, the best sounding, clearest, most enjoyable tws earbuds I have come across. This goes for soundstage, depth, clarity across ranges, and what I consider faithfulness in sound reproduction, what Dre refers to as how the music is meant to be heard. Only the Technics has been able to shine across all these dimensions, coming from a horn, drums, percussion, and guitar player.That said, against this reference the BP1s in Noise Cancelling mode holds its own against my Technics in sound clarity, particularly with the bass as oft mentioned, and the highs which are close, but noticeably not par. Fades, sizzles, done right. This is impressive for the price, a mere fraction of what the Technics is at. Also the battery life is much, much better. Much less range anxiety.LDAC needs to be vetted more, particularly with an LDAC supported source, one of my fav being the Quad DAC LG G series, if you can find one that works. The music on those devices are legendary, on par with Technics, but LG never has been recognized for it. I anticipate the LDAC being impressive also, but once again not on par with something like a reference bud, although with the right app and settings I'm absolutely certain it can match it. Based on what I'm hearing as I'm typing, the Baseus BP1 has what it takes to reach that level, it just needs the right help.I'll add to this once I get to play with the settings more, as I'm not a fan of downloading apps just to control the sound or use. Hasn't been used on calls, not sure I want to. There's dedicated buds for that. I haven't submerged these in water yet either. And the tips haven't been fully optimized. I'm trying not to use the Spinfits I have even though they have solid collars. They cause itchiness and discomfort, unlike their mainland counterparts. That said, word to Floss, the BP1s are a "major, major, major GO."

product: Baseus Bass BP1 Pro Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I was really excited to try these out and man was I surprised with how great they sound especially for the price. They connected right away and the app makes the biggest difference with pretty much any earbuds these days and this one's no different. You can adjust anything and everything from the app making these sound absolutely incredible for the price. I would have thought these were $50+ just listening to them then seeing all the adjustments as well makes these a steal. They fit great, sound great, and the battery lasts forever as well.If you're on the fence, jump down and buy these now!Also, I want to give a shout out to their customer service for being absolutely top notch. I had an issue with something and they more than fixed it. Will definitely be buying from Baseus again and again!

I‚Äôve been getting close to what the product claims, and the charging case feels sturdy. The touch controls take a bit of getting used to, but once you figure them out, they respond consistently.Overall, these are very dependable earbuds for everyday use. Not perfect, but definitely worth the money if you want strong bass and decent ANC without spending a fortune.

If you want maximum battery life and punchy sound at a great price, these are a highly recommended purchase.

product: Baseus Bass BP1 NC Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds

product: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I am seriously impressed with the Baseus E20 earbuds. For such a compact design, the 12mm drivers deliver incredibly punchy, deep bass that makes my music feel alive.Here is why I love them:Crystal Clear Calls: The dual ENC mics actually work; people can hear me perfectly even when I‚Äôm outside.Battery Life for Days: With 33 hours of total playtime, I rarely have to worry about charging the case.Solid Connection: The Bluetooth 5.3 ensures I never deal with dropouts or lag.Built to Last: They feel durable, and the IPX5 water resistance gives me peace of mind during sweaty workouts or light rain.If you‚Äôre looking for high-quality sound and great features without breaking the bank, these are a fantastic choice!

product: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These little earbuds are awesome they definitely packs a punch they are loud and have a lot of bass..the sound quality was great and they fit well in the ear

product: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I really like.

product: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I've been using the E20 True Wireless Earbuds for a few weeks now, so I feel comfortable sharing my thoughts on them. I've used them while commuting, working out, relaxing at home, and even taking calls while doing other things. The earbuds connected to my phone in a matter of seconds and were ready to use. I didn't have to set them up again after that. Now, every time I take them out of the case, they connect right away. I thought they were comfortable in my ears when I put them on. They stayed in place for hours without causing any pain or pressure. The sound was rich and balanced, and the bass added depth without drowning out the rest of the track. I also use them a lot to watch videos, and the clarity makes it easy to understand what people are saying. I got many calls while I was cooking or walking the dog, and the person on the other end could hear me without me having to repeat myself. The battery life surprised me as well; I only had to charge the case every now and then because each listening session was so long. The fact that they are water-resistant makes me feel better about using them in more active situations. Despite frequent use in pockets, bags, and the charging case, they maintained their original appearance and functionality. The E20 earbuds have exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort, sound quality, and battery life after using them every day for the past few weeks. Whether I'm at home, at the gym, or out running errands, they are now a simple and dependable part of my daily routine. They can be used for almost any activity because they have a long battery life, a stable connection, and clear sound.

product: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I have long been a fan of the quality delivered by this manufacturer at an affordable price. When given the opportunity to take the E20 for a spin, I jumped at it!  No surprise, these are AMAZING for their price point of $19.99 (at time of review). As advertised, the bass is deep and vibrant. The mid-tones are good and the high-notes are not at all "tinny".  I find the stereo to be well balanced though the "sound stage" is definitely on the flat side - but, for $20, one cannot expect 7.1 surround sound. The fit is great out of the box and pairing to my phone was a breeze. With a full charge and some pep in my step I set out the door for a quick run and found that the volume levels are acceptable for exercise and that I could safely hear approaching traffic WITH noise canceling turned on or off. Voices on audiobooks/podcasts were clear and distinguishable while my '80s playlist rocked right around the block.  For $20, the fact it includes ANY level of noise cancellation is shocking so, being that its effect is a bit weak isn't a huge surprise or disappointment.  Operation is simple, with single, double and triple taps on either ear doing the job of answering calls or controlling music/chapters.  The charging case, as always, handles like a wet bar of soap but the buds pop right in and return to a full charge FAST.  Due to their solid sound, easy pairing and operation and PHENOMENAL price point, I give these a FULL recommendation and highly suggest these as gifts for ANY gift exchange with a price limit of $20!

product: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: For about $20, these are a good deal. Not the best sounding ear buds I have tried, but pretty decent. Good bass when they are tight in your ears but a little muddy sounding overall. I'm not a fan of this type of earbuds, though, because they don't stay in my ears very well.

product: Baseus E20 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I got these earbuds for my mom to use for her daily walks and listening to music at home. She likes something simple and comfortable, and these turned out to fit her needs well. The earbuds sit nicely in her ears without feeling bulky, so she can wear them for a while without discomfort. She mainly uses them for music, watching videos on her phone, and sometimes taking short calls.The sound quality surprised her, especially the bass, which gives music a fuller feel without overpowering the vocals. Connection has been steady, even as she moves around the house, and she hasn't had any issues with pairing or random dropouts. Battery life has also been more than enough for her daily use, she can go several days before needing a recharge. They've  become part of her daily routine, and she's been enjoying having a lightweight , reliable pair of earbuds that are easy to use and comfortable for long listening sessions.

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: absolutely amazing! Clear sound quality with rich bass and detailed highs ‚Äî perfect for music and calls. The noise cancellation works surprisingly well for semi-in-ear buds, making them great for commuting or studying. They‚Äôre super lightweight and comfortable to wear for hours, and the battery life easily lasts me several days. I also love the reliable Bluetooth connection and the AI mic clarity during calls. Totally worth it!

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: Baseus has been my go to brand for charging blocks and cables for a couple of years now. Excellent quality and these wireless earbuds did not disappoint.They deliver really clear and powerful sound. The ANC works perfectly to block out background noise. They're super lightweight and comfortable and you get insane playtime.Calls come through super clear and the water-resistant design makes them durable. Highly recommend these. Amazing value with an affordable price tag!

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: I‚Äôm impressed with the earbuds. The adaptive hybrid feature effectively cuts out background noise, letting me enjoy my music and podcasts anywhere. The audio is detailed and balanced, with good bass and clear vocals. They fit comfortably and feel weightless, even after hours of use. With long battery life and reliable connection, these earbuds are a good choice for daily use or travel.

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: The Noise Reduction actually works surprisingly well for earbuds that are not the in-ear type. This mode is a bit more "hissy" than what you would hear with in-ear buds. Fortunately the hiss does not increase with volume level, so if you listen at "normal" volume and the music doesn't have a very quiet passage, you probably won't notice it.The Gesture Settings controls offer very good customization options. Lots of flexibility for the tap commands. However, although you can adjust volume level, there is no aural feedback to let you know you've reached the maximum setting. Other earbuds I've tried do have this feature.If you are sitting still or walking, they stay in the ear pretty well. My left ear must have a bit of an odd shape because that one loosens up and doesn't sound as good when it does. The right one is fine though.EQ mode - If you are using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings, the only EQ mode you can use is "Baseus Classic" . If you attempt to switch to another EQ setting, it turns off Spatial Acoustics, which degrades both the volume level and sound quality.The Spatial Acoustics settings actually sound pretty good, but no EQ customization is possible. Personally I prefer the Cinema setting as it is a little less harsh in the high end.Bass Boost - there are five levels to choose from, but none of them have any noticeable effect on the sound.The stock EQ mode settings are OK, but there isn't much difference between them, and you cannot actually see a graph of which frequencies are boost/cut for each.The customizable EQ is shockingly bad. No matter what you do, I will bet money that you cannot make it sound even halfway decent.  Sounds like AM radio to me. Completely worthless to the user.The charge indicator light on the case is pretty useless. There is no readout of battery level, just a single LED indicator that changes color depending on charge level. The highest level indicator - green - means the battery level is between 40% and 100%. That's quite a range! There isn't even a case battery level readout in the phone app.The case does not accommodate wireless charging.Bottom line: these earbuds are pretty comfortable, and sound pretty decent when using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings. If you like to customize your sound with EQ, you will likely be as disappointed with these buds as I am.

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: I‚Äôm very impressed how they sound really good!Just the wear detection won‚Äôt activate if you remove the earbuds fast.  They‚Äôre light and fits my ear.  Battery last long. But it won‚Äôt show me the battery left on the case. Which is odd?Great Buy for sure! üëçI wish Baseus will make high end ‚Äúsemi in earbuds‚Äùwith high-res codec!

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: I've been looking for a pair of budget earbuds with good sound quality and decent ANC and have been disappointed with almost everything I've tried. So many make claims that are a real stretch, if not totally false. At full price, these are a solid contender, and on sale are an amazing value. They have great sound quality, especially when utilizing the customizations in the app. The sound is full and natural. The ANC is actually effective. I haven't compared them to higher dollar products, but within this price range I'm really impressed.Unfortunately, I'm still trying to decide if I can keep them or not. I wasn't paying attention and didn't notice that these don't have the rubber ear inserts so they don't stay in my ears very well when I'm moving around a lot. That is by no means a negative reflection on the product. It's just my ear shape and comfort preference. These do better than most though since they're a semi in ear design. I highly recommend them.

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: Requires an account, personal info, and GPS tracking access (even when the app isn't running) just to unlock full functionality. No disclosure in the listing. No legitimate reason for location tracking. Returning them and never buying from this brand again.Update: The seller reached out and clarified that you can use the app in guest mode and the buds still work without it. They said the tracking is for a find-my-device feature, though I'm not sure why that isn't advertised if it‚Äôs such a benefit. There are still plenty of complaints on the Google Play Store about the app requesting access to photos and contacts, and it seems nothing has changed in over two years since people questioned it. These are earbuds, so it‚Äôs unclear why photo and contact access is needed. Still, since they contacted me, I wanted to give a fair update to the review with their side of the story.

product: Baseus BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: This has to be the best pair of sub-$100 earbuds I have ever used. They are comfortable and sound great like actually sound great! The fit perfectly in my ears and don‚Äôt create any pressure with such an amazing pass through mode. Would highly recommend for listening to music or using with a portable gaming device!

product: Baseus Bass BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: absolutely amazing! Clear sound quality with rich bass and detailed highs ‚Äî perfect for music and calls. The noise cancellation works surprisingly well for semi-in-ear buds, making them great for commuting or studying. They‚Äôre super lightweight and comfortable to wear for hours, and the battery life easily lasts me several days. I also love the reliable Bluetooth connection and the AI mic clarity during calls. Totally worth it!

product: Baseus Bass BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: Baseus has been my go to brand for charging blocks and cables for a couple of years now. Excellent quality and these wireless earbuds did not disappoint.They deliver really clear and powerful sound. The ANC works perfectly to block out background noise. They're super lightweight and comfortable and you get insane playtime.Calls come through super clear and the water-resistant design makes them durable. Highly recommend these. Amazing value with an affordable price tag!

product: Baseus Bass BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: I‚Äôm impressed with the earbuds. The adaptive hybrid feature effectively cuts out background noise, letting me enjoy my music and podcasts anywhere. The audio is detailed and balanced, with good bass and clear vocals. They fit comfortably and feel weightless, even after hours of use. With long battery life and reliable connection, these earbuds are a good choice for daily use or travel.

product: Baseus Bass BS1 NC Semi-in-Ear True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds with Adaptive Hybrid ANC
review_text: The Noise Reduction actually works surprisingly well for earbuds that are not the in-ear type. This mode is a bit more "hissy" than what you would hear with in-ear buds. Fortunately the hiss does not increase with volume level, so if you listen at "normal" volume and the music doesn't have a very quiet passage, you probably won't notice it.The Gesture Settings controls offer very good customization options. Lots of flexibility for the tap commands. However, although you can adjust volume level, there is no aural feedback to let you know you've reached the maximum setting. Other earbuds I've tried do have this feature.If you are sitting still or walking, they stay in the ear pretty well. My left ear must have a bit of an odd shape because that one loosens up and doesn't sound as good when it does. The right one is fine though.EQ mode - If you are using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings, the only EQ mode you can use is "Baseus Classic" . If you attempt to switch to another EQ setting, it turns off Spatial Acoustics, which degrades both the volume level and sound quality.The Spatial Acoustics settings actually sound pretty good, but no EQ customization is possible. Personally I prefer the Cinema setting as it is a little less harsh in the high end.Bass Boost - there are five levels to choose from, but none of them have any noticeable effect on the sound.The stock EQ mode settings are OK, but there isn't much difference between them, and you cannot actually see a graph of which frequencies are boost/cut for each.The customizable EQ is shockingly bad. No matter what you do, I will bet money that you cannot make it sound even halfway decent.  Sounds like AM radio to me. Completely worthless to the user.The charge indicator light on the case is pretty useless. There is no readout of battery level, just a single LED indicator that changes color depending on charge level. The highest level indicator - green - means the battery level is between 40% and 100%. That's quite a range! There isn't even a case battery level readout in the phone app.The case does not accommodate wireless charging.Bottom line: these earbuds are pretty comfortable, and sound pretty decent when using one of the Spatial Acoustics settings. If you like to customize your sound with EQ, you will likely be as disappointed with these buds as I am.
