The ANC is not AS good as the other 3, but the sound and features more than make up for that. Anc isn't bad, but you do get a little background noise from TV in the room. Actual people and my dogs are not noticeable though. But the SOUND!  Best I've heard

product: JBL Tour Pro 3
review_text: These earbuds have very good audio in general, with typical JBL somewhat bass-heavy sound. However, the equalizer function's customizability easily compensates for the coloration. Other features include Ambient Noise Cancelling, spatial audio with optional head tracking, a smart charging case with touchscreen controls for nearly all features, a companion mobile device app with controls for all features, the case can be used as a transmitter to get the sound to the earbuds from non-Bluetooth devices with audio out via USB (A or C) or ‚Öõ inch (3.5 mm) headphone jack, or anything that can be adapted to one of those. Buds are capable of receiving Auracast audio. You can also listen to your tracks in high-resolution LDAC audio at 24 bits & 96 kHz. The only major features that I've seen elsewhere, that the Tour Pro 3 lack is a case that doubles as a Bluetooth speaker or a power bank. But honestly, does anyone really want to carry that extra weight around with the earbuds all the time? I already have a power bank and several Bluetooth speakers. I only carry them around when I reasonably expect to want or need them.However, I found the experience of using the buds for the first time less than satisfying. The main reason for replacing my previous earbuds was declining battery life. But though they were inexpensive (brand 233621, model Zen), they had what I now realize to be excellent broad-spectrum ANC. The Tour Pro 3, in contrast, even at their maximum ANC setting, allow quite a lot of high-frequency noise through that the Zen cancel. This was quite noticeable and annoying while vacuuming the house. I expect better from a flagship product of a well-known brand such as Harman/JBL. If I hadn't gotten them at the Cyber Monday discount with the help of a gift card that covered half the cost I would definitely be returning them and getting something else.I have read elsewhere that the Tour Pro 3's 360 Spatial Audio is also lackluster, but having nothing to compare it to, I can't say much about it. Head tracking seems to work as expected when enabled, moving sounds from center to left or right as I  move my head, but the spatial effect is minimal for me. I'm one of those for whom headphones and earbuds nearly exclusively produce sound that seems to come from inside my head on a line between my ears. Without head tracking, the Tour Pro 3's spatial audio adds fullness and extension so sounds hard-panned left and right (or nearly so) seem to come from outside my head, and those from nearer the center of the stereo image seem to be slightly forward and less sharply defined, but still inside my head. Using headphones or earbuds, I've never heard any effect that made the sounds seem to emanate realistically from somewhere in front of me. It's likely that I never will, just because of how my ears and brain are.Verdict: I'll keep them, but if I had known in advance how weak the Tour Pro 3's ANC was, I would have chosen another brand & model.

product: JBL Quantum TWS AIR
review_text: First Thing: UPDATE these ear buds. You need to do it TWICE! Get the JBL app for your phone and software update the buds, then get the JBL Quantum Engine App for PC (or Mac) and do the firmware update. Before the updates I could only get one bud/channel to work with Android using the dongle, and after the updates both buds work. So far I have tested the USB-C Dongle with PC, Steam Deck, iPad, and Android - it works well with all devices listed providing low latency, and high(er) fidelity, sound. I tested multiple games on Steam Deck, including Hi-Fi Rush (a rhythm game), and had no latency issues. The Dongle is true plug and play (no setup needed) on every device except PC. Plugging in the USB-C Dongle prompted a download of Quantum Engine, and inside the QE app you can set EQ and tweak the Surround Sound settings. I tested the buds in Battlefield V on PC and the surround sound worked well. Adjusting the EQ in the QE app on PC is easy and necessary in order to get the most pleasing sound. The only device I‚Äôm using Bluetooth with is my Android phone and the sound is fine - use the JBL app to adjust the EQ. The Android App offers a FULL EQ, not the typical/lame EQ for dummies a lot of ear bud devices ship with.I‚Äôve only had the JBL Quantum TWS Airs (that name lol) for a short time, so I can‚Äôt offer a comprehensive review yet. I will say they are very light and fit well in my ears. There is no wing, or stabilizer, so these might not be great for active on-the-go situations. The stock EQ needed a tweak for my ears, and the Apps make that easy. The sound quality via the USB-C Dongle is a noticeable upgrade in terms of latency and fidelity. These are better for music than I anticipated, and from reviews I read this is one of the big differences from the more expensive, and older version, of this line of Quantum TWS buds. Battery life is much shorter using the Dongle, and that makes sense as the low latency signal is more power hungry than Bluetooth. I spent some time looking for low latency wireless ear buds and this is one the most affordable options out there ($40 on sale). Hopefully in time more companies will offer similar low latency earbuds, or maybe Bluetooth will get good enough to make a product like this irrelevant.

product: JBL Quantum TWS AIR
review_text: Got these for $50 new in box marked as "used". The sound quality is great. I use them for the gym and for gaming. Im very competitive so im sensitive to latency and these have none that i can notice. They do get uncomfortable after long gaming sessions but most earbuds do that in my ears. Battery life could be better. They last around 4-5 hours with ANC enabled, with it off I'm not sure but definitely a lot longer than 5 hrs. They also look nice, not gamery or bulky.

product: JBL Quantum TWS AIR
review_text: They have an excellent sound quality, the ANC works pretty well and it's also adaptative, I'm not a fan of a talk-through function I think it's best to just pause your music.The headphones are pretty comfortable and fit perfectly for my ear, the battery life is very good too. The case is a little too big for carrying it on a pocket but still can fit. It charges pretty fast too and I appreciate that.The voice assistant is very useful, it can read and answer message and read u all your notifications. Also control smart home devices which I use a lot.Only problem with it is that the dongle doesn't work very well with other smartphones or tablets, I read that the Pc firmware update can fix that but my Pc doesn't have a usb-c port and I haven't been able to buy an adapter (and it can't connect to the pc app by Bluetooth for some reason).Definitely a good purchase still just for it's in-app customization, voice assistant features and sound quality.

product: JBL Quantum TWS AIR
review_text: So I bought these earbuds on discount for $75 on Black Friday, and I want to share some thoughts I have about this thing.1. It's not exactly perfectly low latency. I play rhythm games a lot, and I do notice a slight amount of latency even with the "low latency" dongle mode. I've tried disabling any audio processing on Windows, but it's still the same. The latency is fairly low given that it's wireless. You'll be hard pressed to notice for other games like Valorant, but there's just a touch of latency which prevents me from using it for rhythm games in particular.2. Audio is pretty good. Very bass heavy as you'd expect, but there is an EQ so you can change it around. Once you balance it out with the EQ I think the audio quality is quite exceptional for these buds.3. Battery life is mid. When you use it in low-latency mode the battery dies in around 3-4 hours without ANC or processing. Probably take off an hour if you had it on. The bluetooth mode lasts for much longer, I'd peg it around 6 hours (although I've never fully drained it in bluetooth yet).4. Charging is fairly fast for both the case and the earbuds.5. There are some strange audio artifacts (glitching and occasionally choppy audio) with the dongle. This happens very occasionally, and I've tried disabling interference like from Wi-Fi and other 2.4Ghz accessories but it still occurs.6. I think the touch controls are hard to learn. The one for switching modes is fairly straightforward, but pairing, switching, and learning play/pause is not intuitive.7. Noise cancellation is quite weak compared to many other earbuds on the market, similar with the "transparency mode" on these things. Talk-thru actually is OK, but sounds artificial and you can definitely tell the noise from outside is piped in.8. They sit comfortably in the ears and don't feel like they're gonna fall out. However, at least for me, they get uncomfortable over like 1 hour of wearing.Overall, given the discounted $75 price I think they're a great pair of buds, better than other $99 Bluetooth buds on the market. At the original $150, there are much better options (without low latency dongle).And gamers beware, if you are planning to use these for latency critical audio tasks, these are NOT for you. Stick to wired or look for something else. These get quite close but I still notice a tad bit of audio latency.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: Very comfortable, decent noise cancelling, both ear bud & case batteries last better than my last pair of Sony earbuds. I do not have excellent ears, age, heredity, and industrial noise have seen to that, so the highs are probably wasted on me, but I have enjoyed the excellent image these buds create; I have a favorite recording of Handel's "Messiah", and it's easy to "see" where each soloist and group of singers, along with the parts of the orchestra are arranged, like you would at a live performance. As one group sings, then another one comes in you can hear the source coming from another area. The earbuds do work themselves out from time to time, but give warning & are easy to reposition. My last pair was the best Sony model, which I lost one of. I didn't want to drop another $250 , so I bought these. Now I never will. Tremendous value, with no indication of being cheap. One tiny issue: when dropped from waist high or higher onto a hard surface , the case invariably pops open and ejects both earbuds several feet. My fault, of course, but just saying. 10 month update: quality continues; sound is excellent & both earbud and holder batteries continue to last and last.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: These earbuds sound awesome! The features are great! They are a bit bulky and it took me awhile to get them to fit and I was actually wearing them wrong to begin with, you‚Äôre supposed to put them in your ear and then turn them to the left to screw them into your ears and after I did that they fit so much better. The touch controls work great and I like how you can adjust the controls for your own liking on the app. I use these at work and I can hear everything going on around me as well as what I‚Äôm listening to with the ambient aware which is amazing to me. Definitely a lot of features for the money and the battery actually last about 10 hours! I have these connected to my iPhone 17 and they connect fast every time and Siri works just fine as well. The only con is that they are a bit bulky and I do have to adjust them at times but not a big deal to me.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: I bought these earbuds and simply use them everyday. I find the battery durability satisfactory, as well as the charging time. I think it might take less than 30 minutes to charge completely. I had to change for the small eartips because the medium ones kept popping off, but nevertheless I find them comfortable in my ears. For me, the sound is pretty good and also the noise cancelling.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: I ordered these to replace a set of cheaper buds that I'd used for several years. Overall I'm satisfied but not thrilled.As noted in other reviews, these are pretty difficult to put back into the case. You have to orient them just right and I find myself fumbling with them alot to get them in.Sound quality is acceptable, although they sound a little 'tinny' to me. The EQ gives some help, but I still have some work to get them to warm up. Maybe they'll be better after breaking in for a while.My biggest complaint is probably the noise reduction. It works a little, but I can still hear alot of what's going on around me. I was hoping for it to be more effective.I will probably keep them, but if I had more flexibility I'd probably shop around a bit more. I expected more for the price.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: Very comfortable, I use the small tips and so far they haven‚Äôt tried to fall out when I shake my head around. I love the customization of the audio in the JBL app üò´üò´ and they sound AMAZING. Usually earbuds hurt my ears especially the original AirPod style but these are very comfortable so far. The microphone sounds a little echoey but it‚Äôs still the best microphone I‚Äôve ever personally had on a wireless earbud. You can connect Siri and Alexa to the gestures as well.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: Pros:Reputation Brand NameGood sound with JBL Headphone appPlenty of bass with JBL Headphone appCONS:FitBluetooth disconnectsI purchased these after mt galaxy bud 2 died, due to one bud falling out into my pool last year then finally died about a month ago.My primary use for ear buds is listening to music while doing yard work (mowing, weed eating, edging) and during pool maintenance (brushing the walls and vacuuming).When I first received these, I downloaded the app and they paired nicely with no issues. Capsule charge was at 75% while both buds were at 100%.Next I tried placing them in my ears. When i placed them in my ears and turn them counterclockwise the weren't very comfortable and felt loose like they were going to fall out, however they did say in place when i tilted my head to either side and shook my head. These earbuds are supplied additional ear cushions. I tried the bigger ones and for my ears these were too big for my ear canal and would not stay in very well. I tried the smaller ones and these wouldn't hold in place. I'd like to say they were like Goldilocks and the 3 bears, but none were just right. The closest for me were the medium size, but I still didn't trust them staying in while doing yard work.Today was the first day I've had to really put them to the test. I place them in and fiddle with them for a bit to get a "snug" fit. The only way I could achieve this was by turning them so that the J in the JBL logo was at about a 180 degrees facing upwards.I started Spotify and proceeded to start the yard work. I noticed myself constantly fiddling with the earbud, because the kept feeling like the were going to fall out, enough so that I kept activating the voice pass through.After about a hour and a half into the yard work I was met with a bluetooth disconnected message. When I looked at my phone (Samsung galaxy s23 ultra) it showed bluetooth was enabled and the buds were paired. I started Spotify again and the music resumed. So I was like ok????I did about another 2 hrs of yard work and they stayed connected, but I still constantly felt they were going to fall out.With today's experience, I will not be using these near my poolWould I recommend these to a friend? Probably notDo i think these were worth what I paid for them? No, with the fit issue, these should cost closer to $19.99

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: Amazing pair of earphones. The noise canceling is pretty good, but the battery life is the most impressive. I use it for 4-5 hours of zoom calls everyday, but don‚Äôt have to charge it for almost two weeks. Connects very quickly to both my iPhone and mac. Calls are pretty flawless.‚ÄùTap‚Äù controls are a bit annoying since I can reset or change them only on the app on my phone, whereas I use mostly on my work laptop. Calls were accidentally muted because I tapped on them by mistake.Not used primarily for listening to music, but they sounded pretty decent and base heavy when I did use them for music

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: Best wireless earbuds i‚Äôve ever owned. my friend lent me his pair after I lost my AirPods and I had to buy them after using them for a few days. More comfortable, stay in better, better sound quality, and look better. The only thing AirPods do better the the connecting to your phone. With these you have to get an app and connect them through the app and have use the app for all the features. But that‚Äôs to be expected with non apple products. Other than that, 9.5/10 would recommend.

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: For quality vs price, JBL's Live Pro+ TWS bluetooth earbuds are well worth the cost in my opinion. The sound is great (you can program your own EQ via the app among other options). The battery has a long life. The noise canceling works great. The only negative I've experienced is the noise canceling will occasionally stop working when tilting my head down. I don't know what is causing it at this time (it could be me). Luckily, it can be fixed by using the app to calibrate the fit of the earbuds; however, it can still be an annoyance. Regardless, I'm still loving the product. Recommended.

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: Took these out of the package and had them synced in minutes.  The sound is very good for the price point and the noise cancelling is a bonus.  They fit comfortably in my ear and I have been able to get up to 7 hours of straight listen time.  Compared to other brands I have tried, I would recommend these and would purchase them again for myself.  They make my workday go so much smoother as I can listen to podcasts and/or answer important calls.

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: Love the headsets, I bought them for conference calls and it does a great job with sound quality and noise cancellation, also really, really decent with music specially in quiet settings. It does even better after buying the third party Comply ear foams for this product (True Grip TW-200-C). If  zoom/phone calls or books are your purpose for getting these, it‚Äôs a top notch product much more affordable than Apple‚Äôs earbuds.

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: I love these I can use one or two and they work perfectly I love the sound and call quality! They have great battery life and and gentle on my ears (unlike the hard one that make my ears a little soar after ) I am so happy with my purchase and I would get them again

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: For the price I am very happy. Sure some features don't work as good as other more expensive headphone, but that's why they're more expensive. For what I paid I'm very happy, it connects to many devices with no problems. Only wish the  windows functionality was as good as the android one, but when using on my phone they're wonderful. Loud coworkers are totally silenced if playing music even quietly and the passthrough mode works great.

product: JBL Live PRO+ TWS True Wireless in-Ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: The earbuds are comfortable, fit well on the ears and provide good sound quality. BUT, for some unknown reason the microphone simply does not work. If I connect them for a call, I listen through the earbuds but the active mic is the one from the source device, so the other party hears extremely bad. It happens with Android and Mac, so, no chance to say it is an issue with those devices.I contacted JBL support and they didn't find any solution, so, at the end, I had to return the item back to Amazon.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: A lot of pros with one con.I didn‚Äôt think I had a lot of time for earbuds during the day, so I started off trying a cheap pair. They were $20 or something with 4.8 stars and reviews like, ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt used my Airpods since buying these!‚Äù so I thought that sounded perfect.They sucked. The sound was harsh, they became painful after extended use, noise cancelling was barely noticeable, etc.  I can‚Äôt actually remember all of the problems at this point.  BUT they sold me on the functionality of wireless headphones.Fast-forward to a few months later - it‚Äôs Black Friday and I bite on these because they‚Äôre on sale.  I was a little hesitant because they had a lowly 4.2 stars.  Turns out average reviews aren‚Äôt everything.These are the polar opposite of the highly-reviewed, cheap headphones I tried: they‚Äôre comfortable, and the sound is amazing.  As the title implies, I master audio so this is not a hollow endorsement. The cheap ones had hyped bass, missing mids, and painful presence/treble.  These are very flat and well-performing by comparison, and can be EQ‚Äôd. The noise cancelling is also VERY respectable. I frequently work around loud sources and am sensitive to loud noises, and I have accidentally left these in when I intended to swap for earplugs, because the performance is similar.I love the app. Being able to select between audio quality vs. video sync‚Äôing is awesome when I want to watch live musical performances where sync issues play with your mind. Being able to create custom EQ settings is  very important to me too.The con is that you have to take them out of the case to power them on. It‚Äôs not a huge deal - it‚Äôs easy to pop them in for a split second if they‚Äôve timed out or something.  But there has been one occasion that I ran somewhere and forgot the case.  I intend to live my life without dependence on crap like headphones, so no big deal - take a break.I would normally give something like this 4 stars because that power-on function is a notable miscalculation on JBL‚Äôs part, but it deserves a much better average review than it has so I‚Äôm doing my part to raise it.  In everyday life it‚Äôs not that big of a deal unless you‚Äôre the kind of person who loves to find things to complain about.

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: I bought these on the Black Friday sale and man, I'm so glad I did.  I have several pairs of the lesser Vibes, which sound good, but these blow them out of the water.First, let's address the fitment.  I see many say they don't fit, they fall out, or feel like they're going to fall out.  Don't put the large ear pads on if you don't have large ear canal openings!  This will cause the earbuds to push themselves out.  Too large will push them out, while too small will obviously not have enough to grip your ear.  Test them all to find the right fit, if not, reach out to JBL, I'm sure they have replacement pads of other sizes.  You can also buy them here on Amazon as they're pretty universal.I find pushing them in, and turning them into place, with the proper pads, netted a great seal and no falling out.You HAVE to install the app on your phone; otherwise, you're getting the flat sound your phone manufacturer decided sounded good.  The JBL app is available for Apple and Android - and it makes a massive difference, especially with the noise cancellation and frequency response.With these, I'm hearing songs I've listened to for decades for the first time.  I'm hearing effects and instruments I never heard in the music.  These are that clear.  They also don't kill my ears!  I've tried earbuds from $5 to $300, and while the more expensive ones sounded terrific, they hurt my ears physically.  With these, I get great sound and a great fit with a tremendous battery life.I'm reading a lot of negative reviews where either the fit or the sound is the problem. Most of these would be positive if people were provided with either longer pads so they go a bit further into the ear and more sizes and those with sound complaints would actually install the app.  Mine sounded horrible with the Dolby equalizer baked into Android 13.  Installing the app AND turning off any phone equalizer or sound enhancer was the solution.  I'd definitely buy these again!

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: Great product! The quality of the sound Is pristine and clear and has nice bass to it.The problem: it keeps coming off my ear so I find myself usually adjusting it so the won‚Äôt fall. It does happens more with the left but both ears do it. Thats the only problem honestly. I have an iPhone 13 Pro Max and it syncs well.Ear size: I also change a bigger ear tip so they fit more snug but still after a while they start coming off even though when I rotate it so stays put But that‚Äôs probably also because I‚Äôm working out when that Happens.Battery last a long time!

product: JBL Tune Buds
review_text: Good sounding. Noise canceling is great for the price.  Talk through/passive is very functional. Case and buds put through washer. Then dried at 120*F for 36 hours. No sign of life at all from anything. Plugged in case to charge and everything woke up and works fine now! My ear canals are very small and had to use aftermarket smaller tips but fit well now. If you have to use the small or extra small tips usually just order black so they match aftermarket color ones if you care.Only issue I have is you cant have all the ambient controls, media controls, and volume control its two of the three.

review_text: Great!

product: JBL Vibe 100 TWS True Wireless In-Ear Headphones w/Charging Case
review_text: So first off I bought 2 sets of these I wanna say 2 years ago ish.. maybe a little less I can't remember. One for me one for my husband which later another became mine lol..So i work at gfs a huge warehouse. First tome I dropped one of the ear buds thru the grates I'm the floor.. not just onto the floor 5 storys.. I managed to see where it landed and it's a crane zone so I had to get my boss to get it.. he found it still worked.. a few weeks go buy I fumbled the whole case ear phones and all in the freezer where I work all the time.. I loose one found the other. A week goes buy and one of my friends in janitorial was cleaning mind you another 3 storys.. finds it! I charge it up it still works! Another time samet headphones bc it's got a different color rubber on it bc I lost the one it came with.. I was doing some cleaning in another dept and had a mop bucket next to me full of kinda Nasty water.. not gonna lie. I feel the head phone slip out of my ear.. and I tried to catch it bit instead hand paddled it right into the mop bucket üòÖ I kid you not.. it was in there for a good 10 seconds bc I had to roll up my sleeve to reach in.. I flicked it off dried it with a cloth real good left it in my bag so it could get the monster out before charging it.. and sure as shoot it still works.. but they have become a bit annoying now bc I do work in the freezer below 0 for like 12 hours 5 days a week.. nothing charges in that.. I still use both sets they usually die about 4 hours to 5 hours in and I swap to my husband's old pair lol. But I can't complain with these they have quite a story to tell. üòÖ I do wish they were rated below 0 so they lasted longer but sometimes if they do die I just leave them in they make for great noise canceling with all the fans and belts going it gets loud and when I hear the fans running it makes me even colder so even dead they have there use.The bass is also great.Case could have a cover but they still hold on with Magnet.

product: JBL Vibe 100 TWS True Wireless In-Ear Headphones w/Charging Case
review_text: We have had these for 4 months.  They worked great in the first 2 months.  After that, they are not returnable and now they will not connect to any blue tooth device.  It will not go into pair mode, even after watching a couple how to videos, it still will not go into pair mode.  They are basically useless at this time.The battery life when they worked, was great, the sound was very nice for an ear bud.  I have other JBL headphones, sound bars, and portable devices that work great, but these earbuds are not working as they should have.I'm looking into the factory warranty now and hope they can exchange them, I'm just too late to do that on Amazon's platform.

product: JBL Vibe 100 TWS True Wireless In-Ear Headphones w/Charging Case
review_text: For the price these are great if they fit your ear. product: JBL Vibe 100 TWS True Wireless In-Ear Headphones w/Charging Case
review_text: These ear buds are fantastic and I have zero complaints. Easy to use and stay in my ears throughout the day. I have at least one in 5 days a week all day. I love the quality for the price.

product: JBL LIVE PRO+ TWS True Wireless In-ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones

I use it for 4-5 hours of zoom calls everyday, but don‚Äôt have to charge it for almost two weeks. Connects very quickly to both my iPhone and mac. review_text: For quality vs price, JBL's Live Pro+ TWS bluetooth earbuds are well worth the cost in my opinion. The sound is great (you can program your own EQ via the app among other options). I don't know what is causing it at this time (it could be me). Luckily, it can be fixed by using the app to calibrate the fit of the earbuds; however, it can still be an annoyance. Regardless, I'm still loving the product. Recommended.

product: JBL LIVE PRO+ TWS True Wireless In-ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones

Compared to other brands I have tried, I would recommend these and would purchase them again for myself.  They make my workday go so much smoother as I can listen to podcasts and/or answer important calls.

review_text: For the price I am very happy. Sure some features don't work as good as other more expensive headphone, but that's why they're more expensive. product: JBL LIVE PRO+ TWS True Wireless In-ear Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Headphones
review_text: The earbuds are comfortable, fit well on the ears and provide good sound quality. BUT, for some unknown reason the microphone simply does not work. If I connect them for a call, I listen through the earbuds but the active mic is the one from the source device, so the other party hears extremely bad. It happens with Android and Mac, so, no chance to say it is an issue with those devices.I contacted JBL support and they didn't find any solution, so, at the end, I had to return the item back to Amazon.

product: JBL Tour PRO+ TWS True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: These started out at $200, I waited and waited and got them for $100. Worth the wait. These are high-end earbuds for sure. As high end as Bluetooth can be anyway. I believe they are now back up to $200.Initially, when I first used them, the sound seemed low for the sound level I'm accustomed to on other earbuds. But as my ears acclimated to them...or possibly the earbuds burned in...the sound became more involved and I can hear a wider soundstage than with other earbuds.Overall sound is clean, crisp and clear. The bass is strong if you have and can maintain a sufficiently tight seal in the ear. The stock eartips didn't provide a reliable seal so I installed the largest eartips I have from my Panasonic RZ-S500W earbuds. That did the trick. Reliable seal and they fit in the JBL charging case.The charging case is a little on the large side, but it's still okay. Excellent build quality. Battery life so far on the buds and case are great. But I rarely use earbuds longer than 3 hours so BL isn't much of a concern to me.For reference, I have or have had the earbuds listed below. I will say that I am favoring these JBL earbuds over all of them but my Master & Dynamic MW-07. But I grab these more often because the M&D earbuds don't last more than 2.5 hours battery life. And at about 1.5 hours they produce a warning sound that repeats every so often. Nevertheless, the M&D sound quality is among the best I've ever heard.[Ranked ONLY for sound quality from best to worst]Master & Dynamic MW-07Technics EAH-AZ70W (Best ANC and exceptional sound quality, but battery depletes while powered off)JBL Tour PRO+Technics EAH-AZ60Sony WF-1000XM4 (Bought for "World leading ANC". Returned. Their ANC wasn't better than the Technics EAH-AZ70W and their sound wasn't exceptional enough)Sony LinkBuds SJBL Live FreeNC+ (very small, nicely compact case, but limited custom eartip selection that will fit in the case)Moondrop SparksPanasonic RZ-S500WSennheiser CXSennheiser CX 400BT

product: JBL Tour PRO+ TWS True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I have been very eager to try these, and after losing my beloved Samsung pros, I decided I had to buy! Comparatively on price, these match to many top name brand earbuds on the market, however they blow the competition out of the water! Other than a having a hard time finding a comfortable fitment for my smaller ears, as these buds are bigger than most, the pros of this product outweigh everything negative by miles!The sound quality is unparalleled for the price, with an insane immersive audio, that can be fully adjusted and controlled from the app!The easy to operate touch controls are not overly sensitive, preventing that annoying accidental command. product: JBL Tour PRO+ TWS True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds

product: JBL Tour PRO+ TWS True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds

product: JBL Tour PRO+ TWS True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I bought these to connect to my computer for work from home.  They would not stay connected to a laptop...any laptop.  I tried several and the buds would just disconnect from them.  I called jbl who then said it is a computer problem because they would connect to my phone so I decided to try to use them with my phone because they were not cheap.  I know they are nowhere near the cost of the gold standard option but for my budget they are not cheap.  Here is the process to using them.  First, moisten the rubber pads by breathing on them.  Then jamb them into your ear until it feels as though you shoved a lit candle into your ear.  Turn on the noise canceling.  This part is essential to block out background noise then crank the sound all the way up.  This is not to jam out to rock,  this is just so that you can hear the audio book you are listening to.  Yeah, I'm that guy that listens to audio books for fun.  Now DO NOT MOVE.  Don't blink, don't look around ot they will jump out of your ears with even minor movement.  Try the different sized earpieces.  It will slightly adjust the heat level of the lit candle and will have no impact on how secure they are in your ears.  Turn off noise canceling and turn on ambient aware and you can hear mumbled conversations the neighbors the next block over are having.  Don't worry about privacy, nothing is clear enough to understand a word.  It is the same with someone conversing with you in the same room.  You get a great impression of Charlie brown listening to a class lecture, only amplified.  The last straw was today when I tried to spare my family of the latest book and only the left bud will connect.  It just so happens you have to have the right bud to do much of anything.  So for the bargain price of about $8 per use I have come to the end of the lifespan of these buds.  Not bad for what a jbl representative assure me is the quality that I should expect.  I will end this 9-month journey by biting the bullet and looking at some samsung buds or maybe a pair of Raycons.

product: JBL VIBE 100 TWS
review_text: Love them. Good sound quality. Can't even remember when I bought them, I've had them for so long. Comfortable for small ears. Have worn in light rain and still sound great. Easy bluetooth connection. Simple control settings. Hold charge for a long time. Worth every penny.

product: JBL VIBE 100 TWS
review_text: Very good earbuds. Good quality nice bass, very comfortable and durable.

product: JBL VIBE 100 TWS

product: JBL VIBE 100 TWS
review_text: All in all I'm not disappointed in purchasing these and I'm not going to tell you to not buy them but just know you kind of get what you pay for The fitment though I know it's subjective at least in my case is not very comfortable especially in my left ear they feel rather sharp like they're cutting into my ears.The volume isn't very loud probably loud enough for most people but I like my music a little louder these are not audio file headphones but they are kind of fun to listen to they've got the bog standard Bluetooth headphones equalizer setup heavy base The mids are toned down quite a bit and enough treble. Bottom line they work fine for activities like mowing the lawn waiting for a bus to arrive or canceling out loud noise during demo work I've actually used them as earplugs a couple of times they're not waterproof.Dropping them more than not ends up with one of the headphones flying across the floor as there is no lid on the case I get it it's part of the design but it's a little annoying I find that the case will only charge them about 1 and 1/2 times before the case is dead which can be a little annoying as well I do like the type c charger port on the case but other than that they're pretty much the bog standard cheap earbuds we've all come to know.One final thing again this might just be my weird ears but they don't seem to stay in very well especially the left ear.

product: JBL VIBE 100 TWS

product: JBL VIBE 100 TWS
review_text: Even tho I only had these for a month before I lost the case.  These were good.  Sound was good.  When answering phone calls it was clear.

product: JBL Quantum TWS
review_text: First Thing: UPDATE these ear buds. You need to do it TWICE! Get the JBL app for your phone and software update the buds, then get the JBL Quantum Engine App for PC (or Mac) and do the firmware update. Before the updates I could only get one bud/channel to work with Android using the dongle, and after the updates both buds work. So far I have tested the USB-C Dongle with PC, Steam Deck, iPad, and Android - it works well with all devices listed providing low latency, and high(er) fidelity, sound. I tested multiple games on Steam Deck, including Hi-Fi Rush (a rhythm game), and had no latency issues. The Dongle is true plug and play (no setup needed) on every device except PC. Plugging in the USB-C Dongle prompted a download of Quantum Engine, and inside the QE app you can set EQ and tweak the Surround Sound settings. I tested the buds in Battlefield V on PC and the surround sound worked well. Adjusting the EQ in the QE app on PC is easy and necessary in order to get the most pleasing sound. The only device I‚Äôm using Bluetooth with is my Android phone and the sound is fine - use the JBL app to adjust the EQ. The Android App offers a FULL EQ, not the typical/lame EQ for dummies a lot of ear bud devices ship with.I‚Äôve only had the JBL Quantum TWS Airs (that name lol) for a short time, so I can‚Äôt offer a comprehensive review yet. I will say they are very light and fit well in my ears. There is no wing, or stabilizer, so these might not be great for active on-the-go situations. The stock EQ needed a tweak for my ears, and the Apps make that easy. The sound quality via the USB-C Dongle is a noticeable upgrade in terms of latency and fidelity. These are better for music than I anticipated, and from reviews I read this is one of the big differences from the more expensive, and older version, of this line of Quantum TWS buds. Battery life is much shorter using the Dongle, and that makes sense as the low latency signal is more power hungry than Bluetooth. I spent some time looking for low latency wireless ear buds and this is one the most affordable options out there ($40 on sale). Hopefully in time more companies will offer similar low latency earbuds, or maybe Bluetooth will get good enough to make a product like this irrelevant.

product: JBL Quantum TWS
review_text: Got these for $50 new in box marked as "used". The sound quality is great. I use them for the gym and for gaming. Im very competitive so im sensitive to latency and these have none that i can notice. They do get uncomfortable after long gaming sessions but most earbuds do that in my ears. Battery life could be better. They last around 4-5 hours with ANC enabled, with it off I'm not sure but definitely a lot longer than 5 hrs. They also look nice, not gamery or bulky.

product: JBL Quantum TWS
review_text: They have an excellent sound quality, the ANC works pretty well and it's also adaptative, I'm not a fan of a talk-through function I think it's best to just pause your music.The headphones are pretty comfortable and fit perfectly for my ear, the battery life is very good too. The case is a little too big for carrying it on a pocket but still can fit. It charges pretty fast too and I appreciate that.The voice assistant is very useful, it can read and answer message and read u all your notifications. Also control smart home devices which I use a lot.Only problem with it is that the dongle doesn't work very well with other smartphones or tablets, I read that the Pc firmware update can fix that but my Pc doesn't have a usb-c port and I haven't been able to buy an adapter (and it can't connect to the pc app by Bluetooth for some reason).Definitely a good purchase still just for it's in-app customization, voice assistant features and sound quality.

product: JBL Quantum TWS
review_text: So I bought these earbuds on discount for $75 on Black Friday, and I want to share some thoughts I have about this thing.1. It's not exactly perfectly low latency. I play rhythm games a lot, and I do notice a slight amount of latency even with the "low latency" dongle mode. I've tried disabling any audio processing on Windows, but it's still the same. The latency is fairly low given that it's wireless. You'll be hard pressed to notice for other games like Valorant, but there's just a touch of latency which prevents me from using it for rhythm games in particular.2. Audio is pretty good. Very bass heavy as you'd expect, but there is an EQ so you can change it around. Once you balance it out with the EQ I think the audio quality is quite exceptional for these buds.3. Battery life is mid. When you use it in low-latency mode the battery dies in around 3-4 hours without ANC or processing. Probably take off an hour if you had it on. The bluetooth mode lasts for much longer, I'd peg it around 6 hours (although I've never fully drained it in bluetooth yet).4. Charging is fairly fast for both the case and the earbuds.5. There are some strange audio artifacts (glitching and occasionally choppy audio) with the dongle. This happens very occasionally, and I've tried disabling interference like from Wi-Fi and other 2.4Ghz accessories but it still occurs.6. I think the touch controls are hard to learn. The one for switching modes is fairly straightforward, but pairing, switching, and learning play/pause is not intuitive.7. Noise cancellation is quite weak compared to many other earbuds on the market, similar with the "transparency mode" on these things. Talk-thru actually is OK, but sounds artificial and you can definitely tell the noise from outside is piped in.8. They sit comfortably in the ears and don't feel like they're gonna fall out. However, at least for me, they get uncomfortable over like 1 hour of wearing.Overall, given the discounted $75 price I think they're a great pair of buds, better than other $99 Bluetooth buds on the market. At the original $150, there are much better options (without low latency dongle).And gamers beware, if you are planning to use these for latency critical audio tasks, these are NOT for you. Stick to wired or look for something else. These get quite close but I still notice a tad bit of audio latency.

product: JBL Tune 130NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: These earbuds exceeded my expectations! The sound is super clear, the bass is strong without being too much, and the noise-canceling works surprisingly well. They‚Äôre comfortable for long use and the battery lasts a lot. Totally worth it.

product: JBL Tune 130NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: these earbuds are very dependable and after having had my previous earbuds (AirPods (the older kind)) start to break after a few months, these earbuds have been a godsend. They are way easier to fit into ears and they come with multiple different size plugs. They cost around the same and have way better, audio quality, they also are more user-friendly. The battery life is amazing way better than my phone probably could last a solid week before having to recharge the case and the battery isn‚Äôt even that diminished if I fall asleep and I‚Äôm listening for around 12 hours. I definitely recommend this product because the battery life is amazing. They connect super easily. They are super comfortable and the side buttons are a lot more understandable Than any earbuds I‚Äôve used before. I feel there a lot more durable as well. I also think that the noise canceling is better than my Sony Wireless noise canceling headphones and that is saying a bunch.sorry for the super long review.

product: JBL Tune 130NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: I bought these to help filter out noise at the office generally for music listening. I will split the review into three section: Noise Cancelling, Sound Quality, and Other.Noise Cancelling:They will work for some people but not all. At the home office they work great, they filter out the frequency of noise produced by computer fans. However, I don't believe the noise cancelling is all that adaptive, rather it is just filtering a fixed number of frequencies. For example, the higher frequency noise from my air purifier is still noticeable, but dampened. This seems to be the case with all noise. I would expect their algorithm is doing something like filtering out the average frequencies in the average environment so overall you do indeed get a quieter listening experience.  Ã∂IÃ∂ Ã∂fÃ∂iÃ∂nÃ∂dÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂hÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂"Ã∂AÃ∂mÃ∂bÃ∂iÃ∂eÃ∂nÃ∂tÃ∂ Ã∂AÃ∂wÃ∂aÃ∂rÃ∂eÃ∂"Ã∂ Ã∂sÃ∂eÃ∂tÃ∂tÃ∂iÃ∂nÃ∂gÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂oÃ∂ Ã∂bÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂hÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂qÃ∂uÃ∂iÃ∂eÃ∂tÃ∂eÃ∂sÃ∂tÃ∂.Ã∂  (UPDATE: Meant to say ANC (duh) slightly confusing what mode I was in based off of the quick start manual. Ambient would be if you wanted to hear more than if the ANC was just off.) For the price this is very acceptable. The more adaptable, on the fly noise cancelling algorithms are extremely difficult to implement, and hence you pay a premium for them. Overall, I would compare these to a really good pair of foam tip IEMs in terms of noise cancellation. These will definitely not provide any hearing protection for things like shooting, loud shop work, etc... so keep that in mind and use your head.Sound Quality:These are definitely a "consumer  grade" listening experience, which for most people won't be a bad thing. For the price I am indifferent. I would say the bass is higher than normal with more muted/muddy treble. This isn't necessarily a bad thing and I would say most people would find them "good".  For what they cost, the sound exactly like what I would expect, better than a 20 dollar pair of headphones and not as good as a $150 dollar pair of IEMs, but your mileage may vary. For comparison with a competitor, I have some Sony wf-c500 wireless earbuds (no ANC) and these sound roughly the same, maybe slightly less clear treble and bass. I would still pick these over the Sony's because these have more features for the price and for other reasons I will list below.Other:Battery -- I think the battery life specs are roughly accurate, I get a full day on them, but haven't really pushed them to the 40 hours though. Battery life seems great, the case seems to get you maybe 2 charges. The case is nothing special, I wish the hinge had more tension in it like the Sony's so it felt more premium, I can kind of wiggle it a little bit but definitely not a deal breaker. I have yet to run them to the point where they alert you if they are low just once or they keep doing it. If they keep doing it I will update and remove a star because I don't quite understand why you would annoy the user with a message consistently for the last X% of battery (original rating is 4 stars).Size and Eartips -- these are rather large, but acceptable given the price and feature set.  They don't fit in the ear as well as the Sony ones do but they don't seem to fall out either. The Sony design fits into the ear better and "hugs" it so to speak, they seal better as well. I do really wish these came with a set of foam tips, they would actually compete in a different price bracket for that much, mainly because of the noise reduction. They would also help the fit. The included silicon ear tips are like the cheapest on the market, not as supple as more premium earbuds. There's nothing inherently wrong with them but they may rip after a while. I think if JBL addressed the fit (decrease the depth of the "body" in the ear so they seal better since there would be  less weight pulling down on the eartip) and eartips they'd have an extremely solid 50 dollar pair of earbuds.Controls -  Ã∂UÃ∂nÃ∂lÃ∂eÃ∂sÃ∂sÃ∂ Ã∂IÃ∂'Ã∂mÃ∂ Ã∂mÃ∂iÃ∂sÃ∂sÃ∂iÃ∂nÃ∂gÃ∂ Ã∂iÃ∂tÃ∂,Ã∂ Ã∂IÃ∂ Ã∂dÃ∂iÃ∂sÃ∂lÃ∂iÃ∂kÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂hÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂cÃ∂oÃ∂nÃ∂tÃ∂rÃ∂oÃ∂lÃ∂sÃ∂ Ã∂dÃ∂oÃ∂ Ã∂nÃ∂oÃ∂tÃ∂ Ã∂hÃ∂aÃ∂vÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂vÃ∂oÃ∂lÃ∂uÃ∂mÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂aÃ∂dÃ∂jÃ∂uÃ∂sÃ∂tÃ∂mÃ∂eÃ∂nÃ∂tÃ∂,Ã∂ Ã∂mÃ∂aÃ∂sÃ∂sÃ∂iÃ∂vÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂mÃ∂iÃ∂sÃ∂pÃ∂lÃ∂aÃ∂yÃ∂ Ã∂fÃ∂rÃ∂oÃ∂mÃ∂ Ã∂JÃ∂BÃ∂LÃ∂,Ã∂ Ã∂lÃ∂oÃ∂oÃ∂sÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂aÃ∂ Ã∂sÃ∂tÃ∂aÃ∂rÃ∂ Ã∂fÃ∂oÃ∂rÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂hÃ∂iÃ∂sÃ∂.Ã∂ Ã∂IÃ∂ Ã∂dÃ∂oÃ∂ Ã∂nÃ∂oÃ∂tÃ∂ Ã∂wÃ∂aÃ∂nÃ∂tÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂oÃ∂ Ã∂hÃ∂aÃ∂vÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂oÃ∂ Ã∂iÃ∂nÃ∂vÃ∂oÃ∂kÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂aÃ∂nÃ∂ Ã∂aÃ∂sÃ∂sÃ∂iÃ∂sÃ∂tÃ∂aÃ∂nÃ∂tÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂oÃ∂ Ã∂rÃ∂aÃ∂iÃ∂sÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂tÃ∂hÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂vÃ∂oÃ∂lÃ∂uÃ∂mÃ∂eÃ∂.Ã∂ Ã∂TÃ∂hÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂SÃ∂oÃ∂nÃ∂yÃ∂ Ã∂eÃ∂aÃ∂rÃ∂bÃ∂uÃ∂dÃ∂sÃ∂ Ã∂dÃ∂oÃ∂ Ã∂hÃ∂aÃ∂vÃ∂eÃ∂ Ã∂vÃ∂oÃ∂lÃ∂uÃ∂mÃ∂eÃ∂;Ã∂ Ã∂hÃ∂oÃ∂wÃ∂eÃ∂vÃ∂eÃ∂rÃ∂,Ã∂ Ã∂  (UPDATE: Volume controls can be added through the app as a functionality; however, you loose the ability to change noise modes. I'm still rating 4 stars because I want both, would put 4.5 but can't. I don't see why both sides need a long press for google assistant or siri, one of these long presses could change the noise mode.) I would still pick the JBL buds because the volume steps are more gradual. I can get these to a comfortable level where with the Sony ones it always either a little too loud or a little too quiet. Other than volume I love that the controls are capacitive. Sony opted for actual push buttons in theirs which makes them unusable when laying on your side or for example working on your car, as you constantly bumping/pushing the buttons inadvertently in both cases -- so big win for the JBLs.Overall, a quality earbud for the price but improvements could be made, not sure you can find a more feature rich earbud for this price.

product: JBL Tune 130NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: The JBL Tune 13ONC TWS earbuds deliver impressive audio quality with rich bass and clear mids. The Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) works well for blocking out ambient noise, making them great for commuting or working in busy environments.They fit comfortably and securely, with a compact, lightweight design. Battery life is solid, offering around 6 hours per charge plus additional charges from the case.The touch controls are intuitive and responsive, though sometimes a bit sensitive. Overall, they offer great value for wireless earbuds in this price range.Highly recommend for anyone looking for affordable ANC true wireless earbuds!

product: JBL Tune 130NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: The sound quality is great. But the constant falling out, constant connection issues and troubleshooting (oh my god how much of my life I wasted getting these to reconnect), the not charging when I put them in the case, the constant pausing of my music because my hair touches the sensitive sensor while playing basketball. Just a headache that I constantly kept trying to ignore. I'm done with these. For casual listening, they are great. For active listening, heck no.

product: JBL Tune 130NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: I had a refurbished pair of JBL Reflect Mini NC earbuds that died on me. So I bought these as a replacement. At the time I only paid 50 bucks because of a sale.Overall they are great at that price point. They are made out of plastic so they do feel a little cheap. But so far I have not had any issues with durability. The fit is surprisingly comfortable and they don‚Äôt slip out of my ear. Sound overall is solid. They have decent bass and a pretty balanced sound. Better than my old beats but not quite as clear as my previous JBL. Battery life is great for me, they have not died while using them. And the case holds an enough charge for a couple days, sometimes even a week.Overall, if I paid full price I wouldn‚Äôt be upset. The noise canceling helps but is not full cancellation. And they do not auto pause when I take them out of my ears. Both features I wish were better at a 100 price point.But for 50 bucks they have been excellent.

product: JLab Go Air Tones+ True Wireless Earbuds Designed with Auto On and Connect
review_text: The JLab Go Air Pop+ true wireless earbuds offer a solid balance between affordability and performance. They feature Bluetooth connectivity, a built-in microphone, and up to 35 hours of total battery life with the USB-C charging case. The earbuds deliver customizable EQ3 sound settings and dual connection support, making them convenient for everyday use. With a comfortable in-ear design, stylish color options, and a high customer rating, they are a reliable choice for users looking for quality wireless earbuds at a reasonable price.

product: JLab Go Air Tones+ True Wireless Earbuds Designed with Auto On and Connect
review_text: ...i don't know how these are only $20.  the sound quality is great for the price, but even more broadly, the VALUE IS THERE!  i have used exclusively airpods for the last five or so years, so much so that i kinda forgot that other options exist.  i was here, with one broken airpod (thanks to my dog--he's a good boy who doesn't chew on things but decided my airpod that unknowingly fell out of my pocket looked tasty, i guess?).  this stuck me only using the left one while i "saved up" somehow--during the holidays--for a new pair of pros.  after a week or two of using the one, it kinda dawned on me that, wait, there's more out there than just airpods lol.  my man watches a ton of tech stuff on youtube, so it's not like i was unaware, it just didn't click FOR ME that there is more out there that i could actually use!  once he turned me into an Apple girlie, i said there was no going back.  and we all know nothing works as well with Apple than more Apple, right?  it's true; the immediate connectivity and seamless pairing of airpods is unmatched.  i won't sit and pretend that's not true.  but these are a close second, as far as i can tell.  i don't listen to music at home very often, especially not in earbuds; i'm usually listening to news, podcasts, reactions, etc.  so i'm not looking for amazing sound quality by any means.  BUT THESE HAVE IT!  i put on TPAB to check and YEAH, THESE ARE GREAT!  the familiar songs i know so well weren't lost to some cheap engineering or budget components.  but for my normal use case scenario--listening to political news on a low volume while i'm working from home, listening to hip-hop media while cleaning the kitchen, or listening to reddit stories to drown out my man's snoring on those extra-loud nights, these are phenomenal.  also EXTREMELY comfortable.  i love the skin-tones they came out with, too.  that's so frickin cute and thoughtful that i had to get a pair in my own skintone even though i'm more of a white/black girlie.  it's so nice to have them blend in rather than be this white, obvious thing in my ear.  i LOVE the app--it shows the battery level, lets you check for updates MANUALLY, but also has an equalizer, CUSTOM TOUCH CONTROLS!!!!!!!!! which i of course used to mimic the touch control of airpods just for ease of use, allows you to even set a volume limit to protect your ears.  also comes with some built-in ambient noises which i am a big fan of.  and the awareness feature -- i am assuming this is maybe for people who go on walks???  or, like me, wear them a lot but still have conversations here and there.  i'm so super impressed with these LITERALLY TWENTY DOLLAR earbuds, i can't say it enough!!!i want to state that i am in no way compensated for this review, nor is this one of the increasingly-common AI-generated reviews you'll see on this platform, i am just genuinely so surprised by the quality and the comfort of these.  i think these are an amazing, affordable option for anyone who is ready to burst out of their expensive Apple comfort zone, or on a budget trying to save up for something they think is "nicer" (trust me...you might change your mind on that part).  these would make a wonderful gift for teens who lose things (i know all too well), or even just to have around as a backup pair.  if i were still working in an office, i'd probably buy another to keep in my desk.  they're THAT GOOD.still TBD is how well they work with a PC -- i've only used them with my phone, so far.  if i decide to try that out, i'll come back to update :)

product: JLab Go Air Tones+ True Wireless Earbuds Designed with Auto On and Connect
review_text: I bought this pair of earbuds on sale for a very reasonable price, thinking that if it does not work out as expected, I would not be too upset about it.  But to my surprise, this pair of earbuds works really well, and the sound quality is solid.  The earbuds pack with operating features that are responsive.  The device connects to my phone right away and stay connected throughout my workout.  The pair of earbuds feel relatively comfortable to wear and fits snuggly in my ear canal.  The device stayed securely in my ears most of my workout routine, but there were a few occasions I had to adjust the fitting as I felt the device slipping out of ear.  I find it useful that the device comes with a very short built-in usb-c female charging cable that tucks underneath the charging case where I do not need to carry around a charging cable and comes with multiple silicone ear tips to make the device fit to my ear canal size.  I also like the "aware" feature that amplifies the surrounding sounds to make me aware of what is around me, especially when I am riding a bike on a busy street.  One thing I was not too thrilled about was the effort it takes to remove the earpiece out of the case.  Some reason I had hard time getting a good grip on the earpiece to remove it out of box, especially when the two earpieces are together in the case.  Perhaps it is my poor grip or the slippery material of the earpiece, but it took a lot more effort than I expected to remove the earpieces.  Other than that, this product offers good quality sound at a reasonable price.  The question is... how long the battery will last....

product: JLab Go Air Tones+ True Wireless Earbuds Designed with Auto On and Connect
review_text: I‚Äôve been using the JLab Go Air Pop+ earbuds for about two months now, and overall I‚Äôm really impressed with what you get for the price.First off, the sound quality is very decent for budget true wireless earbuds. They‚Äôre not meant to compete with premium models, but for everyday listening‚Äîmusic, videos, and calls‚Äîthey sound clear and punchy. The EQ3 settings are a nice bonus and actually make a noticeable difference depending on what you‚Äôre listening to. The mic is not bad.. whoever I'm talking to can hear me but there's no noise canceling at all which can be annoying if you're in a noisy environment.Battery life is another strong point. I don‚Äôt find myself charging these often, and they easily last through multiple days of casual use. The dual connect feature is convenient too, especially if you want to use just one earbud at a time.There‚Äôs no active noise canceling, but that‚Äôs expected at this price point, and honestly I didn‚Äôt miss it. Passive isolation is fine for normal use.My only minor complaint is the built-in USB-C charging cable. It works, but it‚Äôs a bit annoying having to plug the case directly into an adapter instead of using a separate cable. Not a dealbreaker, just something to be aware of. Also the touch controls are a bit finicky and you have to learn the gestures for left and right buds separately.Overall, these are a great option if you‚Äôre looking for affordable, reliable earbuds with good sound and excellent battery life. I‚Äôd definitely recommend them to anyone who wants solid performance without spending a lot.

product: JLab Go Air Pop+ Tones True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I bought this pair of earbuds on sale for a very reasonable price, thinking that if it does not work out as expected, I would not be too upset about it.  But to my surprise, this pair of earbuds works really well, and the sound quality is solid.  The earbuds pack with operating features that are responsive.  The device connects to my phone right away and stay connected throughout my workout.  The pair of earbuds feel relatively comfortable to wear and fits snuggly in my ear canal.  The device stayed securely in my ears most of my workout routine, but there were a few occasions I had to adjust the fitting as I felt the device slipping out of ear. I also like the "aware" feature that amplifies the surrounding sounds to make me aware of what is around me, especially when I am riding a bike on a busy street.  One thing I was not too thrilled about was the effort it takes to remove the earpiece out of the case. Other than that, this product offers good quality sound at a reasonable price.  The question is... how long the battery will last....

Also the touch controls are a bit finicky and you have to learn the gestures for left and right buds separately.Overall, these are a great option if you‚Äôre looking for affordable, reliable earbuds with good sound and excellent battery life. I‚Äôd definitely recommend them to anyone who wants solid performance without spending a lot.

product: LEEMC Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I recently purchased the LEEMC Wireless Earbuds and they have exceeded my expectations, particularly regarding functionality and design.Key Highlights:‚Ä¢ Smart Touch Screen Case: The ability to control noise cancellation settings and monitor battery life directly from the case is incredibly efficient. It eliminates the need to constantly check my phone to manage the earbuds.‚Ä¢ Secure Over-Ear Design: These are perfect for active use. The hooks provide a very stable fit during movement, making them ideal for sports and workouts without the fear of them falling out.‚Ä¢ Performance: The Bluetooth 6.0 connection is stable with no noticeable lag. The noise cancellation (ANC/ENC) performs well in noisy environments, and the bass response is deep and clear.‚Ä¢ Battery Life: With 40 hours of total playtime, they hold a charge significantly longer than many higher-priced competitors.Final Verdict: These offer a premium experience with unique features at a great price point. If you want reliable workout headphones with a high-tech edge, these are a solid choice.

product: LEEMC Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I‚Äôm genuinely blown away by these LEEMC Wireless Earbuds! From the moment I put them on, the fit was secure and comfortable ‚Äî they stay in place even during long workouts and runs. The Bluetooth 5.4 connection is solid and quick to pair with my phone, and I‚Äôve experienced zero dropouts so far.The sound quality is impressive for the price point ‚Äî rich bass, clear highs, and surprisingly good overall balance. I also love the 80+ hour battery life, which means I can go days between charges without any stress. The waterproof rating gives me confidence to wear them during sweaty gym sessions or in light rain.Touch controls are intuitive and responsive, and the LED display on the case is a nice bonus. Overall, these have outperformed my expectations and feel like a much more expensive pair of earbuds. Highly recommend them to anyone looking for reliable, great-sounding wireless earbuds!

product: LEEMC Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I am thrilled to own these earbuds. I‚Äôve lost two Apple AirPods, one on the beach and one while doing yard work. The comfortable silicone ear hooks solve the problem of losing earbuds. The  noise cancellation feature is really nice to have, again at this price point.

product: LEEMC Wireless Earbuds

Battery life has been reliable so far, and the charging case is compact and easy to carry. Overall, a great option for everyday use

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: They sound great, they're very comfortable and don't hurt your ears, and the noise cancellation is awesome! Only drawbacks is the suction piece can turn inside out when removing from ear, and the button can be super sensitive and be affected by your hair.

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: I gave these a good run through and have some thoughts. I'll start with the negatives. First, these do not sound great for music. It doesn't matter how I've EQ'ed them, I could never get the bass to a level I liked. These are mainly heavy on the highs with a lack of detail in the mids. Their sound signature, even after EQ'ing, works well for calls but didn't sound great with music or music-heavy movies. Second, Lenovo doesn't make an app for Android, iOS, macOS, or anything other than Windows. You must download Lenovo's Windows app to update their firmware, adjust settings, and EQ them. Third, their touch controls are limited. There‚Äôs a glossy strip on the earbuds that seem like they‚Äôd be great for volume controls, but they only have basic tap controls that are wonky. Fourth, Atmos sounds terrible. Like every other company that tries to upscale stereo audio to faux surround sound, the results are awful sounding, and I left Atmos off. Lastly, their ANC is on par with $40 earbuds from competing brands. It‚Äôs nice that Lenovo offers ANC, but it isn‚Äôt anything to write home about and it had issues with my space heater, something earbuds from other companies (even at $40) had no issues cancelling out.Despite these negatives, there are a few positives that make these a solid purchase for PC use. They maintain a solid connection to my Lenovo and Dell PCs. I could stay within a 10ft radius without experiencing dropouts or skips, even when in Teams meetings. I didn‚Äôt have anyone complain about microphone quality or other issues. The microphone tech here was able to cancel out the space heater in my office along with other low office noises.Latency was low enough I could watch training videos and other videos without having lip sync delays. My Lenovo has Bluetooth 5.3, but my work-issued Dell system has Bluetooth 5.1 and latency was still low with it. Lenovo‚Äôs app is easy to use once you get it installed, and it always connects to the earbuds without issues. The EQ was easy to adjust from a list of pre-sets or a simple band EQ you can adjust. Like I said, I could never get the bass levels I wanted or clarity in the highs, but having an EQ is better than not (I‚Äôm looking at you, Apple).The case doesn‚Äôt have Qi charging, I wish it would, but USB C charging was quick. These earbuds were getting me about 5 hours of use with ANC on, Lenovo advertises up 7 hours without ANC enabled. Much to my surprise, these earbuds feature wear detection. It‚Äôs a simple light sensor, but it works. Take one earbud out while playing content and it will pause. You can use the earbuds independently as well.Overall, these aren‚Äôt bad if you‚Äôre looking for a pair of inexpensive earbuds to use for Teams meetings. They aren‚Äôt great for music or movies, but they‚Äôre still serviceable. These excel with calls and meetings while providing a solid connection to Windows PCs during Teams meetings, something other earbuds have issues with. I don‚Äôt recommend these for media consumption, but they are great ‚Äúbusiness‚Äù earbuds to get work done.

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: I got these because of my laptop and initially I thought they were good headphones/earbuds for like the first week but it has been a nightmare to use these. I can only get one or the other side to connect to blue tooth. I finally fixed that and got both sides to sync together and connect to Bluetooth and within less than a week it went back to me only been able to hear from one ear bud at a time. I am not connecting it to other devices!!!! It should not be so challenging to reset the earbuds and get them both synced up and they should not revert back to only one ear bud working at time. I wish I would have returned them during the time frame to get refund or replacement but snoozed off hoping to fix them. I am disappointed. I have spent too many hours trying to resolve this and when I did it went back to not functioning as intended within days.

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: Really like these earbuds. They‚Äôre super comfortable and easy to use.I especially like that I can connect them to both my phone and my computer at the same time.When I‚Äôm watching something on my laptop and someone calls me, the earbuds automatically switch to the phone. That‚Äôs really convenient. Totally happy with the purchase!

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: These headphones are actually really good; the noise cancellation on them is amazing and the audio quality is pretty good. i highly recommend them.

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: The left ear buds stopped working within 3 months of purchase.Waste of my money

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: If you want cheaper ear buds, these are just ok. Battery will last max 2-hrs and audio quality is just ok. I used them for about a year and they still work, but I just purchased a nicer pair, different brand for almost double the price. You get what you pay for. I could never figure out how to control noise cancellation vs pass through audio.

product: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming
review_text: I really wanted to like these earbuds.  They are a nice color, not the usual black.  The case is well made, though I would have liked a feel that was less slick, and a squared off base so it could set up on my desk.  They last about 4 hours listening to videos and audio books.  I am not one to use noise cancelling, I like to hear what is going on around me, but I did test it and there was a significant reduction in the noise in my office.  The instructions were a little lacking, there were pictures that told how to turn the earbuds and noise cancelling on/off.  I can supposedly register the earbuds, but do not see the serial number, and the only QR code on the box does not scan with my phone.  There was also mention of an app for further adjustments and updates to the earbuds, but after much searching I found it is an app for a computer, not cellphone.  This is very disappointing since I would be primarily using them at work and cannot download an app to my work computer.  After trying them out at work for 8 hours (you can use 1 bud at a time), I found them uncomfortable.  They fit very similarly to the newer apple buds, which I can't wear for the same reason.  The sound was ok.  With lower voices I didn't notice any issues, but the audio book I was listening to has a female narrator, and sounded a little tinny.  The app is supposed to allow you to make adjustments, but I cannot verify that.

product: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I have been looking for a good pair of earbuds for a few months now. I have the Steel series arctic earbuds that are 150$, and four others. The Monster earbuds are better than all of them. My SS buds were great but the ANC broke after about a week. Then a month later the transparency feature suddenly made them so quiet they are not worth using. The other pairs are just mid and meh. But these Monsters have deep bass which for me is a must, and they sound fantastic! I am an avid music/podcast listener and gamer. These are perfect for all uses! They feel well made and solid! The case is great and I love the design. All of this to say they are IMO very much worth the price! I got them on a deep discount but if I had to pay Full price I would not feel ripped off like the SS arctic buds. Highly recomend! Only issue was the ear pads were too small and I had to use some from a different pair. But I have big ears lol! Once I used different pads they sound just like I had hoped.

product: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Been knowing about monster brand since highschool (2010) always wanted a pair but never seem to afford it. Yes later I came across them again. And this I got them. And it is definitely well worth it brand and quality. Usually prefer the bigger ear piece but had to switch to the smaller ones due to the big ones hurting my ears. But over 10/10 in sound quality, and design.

product: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I'm a mid grade earbud buyer and these are pretty darn good, got them for a great price for cyber Monday (close to half off) they replaced my higher end series of JBL's. The sound quality is better than the JBL vibe 100 by far. The only trade off is the volume does not get as high as the JBL's. The monsters could be a bit louder, the JBL's at full blast are too loud to tolerate to where the monsters at full blast are just nowhere near as loud. The sound quality is the key, the monsters are hands down better between lows mids and hi. The range and crystal clear sound outweighs making your ears bleed. I also thing the charging case on the monsters is a MUCH better design. Overall 5* but to be honest if I paid sticker price as opposed to half off I would be disappointed and it would fall to 3*. If you can get a good deal for them grab it!

product: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These are really nice..Sounds great. Battery life good...

product: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I'm a huge Monster Audio fan, even their lower priced items tend to have decent sound for the money you'll spend.  I really liked these, they sound great with a full range which for me is important as I listen to just about everything from early 20th jazz, Big Band from the 20's & 40's and most anything up through current selections. One problem I've had with other Bluetooth buds is they tend to fall of my ears with even slight activity but these didn't have that issue at all. I was able to wear them while working on my hobbies which include wood working as well during physical therapy which could ne fairly vigorous without having to readjust them. I especially liked that they didn't fall out while sleeping. Put them in at bedtime and still have them in at 5am.The issue I have with them and it's a big one is after several months charging became a major issue.  I tried cleaning the contacts on both the case and buds to no avail and unless I left them for a day in the case it was unlikely I'd have even half a charge. At first it was just the right ear bud but then it was both. It really became a nuisance when you'd leave them in the case for 12 hours only to find they were still at 10% the next morning. We finally gave up on them and ordered a new pair of earbuds.

product: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Very good ear buds. Clean, clear sound, with good fit. Fast, trouble-free connectivity. Cylindrical ear bud case charges ear buds between uses, AND it easily fits in a pepper spray belt case - handy! Only problem is top volume could be a little louder. Still worth 5 stars. Good value for the purchase dollar.

product: Monster Clarity 101 AirLinks Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I bought these, the 700 anc and Champions because I use buds A LOT and the price on Amazon was good. The backup batteries are all across the spectrum with this one being the medium but still not great, like the Champions. Sound quality was mid pack but the not far behind the 700's. Function is perfected when it comes to thermal, too sensitive and adjustments become inadvertent actions. Form is really nice as well, i really like the framing, finish and the LED actually looks linear. Connects within a second or 2 and range is similar to skullcandy which imo has the best range I've seen. Love the L/R connectivity as well, normally I had to always carry 2 sets for work. IPX rated so I can work in them and I also like the case with the slide window. The only functions it's missing is ambient microphone and anc but for half the price of the 700's that's ok with me.Update: after using these for a few weeks I wanted to leave a few notes. Battery life on the buds are the best I've seen on individual buds. I'm usually only wearing 1 at a time but most days 1 bud will outlast the battery on my phone and I am almost always listening to something. The charging case isn't quite as good and needs to be charged every few days. The Monster Champions is a heavier case but will last literally weeks on a single charge and daily use. Despite that these are the best buds I've ever owned and I've had literally dozens. I wear these over my ANC 700's, Beats, Klipsch, several JBL's, several Skullcandy's and Sony buds. Lastly, fit is also the best I've experienced. I normally don't have problems finding buds that fit and usually use the supplied medium sized inserts but these stay in place as good as any. I'm not fumbling with them while I work outside in Texas and I love that.
