product: Samsung Wireless Headphones Bluetooth Ear Buds for Samsung Galaxy A17 A16 A36 S25 Ultra S24 S23 S22 S21 Bluetooth 5.3 Earbuds with Mic Noise Cancelling in Ear Earphones 60H Playback with LED Display
review_text: These earbuds were super easy to pair to my iPhone 16e. They are pretty comfortable, especially compared to the old wired earbuds that I used back in the Dark Ages. They sit close to the ear and don't look obvious when wearing.The sound quality of the earbuds is very good, and the batteries last a few hours on a charge. For listening to music, they rate a solid 5, especially considering their price point.However, the sound quality of the mic leaves much to be desired. I've been told that I sound very muffled and "distant" when talking with them. I rarely answer my phone, and when I do callers can still hear me despite the poor sound quality. My main use is for private enjoyment of entertainment on my phone, and for this function I find these quite adequate. However, it would be nice if there was a way to disable them as my phone's mic. I did some research on disabling earbud mics and the methods I found (disabling in the device's Bluetooth settings & also in the Microphone settings) were not successful.

product: realme Buds Air 7 Pro with Ai Live Translation
review_text: I bought these earbuds primarily out of curiosity to see how the "AI live translation" feature worked. Overall, the earbuds themselves aren't bad, but the software that powers them leaves a lot to be desired.*The AI translation feature is present in a dedicated app menu, but the page or tab simply doesn't work at all after selecting the mode and languages.*The app itself demands many different permissions, including your location, microphone, and nearby devices. While microphone and nearby device access can somewhat be explained, sharing your location makes absolutely no sense, yet the app won't proceed without it. This prevents you from adjusting the sound mixer or even attempting to use the non-functional AI translation.*Noise cancellation works, but if there's any wind, you'll experience light clicking or crackling in your ear.*The earbuds come with additional eartip sizes. With the medium-sized tips, the earbuds shift around in my ears while walking, creating strange clicking noises. With the large tips, the earbuds simply fall out of my ears after 5-8 minutes of walking.For this price, not worth right now. In theory, for around $50-60, they'd be decent earbuds, as the material quality and sound are not bad at all.

product: Wireless Earbuds
review_text: For someone hard-of-hearing like myself, these are the answer to my prayers.  Didn't have to spend a boatload of money, either.  Frankly, I don't know how they can sell them so reasonably.  I had a pair of large, with full ear cups, bluetooth headphones to listen to TV.  My wife doesn't like the high volume so I had to wear them all the time during the day / evening with the TV audio muted when watching unless we were watching a movie / TV program she wanted to watch with me.  Now I can hear her and the TV simultaneously so she doesn't have to yell at me to override the old headphones.  The audio is perfect.  The old headphones were extremely poor for high frequencies and were very heavy with the bass.  Without the high frequencies everything sounded muffled and forget trying to understand what foreign actors are trying to say on my favorite shows.  I could understand 20-40% of what they were saying no matter how loud I had the headphones jacked up and background music in the film / TV show just made it all that much worse.  No longer!  Great audio, lots of high frequency response so I can watch everything now and understand all the words being spoken.  These work great for music, too, on my iPhone and MacBook devices.  I bought a bluetooth transmitter on Amazon (1Mii SafeFly Dual | Bluetooth 5.3 Adapter Bluetooth Transmitter w/Screen for Wireless Headphones), plugged the 3mm audio plug into the headphone jack on the TV and away we went after pairing.  The SafeFly transmitter mentioned comes with a USB charging port so I just plugged it into a USB to AC adapter into the outlet behind the TV so it remains fully charged at all times.  These are great for the hard-of-hearing like myself.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Pro R190 Bluetooth Earbuds True Wireless
review_text: These renewed Galaxy Buds Pro arrived in excellent condition and function like new.  The sound quality is impressive, with effective noise cancellation and clear audio.  The Phantom Violet color is vibrant and adds a stylish touch.  However, they tend to slip out during workouts, and the battery life is decent but not exceptional.  Overall, a solid purchase for the price.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Pro R190 Bluetooth Earbuds True Wireless
review_text: I wanted to love these Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro in Phantom Silver. Really, I did. They looked sleek, sounded crisp, and the noise canceling was so good I couldn‚Äôt hear my neighbor‚Äôs lawnmower OR his terrible karaoke. For a brief, shining moment, I thought we had a future together.Then the romance ended.Battery life: Nonexistent. These things died faster than my motivation on a Monday morning.Fit: Imagine throwing a bar of soap in your ear and hoping it stays. Spoiler: it doesn‚Äôt. I tried all three sizes of tips. My ears rejected them like an organ transplant gone wrong.Connection: The sound cut in and out like they were trying to Morse code me a distress signal. (Probably saying ‚Äúreturn me, please.‚Äù)To be fair, when they did work, they sounded fantastic. Crisp highs, solid bass, and the noise reduction could probably drown out my mother-in-law‚Äôs ‚Äúhelpful suggestions.‚ÄùBut after two days of frustration, I‚Äôm packing them up and sending them home. Good sound, terrible everything else.Final verdict: Great for a demo. Terrible for real life. Unless you enjoy chasing earbuds across the floor like a toddler chasing Skittles.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Pro R190 Bluetooth Earbuds True Wireless
review_text: Not bad at all for refurbished! Connected with ease and they sound awesome! Thank you!

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Pro R190 Bluetooth Earbuds True Wireless
review_text: I upgraded to these after losing my beloved Galaxy Buds+ and was mildly disappointed. After using these for three or four years, I have since moved on to the much happier pair of Galaxy Buds3.Compared to buds I've had before and after, the fit for these was the worst. They would easily slip out of my ears (regardless of which earbud-tip size I attached.) They also hurt to wear, after a while.Something about the case's shape also meant that any time I dropped it, it opened and launched the earbuds into oblivion. They were never damaged, so I guess in that sense it did its job. But it's an awkward thing when it happens, for example, on an airplane.(While we're on the subject: Side-sleepers, beware, these are not the earbuds for you. They stick out too much for that and it hurts.)Battery life is about, eh, 2 - 3 hours. If it starts to die in use, you can keep the case charged and put one bud in there and just keep alternating them.One thing I'm really impressed by is their water-resistance. My cat pushed the case and buds into his water bowl, and after setting them out to dry for a day they functioned as normal.To their credit, the sound is great. They also have intuitive and useful touch-controls, and their noise cancelling is pretty decent. But the other aspects outweighed this for me, I think.The Good:- Sound is great- Touch controls are easy and work well- Noise-canceling is decent- Fantastic water resistanceThe bad:- Short battery life- Pretty uncomfortable to wearThe Ugly:- Them

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Pro R190 Bluetooth Earbuds True Wireless
review_text: Arrived overnight as promised and works perfectly so far. Definitely a recommended grab for a deal! The sound and the fit is much better than expected due to other reviews for this model.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I don‚Äôt usually write reviews, but I felt compelled to share how impressed I am with these headphones! I have small ears, and most earbuds never stay in place. The only ones that worked for me in the past were the Bose SoundSport. After that, I used Beats Pro over-ear headphones. While they stayed on, I was never truly impressed with the sound quality.I spent weeks researching before purchasing these, and I‚Äôm so glad I did. They fit comfortably in my small ears and stay put without any issues. The active noise cancellation is excellent‚Äîat the gym, I used to hear conversations and background noise through my old headphones, but with these properly seated, I hear NOTHING at all!The sound quality and clarity are a noticeable upgrade from my old Beats, and I really like being able to adjust the sound through the app. I prefer bass-heavy music, and these deliver. While volume controls on the earbuds themselves would be nice, it‚Äôs not a deal breaker since my phone is usually nearby.If you struggle with earbuds staying in your ears and want a high-quality pair of headphones that cost about half the price of other major brands‚Äîwhile performing even better in my opinion‚ÄîI highly recommend giving these a try!

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: These are great sounding earbuds and they are fantastic for the price. You really can't get any better. I specifically needed these though because I need a good transparency mode and I didn't want to spend too much for earbuds. I have nicer earbuds that have much better noise canceling but The trade-off with the other earbuds that I have tried was that they had a poor transparency mode so it seems like at this price you kind of get one of the other. The noise canceling isn't terrible on these earbuds it's just that if that is what you want more than anything you can get better on different earbuds. So again if you're looking for a good all-around earbud with great transparency mode go with these. I should also note I have smaller ears and although they are a little bit bulky they fit and they do not fall out. A little tip though, twist them a little bit to get them to grab onto your ear just right.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: Great earbuds.  I like how you can costomize them to fit your ear.  Great sound. And easy to control.  They connected to my Samsung phone with no issues and work great.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: These Galaxy buds fe are almost perfect.As an audiophile these definitely sound great, a bit of treble sparkle, slightly boosted mids and BASS. While I personally think they sound better than the Method 360 ANC by Skullcandy, they have quite a ways to go to become the perfect earbud.The battery life is not the greatest as I only get 5-6 hours with ANC on. And about 22-24 with the case.The fit is very good, I'm glad to see a stability fin on these. Not only does it make them fit better, but man do the look good. Also speaking of the fin, they do stay in the ear very well, and with their IPX2 rating I've had them drenched in sweat and snow and everything still works so prompts to Samsung.The ANC is good enough as it reduces background noise and softens conversations around.The app experience is very cool, one thing is I downloaded the Wearable app and was told that the app was not needed and that I could access everything from the settings app on my S23. Don't know if it was a UI update or something, but all very cool.Two things. One, the ANC stays off until you go into the settings and change it yourself, so you can have ANC in just one  earbud.Two, the wear detection works but it takes the earbuds a second to realize its not in my ear. Also just a general note I'd like to have a company who makes an earbud with wear detection and it just pauses the earbud you took out and not both earbuds.Overall they are very good earbuds and will be great for a casual listener who wants a Samsung product. These are great!!!

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: Recently purchased these because a older set of wireless earbuds I had started to glitch out in the left ear wouldn't charge properly. So bit  bullet and bought these and I'm glad I did. They were easy to connect. They charge great. They fit in the ear perfectly and come with sized earbuds and a few other attachments from outside the ear when the earbuds are in  to adjust for comfort. wasn't too deep in Pocket (if you choose to do a monthly payment plan like I did) comes in into simple yet pretty good looking colors. I must say black and white. I chose white so I can find them even in their case in the case itself fits in the palm of the hand very comfortably and I omit I am bad with taking the earbuds out of the case and sometimes holding the case itself, but in having had these for a bit. I did fumble the case and it didn't fly open which is a blessing The functions in the earbuds themselves are very simple, personally I have absolutely no care that they don't do volume control for me. It's starting stopping and just moving on to the next song and answering calls. They are very excellent for that. They work great. Oh, and let's not forget the sound quality and noise cancellation. It doesn't drown out the environment around you, but it gives a perfect balance of quiet and self-awareness where you can enjoy what you're listening to and not be completely unaware of what's going on around you.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro True Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: These renewed Galaxy Buds Pro arrived in excellent condition and function like new.  The sound quality is impressive, with effective noise cancellation and clear audio.  The Phantom Violet color is vibrant and adds a stylish touch.  However, they tend to slip out during workouts, and the battery life is decent but not exceptional.  Overall, a solid purchase for the price.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro True Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: I wanted to love these Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro in Phantom Silver. Really, I did. They looked sleek, sounded crisp, and the noise canceling was so good I couldn‚Äôt hear my neighbor‚Äôs lawnmower OR his terrible karaoke. For a brief, shining moment, I thought we had a future together.Then the romance ended.Battery life: Nonexistent. These things died faster than my motivation on a Monday morning.Fit: Imagine throwing a bar of soap in your ear and hoping it stays. Spoiler: it doesn‚Äôt. I tried all three sizes of tips. My ears rejected them like an organ transplant gone wrong.Connection: The sound cut in and out like they were trying to Morse code me a distress signal. (Probably saying ‚Äúreturn me, please.‚Äù)To be fair, when they did work, they sounded fantastic. Crisp highs, solid bass, and the noise reduction could probably drown out my mother-in-law‚Äôs ‚Äúhelpful suggestions.‚ÄùBut after two days of frustration, I‚Äôm packing them up and sending them home. Good sound, terrible everything else.Final verdict: Great for a demo. Terrible for real life. Unless you enjoy chasing earbuds across the floor like a toddler chasing Skittles.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro True Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: Not bad at all for refurbished! Connected with ease and they sound awesome! Thank you!

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro True Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: I upgraded to these after losing my beloved Galaxy Buds+ and was mildly disappointed. After using these for three or four years, I have since moved on to the much happier pair of Galaxy Buds3.Compared to buds I've had before and after, the fit for these was the worst. They would easily slip out of my ears (regardless of which earbud-tip size I attached.) They also hurt to wear, after a while.Something about the case's shape also meant that any time I dropped it, it opened and launched the earbuds into oblivion. They were never damaged, so I guess in that sense it did its job. But it's an awkward thing when it happens, for example, on an airplane.(While we're on the subject: Side-sleepers, beware, these are not the earbuds for you. They stick out too much for that and it hurts.)Battery life is about, eh, 2 - 3 hours. If it starts to die in use, you can keep the case charged and put one bud in there and just keep alternating them.One thing I'm really impressed by is their water-resistance. My cat pushed the case and buds into his water bowl, and after setting them out to dry for a day they functioned as normal.To their credit, the sound is great. They also have intuitive and useful touch-controls, and their noise cancelling is pretty decent. But the other aspects outweighed this for me, I think.The Good:- Sound is great- Touch controls are easy and work well- Noise-canceling is decent- Fantastic water resistanceThe bad:- Short battery life- Pretty uncomfortable to wearThe Ugly:- Them

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro True Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: Arrived overnight as promised and works perfectly so far. Definitely a recommended grab for a deal! The sound and the fit is much better than expected due to other reviews for this model.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I only received them yesterday, but after using them all day, I love them.The fit is different from any other earbuds I've used. They feel like they're going to fall out, but they never did, and I was climbing ladders, bending over, etc. The looser fit is much more comfortable. They don't make my ears sore or itchy like the Galaxy buds 2 did.The sound quality and noise cancellation were surprisingly good, considering the looser-feeling fit. I listened to music all day and made a few phone calls on top of a very windy and noisy rooftop. The sound quality is much better than that of the Galaxy Buds 2, and the ANC blocked the noise from the loud HVAC unit I was working next to.I really love that they allow you to change songs, stop/start music, and change volume just by saying it, without saying "Hey Google" or doing anything else. The voice command for volume is useless, though, because it only changes by a tiny bit, so you would have to keep saying it repeatedly. It would be better if you could say to set the volume at XX%. The swipe controls on the stem work really well, but the pitch controls take some getting used to.Battery life was pretty decent. I didn't keep track, but they worked for about 3-4 hours with music at full volume. I may buy a second pair so I can having one set charging while I use the other set

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: It's the best product for Samsung users!Instant connectivity, very professional noise cancellation, and I found the simultaneous translation incredible (I tested it with friends from India and China). The English translation is perfect.Regarding the anatomy, I haven't been able to remove and replace the rubber band yet, but overall, it fits my ear well.Super good battery life, fast charging, and exceptional sound quality.

They said I sounded extremely clear.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbud Headphones
review_text: I have every wireless earbud model that Samsung has made thus far. I cannot recommend Galaxy Buds 2 Pro enough.The sound is remarkable, simply put.Turning on the 360 audio feature on them changes everything, I don't even know how it's possible to feel like the sound is coming from everywhere besides the things sitting in your ears.The active noice canceling is shocking, it's substantially better than just a generation ago in the buds 2.  My window is right next to a main road in my town, and I can sit right in front of it, watching cars go by 15 feet away, without anything playing in the earbuds, and not hear the cars at all. Blows my mind.Generally buds with wingtips fit best in my ears, and they give me more confidence wearing them in active conditions, jogging, biking, cleaning, etc. The Buds 2 never stayed in my ears very well, constant adjustments, the Buds Pro were even worse, and produced unbearable pain in my ears due to their size, geometry, and weight. I was frankly expecting a similar outcome with these Buds 2 Pro, I was instead very surprised to find out that they fit and stay in my ears better than even the Buds FE and other wingtipped buds. I can wear them indefinitely without discomfort, and rarely have to adjust their position in my ears. I do not know how they pulled this off. They are noticeably lighter than previous buds, this surely plays a role.  (I understand the fitment will vary by individual)Battery life is also perfectly sufficient for most people's listening habits, I would imagine. The old Buds+ and their 11+ hours have spoiled me though, and leave me wanting more with all the Buds I've had since, but, I can't really complain with these specifically, ~6 hours is a fine tradeoff if it means lighter buds with better drivers.I'm not an audiophile, I can't tell you why these sound great, but they do, that is certain.HIGHLY recommend.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbud Headphones
review_text: This is the perfect design! I love the design as it perfectly fits and stay in the ear. No risk of falling down during run/work out. The sound quality is superb and branded by AKG and the price is reasonable specifically as Samsung always gives special offer! The volume control cannot be done through the buds, but it is okay and perfect. I found the battery life enough for at least one day and use of usb type-c port and wireless charging is another plus point I could consider!

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbud Headphones
review_text: I have always used cheaper Bluetooth wireless headsets for my phone, but on a recent trip to Utah I decided to splurge. I don't know why I didn't sooner. These are super comfortable in the ears and the noise canceling is absolutely amazing. I would compare it to my Bose headphones that I wear when I'm at home in the quality of the noise canceling. If you pair them with a Samsung phone, you get even more additional features that are just mind blowing compared to your cheap Bluetooth headsets.So I leave it in this if you have a Samsung Galaxy Device absolutely think about spending the money and buying a set of fees you will not regret it. Only one complaint I have, the flip up lid of the charger case comes open very easily, every now and then you'll lose the headphones in your pocket or if you drop the case they will go flying. They have even bounced off into puddles and into a toilet at one point. Drive them off quickly and both of them have still worked for month since I got them. Other than the case I have nothing bad to say about these things can't wait to see the next iteration.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbud Headphones
review_text: Bought these as an upgrade from mid - level Jlab wireless headphones. The primary reason that I wanted an upgrade from my old Jlab headphones was the quality of making calls. Honestly other than that I had no issues with my old ones. After buying these I tested the sound quality for calls. IT MAKES PHONE CALLS WITH SUPER GOOD QUALITY. It did exactly what I had got them for! I was a little sad however, to realize that the noise cancelling mode had actually decreased in quality. Initially I could not tell a difference between regular off mode and noise cancelling. Then I discovered I had some bigger ear tips. This did make a decent difference, however the noise cancelling just still never was as good as my old headphones (and to be honest they were not like the most insane at it either). I think I'm gonna try and find some better tips online that will help with noise cancelling and see what happens.Overall:Phone call quality: AMAZINGTec and features: A little sensitive but overall really well doneOverall feel in the ears etc: Not bad at allNoise cancelling mode: Mid at bestAmbient Noise mode: GreatWorth the upgrade from $70 Jlab wireless headphones: Overall yes

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I upgraded to these after owning the Galaxy Buds Live, which is a very different design. I'm not an audiophile, but I am fairly experienced with mid-tier sound equipment, speakers, and headphones. I built my own 11.1 surround sound movie room using a higher end Yamaha receiver and have used Klipsch, Polk Audio, Paradigm, BIC America, Sony, Yamaha, Pioneer, Bose (don't judge me, they work well in some applications), JL Audio, JBL, Mirage, and other brands of speakers through the years in home and car audio setups. For headphones, I've mainly used wired as early wireless models sounded hollow and tinny in comparison. I've used lower end AKG and Sony buds, as well as mid-tier Sennheisers. I've also used higher end Sony over-ear headphones as well as the highly rated (but lesser known) Status Audio CB-1 studio monitor headphones.I waited a while to buy into the wireless headphone market and finally took the plunge with the Buds Live as they offered something my wired headphones didn't‚Äîambient sound. Usually this is an unwanted distraction and noise isolation is preferred, but sometimes I want to be aware of what's going on around me and be able to engage in a conversation even if I have my buds in. Apple did this well with their pass-through technology, but I'm not about to switch over to an entirely new product line and closed ecosystem just for headphones, so I waited. The Buds Live managed this trick with a low-tech solution by not sealing in the ear canal, so I gave them a try. Sound quality was decent‚Äîon par with my lower end AKG wired buds, but not as good as my mid-tier (~$100) Sennheiser buds. They also were finnicky with their connection and cut out a lot if my phone was in my pocket, especially if I bent over or squatted.BUDS 2 PRO:I upgraded to these as they also had a pass-through feature which seemed to work fairly well and did so automatically when you started talking. I figured this would be just as good and offer better sound and isolation when desired. Overall I think this feature works pretty good and is a nice compromise for me. In terms of sound quality, the Buds 2 Pro are definitely a step up from the Buds Live and probably on par with my wired mid-tier Sennheisers. I can't complain about the sound quality at all.As with the Buds Live though, the Buds 2 Pro require a bit of fidgeting to get them seated in the ear properly. Traditional ear buds, and even Apple's Airpods require little thought or adjustment beyond getting the right sized rubber or foam tips for a good seal. Samsung seems to go for more experimental designs which require learning and getting used to. After a few days use, they still aren't "natural" to put in or locked into muscle memory‚ÄîI have to fuss with them a bit to get a good seal. Once in though, I haven't had any problems.Overall, I recommend these buds. They still aren't perfect as the fit isn't intuitive, battery life a little meager, and the noise cancellation is about 85-90%, not 100, but overall, solid headphones. Could you get way better sounding wired headphones for tons less money? Yes, for about $50 you can pick up a pair of Status CB-1's and hear every fine detail in high fidelity. But in the wireless in-ear category, prioritizing convenience and mobility over everything else, these perform admirably. I've heard Sennheiser's Momentum True Wireless 3 buds *might* edge these out in terms of sound quality, but they look a lot more bulky (stick out more from the ear and therefore may be less stable) and don't have the automatic ambient sound pass-through feature. They also are a touch more money. On the upside though, they appear to be a more traditional bud design, so might be more straightforward to put in, but Airpods are probably still the easiest to put in and take out.But I plan on using the Buds 2 Pro for years before feeling the need to upgrade again. I'm satisfied with the purchase, though still wincing at the cost-to-performance ratio compared to wired options. Can't knock a product for performing in the top tier of its specific market though, so I'll give it 5 stars as a true wireless earbud, but would give it 4 in sound quality against cheaper wired in-ear and over-ear options.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I have had these for 3 yrs now.  I use them almost daily as a construction worker.  With no music playing it actually makes it easier to talk to people because the noise cancelling cuts out all the background noise.  I often wear them just as ear plugs with no audio at all.  They work better than foam plugs for grinding or other loud tasks.  If I have music playing on top of the noise canceling I basically cannot hear anything but the music and these sound great.  I was adverse to ear buds for a long time until I bought these.  I always preferred over ear headphones.  The "jelly bean" style is very nice and with 3 cup sizes in the box its easy to get a good fit.  They do have a poor battery life but it last long enough to get me to break and then they go in the car.  They charge fast so its no issue really and given how much work they are doing with the noise canceling its no surprise they are heavy on battery usage.  I do not use voice detect because I found that WILL kill your battery if you intend to use these for work all day.  The augmented audio feature is also very cool.  Nice for hunting.  I clean them cups and screens often with a q tip.  One soaked in peroxide and then one soaked in alcohol.  They have maintained great audio clarity over the years despite heavy use in the very tough environment of an outdoor construction site during all seasons in Michigan.  I'd buy a new set before I "upgrade" to the blade style of the buds pro 3.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I researched on this earbuds for a year when it came out but it was so expensive. Then this year I saw that it's on installment and discounted. It even got more affordable this month, wish I waited longer. I love this because I have the Z Fold 5, been a phablet x stylus user since Note 2! There are so many reasons to invest in this earbuds, most especially if you're a Samsung user.First, it just integrates with my phone intuitively and I can use it with my MacBook 2017 and Garmin Fenix 6s! The Wearable widget helps reconnect the earbuds back to the phone faster than fumbling with the app. I can continue listening to a song or podcast on Spotify from my phone to my laptop and back to my phone, and the sound quality and volume doesn't change.Second, the connectivity is sustained better than other wireless earbuds, whether watching a video, listening, or gaming! There's a gaming option that minimizes the lag between the sound and game action. I can leave my phone farther and still listen to music, or more important, get calls while doing tasks more than 20 feet or more away - even between 2 rooms apart. I had cheaper buds that once I close our steel-cored front door, the connection with my phone will be disrupted even if my phone is just right next to the door.Third, I love the responsiveness to equalizer adjustments! I'm not a sound engineer or audiophile but I used their reviews to narrow down my options based on the products that produce the best sound qualities on the range of frequencies I can already hear with my naked ears. We appreciate sounds differently so it depends on individual hearing but we'd agree that these pricey things respond fast! My hearing was tested, I'm also trained in classical music, and have a healthcare background, so my ears seek refined details from music or physiological sounds. I don't like too much enhanced bass and uncomfortable loudness, as those can lead to deafness. These buds can be loud and bass-proud too! Fresh from the box, these buds were on Normal settings on the Wearable equalizer. To me, I heard the lower frequencies more than the higher ones but I can still distinctly appreciate the higher registers. So I tweaked the equalizer and it responds immediately!!! That equalizer doesn't allow customization but Spotify allows it. I noticed that the Dynamic option looks like the Harman Curve, whether you're a fan of it or not, it's preset already. Although with these earbuds, I can tell if music has been rendered with Dolby, HiFi or some technology... some music do sound unnatural. I had to check the music piece I'm studying if I heard the musical dynamics right, as I might be attempting to produce that sound quality in real life.Now, the stuff I don't like... first, these were so uncomfortable at the start. I can't bear these in my ears for 30 minutes when I first got it. I had to stretch my earlobes and wear these for staggered periods of time per day. I mixed and matched between small and mid-sized tips until the buds fit test say they're ok and it does feel comfortable. It took me a week to adjust my ears and now I can wear them 4 to 6 hours straight. I almost returned these but I thought I'm used to having wired earphones and it's the sacrifice to wireless earbuds that do work. Just like others advice, do the fit test frequently until the fit feels right.Second, the charging case isn't waterproof and shockproof, so I bought the Samsung armor for it. Both the buds and case get dusty pretty quickly. I clean the tips and case with alcohol and tissue.Third, I don't like that it's protruding out of my earlobes but it is what it is. As of this writing, it's one of the smaller and lighter earbuds. I've tried working out and doing sports with these, they pop out when I clench my jaw, move my head in many directions or jump. I have to strap these so if it does pop out, it'll hang from my shoulders and not get stepped on.Oh well, enjoy yours!

On the upside though, they appear to be a more traditional bud design, so might be more straightforward to put in, but Airpods are probably still the easiest to put in and take out.But I plan on using the Buds 2 Pro for years before feeling the need to upgrade again. I'm satisfied with the purchase, though still wincing at the cost-to-performance ratio compared to wired options. Can't knock a product for performing in the top tier of its specific market though, so I'll give it 5 stars as a true wireless earbud, but would give it 4 in sound quality against cheaper wired in-ear and over-ear options.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I have had these for 3 yrs now.  I use them almost daily as a construction worker.  With no music playing it actually makes it easier to talk to people because the noise cancelling cuts out all the background noise.  I often wear them just as ear plugs with no audio at all.  They work better than foam plugs for grinding or other loud tasks.  If I have music playing on top of the noise canceling I basically cannot hear anything but the music and these sound great.  I was adverse to ear buds for a long time until I bought these.  I always preferred over ear headphones.  The "jelly bean" style is very nice and with 3 cup sizes in the box its easy to get a good fit.  They do have a poor battery life but it last long enough to get me to break and then they go in the car.  They charge fast so its no issue really and given how much work they are doing with the noise canceling its no surprise they are heavy on battery usage.  I do not use voice detect because I found that WILL kill your battery if you intend to use these for work all day.  The augmented audio feature is also very cool.  Nice for hunting.  I clean them cups and screens often with a q tip.  One soaked in peroxide and then one soaked in alcohol.  They have maintained great audio clarity over the years despite heavy use in the very tough environment of an outdoor construction site during all seasons in Michigan.  I'd buy a new set before I "upgrade" to the blade style of the buds pro 3.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I researched on this earbuds for a year when it came out but it was so expensive. Then this year I saw that it's on installment and discounted. It even got more affordable this month, wish I waited longer. I love this because I have the Z Fold 5, been a phablet x stylus user since Note 2! There are so many reasons to invest in this earbuds, most especially if you're a Samsung user.First, it just integrates with my phone intuitively and I can use it with my MacBook 2017 and Garmin Fenix 6s! The Wearable widget helps reconnect the earbuds back to the phone faster than fumbling with the app. I can continue listening to a song or podcast on Spotify from my phone to my laptop and back to my phone, and the sound quality and volume doesn't change.Second, the connectivity is sustained better than other wireless earbuds, whether watching a video, listening, or gaming! There's a gaming option that minimizes the lag between the sound and game action. I can leave my phone farther and still listen to music, or more important, get calls while doing tasks more than 20 feet or more away - even between 2 rooms apart. I had cheaper buds that once I close our steel-cored front door, the connection with my phone will be disrupted even if my phone is just right next to the door.Third, I love the responsiveness to equalizer adjustments! I'm not a sound engineer or audiophile but I used their reviews to narrow down my options based on the products that produce the best sound qualities on the range of frequencies I can already hear with my naked ears. We appreciate sounds differently so it depends on individual hearing but we'd agree that these pricey things respond fast! My hearing was tested, I'm also trained in classical music, and have a healthcare background, so my ears seek refined details from music or physiological sounds. I don't like too much enhanced bass and uncomfortable loudness, as those can lead to deafness. These buds can be loud and bass-proud too! Fresh from the box, these buds were on Normal settings on the Wearable equalizer. To me, I heard the lower frequencies more than the higher ones but I can still distinctly appreciate the higher registers. So I tweaked the equalizer and it responds immediately!!! That equalizer doesn't allow customization but Spotify allows it. I noticed that the Dynamic option looks like the Harman Curve, whether you're a fan of it or not, it's preset already. Although with these earbuds, I can tell if music has been rendered with Dolby, HiFi or some technology... some music do sound unnatural. I had to check the music piece I'm studying if I heard the musical dynamics right, as I might be attempting to produce that sound quality in real life.Now, the stuff I don't like... first, these were so uncomfortable at the start. I can't bear these in my ears for 30 minutes when I first got it. I had to stretch my earlobes and wear these for staggered periods of time per day. I mixed and matched between small and mid-sized tips until the buds fit test say they're ok and it does feel comfortable. It took me a week to adjust my ears and now I can wear them 4 to 6 hours straight. I almost returned these but I thought I'm used to having wired earphones and it's the sacrifice to wireless earbuds that do work. Just like others advice, do the fit test frequently until the fit feels right.Second, the charging case isn't waterproof and shockproof, so I bought the Samsung armor for it. Both the buds and case get dusty pretty quickly. I clean the tips and case with alcohol and tissue.Third, I don't like that it's protruding out of my earlobes but it is what it is. As of this writing, it's one of the smaller and lighter earbuds. I've tried working out and doing sports with these, they pop out when I clench my jaw, move my head in many directions or jump. I have to strap these so if it does pop out, it'll hang from my shoulders and not get stepped on.Oh well, enjoy yours!

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: I bought the international version of the Samsung Galaxy Buds3 Pro mainly because of the better price. I very rarely need warranty replacement for items like this so I appreciate the lower price. I really appreciate the great noise canceling of these ear buds when working out at the gym. The bass really seems a lot better than my previous Samsung ear buds. I would really recommend these for anybody considering them.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: Amazing product Long range connectivity sound great no more to say its samsung always great products

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: Fits my ears perfectly. The sound is amazing. The noise cancelation is great. I can have a normal conversation on the phone with them. I dont have to talk loud for the person to hear me.  Best purchase I've made.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: Bought 2 pair.  I love mine, the other is a gift for my husband who still uses a wired pocket earbud.We use Samsung Smart phones, so this connectivity and compatibility was very important.So comfortable, I don't know I have them on.  The sound is and quality are incredible.  Wirth the price so far.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: They're good headphones into everything they are supposed to. They are very compatible and the app is great. If you have a Samsung phone I would recommend them. I wish they were slightly louder which is why they were only getting four stars, even though they are very good quality.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: These buds are a big let-down, especially since they are priced and positioned to be the top buds Samsung makes. I'm into personal tech, and I own way too many Apple and Samsung devices. I currently use a Samsung Galaxy Fold 7, and that is the phone I've been using with these buds. I also currently own the Galaxy Watch Ultra, and I also have Apple Earpods Pro as well (also used the Samsung buds with Ipad Pros and Window laptops)Unfortunately, from a reliability stand point, the Apple Earpods Pro work better with my Samsung phone than Samsung's own ear buds.Issues:1. My right ear bud just stopped charging and connecting. I've charged, pulled the bud in and out of the case, pushed it in, re-paired, reset, and I cannot get the right ear bud to charge or connect. Just period, right now, after days of messing with it, the right ear bud doesn't work. I've had these buds for like 3 months.2. Pairing doesn't always activate. Generally, to pair, you open the case and hold the pair button for a few seconds, and it's supposed to enter pairing mode. Unfortunately, with these buds, that process has not worked on several occasions. I noticed this issue seems to happen more often when the buds connect to a previously paired device, and then you try to pair to a new device. Probably a software bug, but common, these are the Pros, and should not have these issues. For comparison, I've never had a pairing issue with my Airpods Pros, Apple or Android device.3. Mic/voice dropouts. On several occasions, when answering a phone call, or doing a Teams call, the audio would work, but the mic would not. The bluetooth settings would say everything is connected (both audio and mic), but for whatever reason, the mic-audio would not work. Probably another software setting, but it happened to me on a couple important work-related calls, and it's one of those things that really makes you lose confidence in the buds. I've had this happen once with the Airpods Pros, but only once.Good things:1. As a techy person, I really liked the LED lights on the blade portion of the buds.2. When it works, big caveat, when it works, the integrated world of Samsung devices is nice (e.g. auto-switch between devices, battery levels, customization, etc).3. I like the look of the case and buds better than the Apply buds.Would I buy again? No. If you're debating between the Samsung buds Pro and the Apply buds Pro, even if you're an Android user, I would recommend going with the Apple Buds Pro.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: Awesome bass. Definitely worth every penny

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024
review_text: I have tried a handful of Bluetooth ear buds and have used airpods pro 2 as my daily drivers for the past 2yrs. These sound better and from what I can tell the mics do a better job at noise isolation. There are things that samsung really should change on the next iteration of these. The way they seat into the case could have been better, the angle they sit at I have to turn the ear buds 180 degrees to put them in my ear when pulling them from the case. The triangular shaped stems make it so you have to put them back into the case a certain angle and requires more effort from the user versus with a rounded stem you just get the stem partialy in the case and then the built in magnets helping get them orientated and seated correctly. When adjusting them in my ears, I almost every time hit the haptic button built into the stems that pauses the music. They should have put more thought into the colors. I intentionally didn't go with the white because I didn't want them to look like my previous airpods but the silver color with the blue and red tabs on the bottom makes them look pretty chintzy. At a $250 MSRP directly competing with airpods, it's very disappointing that the case doesn't have the ultra-wideband built in to be able to use the radar like feature from your phone to find them. The find my feature relies on the buds being out of the case and reliant on chirping noise from the buds to find them. I had to buy a samsung smart tag to attach to the protective case carabiner so I could have this feature. Volume is great on these, they are as loud, if not slightly louder then airpods. I find that battery life on these are excellent. With ANC on the battery is around 6hrs and way longer if you have ANC off.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: It works great! I bought it refurbished and it definitely an upgrade from the original Buds Pro! Better noise canceling, sound and better design as well! It does work with older models such as the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE. The case fells so nice but can easily get scratched if left in pocket with car keys and other hard objects. Battery life is not bad at all, as both buds can last 2+ hours or more, even if you you use it longer and the battery dies out, it charges super quickly. The case should charge the earbuds 3 around full battery cycles, more or less. I've read reviews  about the bad comfort from the Buds 3 so I chose this one, refurbished. Good as new!

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: What you should know!These are the best buds I have used and also my second pair.  I don't like the stem on the buds pro3 and have read the sound isn't as good.  These buds are awesome!  I am sure if you find some in good condition you will agree.Tech KingsThis is the seller which I purchased these from.  They were clean and pound just as hard as my first pair.  They come with a short charging cord and only 2 sets of tips.  Was a little disappointed about that as my first came with 3 pair.Be smart when cleaning!I use these a lot!  That being said these buds get dirty. Be easy when cleaning them!  I ruined my first pair and had to order replacements.  I would do so again in a heartbeat as I love them.  I hope the pro buds 4 do away with the stupid stem design and go back to this compact style.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: If you just want something that works with Amazon Music on your phone then this will work. It's refurbished so it's just okay and it won't compare to a brand new SGBP2. Sound quality is decent (kinda like the first edition) but for some reason,I can't adjust volume by tapping the buds which I could do with my other SGBP2 I got from Samsung Store. Also,I didn't get extra earbuds for other sizes but it's a good thing that the one that came with it was perfect fit. So yeah,we're just getting our money's worth.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: Bought on 02/15/25 at about 11:55pm and it came fast...it was here by 02/16/25 between 8-10am.I'm coming from using the "Samsung Galaxy Buds+" and "Samsung Galaxy Buds2" which i have had for 5 and 4yrs+ respectively. I love to stick with things and i love comfort and i don't like the unpredictability of new things.My Samsung Buds2 tip got spoiled plus it's no longer as loud, while working out last week, the left side of my Buds+ went out. I did everything i could and even called Samsung to no avail. I have small ears and so i really loved my previous buds. I was really apprehensive towards these ones being that they don't look as compact as the last ones I own. When i got them, they did not have the original box, so i was even more apprehensive and thought to myself I will surely be returning this. BUT, upon opening it, it was clean and no visible damage or anything.So far, the sound quality blew my mind immediately i put it on, I got chills. Also, upon taking a picture of it on my S24+ to leave this review, it automatically gave me option to pair(interesting). I hadn't had it on for long before the battery ran out but i can't comment on this because i do not know if it was fully charge(update later on this).The fit is also something I'll have to get used to as my ears are small(I loved the fit of the Buds+ better). It also has some settings that are not available on the other sets i have such as-"Voice Detect"(reduces volume if it detects your voice incase you are having a conversation while listening so you don't have to take them off)-"Head tracking"(adjusts volume according to how you turn your head)-Neck Stretch reminders(incase you bend your head too much looking at your screen).Now i waiting a few days to post this review( 03/02/25). I'd have to say although i really love the sound quality, but i have to constantly adjust it in my ears alot more than i did my last two especially when i go jogging/running. Literally every few seconds. Annoying...but I don't think I'll return it because i don't have a better audio option for the price point at this time. Also, it doesn't have the volume touch controls like the previous ones.07/06/25: Update.This is a long overdue update. Now i get why it was on refurbished sale. The earbuds are horrible for calls which are very important for me. No one can here me on the phone if i use them which is pretty annoying since it was one of the most important reasons i bought them.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I had a Buds Pro I got a few years ago, and then I guess they fell out of my pocket while I was out because they're gone. So I got these.Fit feels a little better than the Pros did, but I'm probably imagining that. Connects to the wear app easily and well, allowing control such as changing from surround sound to ambient sounds. Love that you can turn off touch controls. My ears are garbage at holding buds in so I constantly have to push them back in. (It's not an incorrectly sized ear-tip. Large is way too big, medium doesn't get a perfect grip. Broken ears.)I will admit I haven't tried the call option, as I seldom get calls, and haven't at all while wearing them. I do know the original Pros worked great though. Just tested it calling someone. Both of us noticed no sound issues. They didn't know I wasn't using my phone and they sounded normal to me.I am kinda sad color-wise. The original Pros had a like, glittery-ness to them, the the buds themselves were mirror-like. These are just a plain pastel purple, which I still like but don't think is as pretty. However, I think part of that is the material on the outside of the box is more tacky. The originals were smooth, and I imagine the change was to keep them from easily falling out of your pocket. The biggest issue is, if you have the white or purple, they smudge visibly easier.I had hoped that the find your earbuds option was for if you misplaced the whole thing, but it's simply for if you drop a bud and cant find it, which is disappointing.I can't give a good estimate on battery life. I just spent the past twenty minutes in a call and  the buds went down 5% I don't use them a lot because I'm disabled so I don't go out much, and I've never looked at the battery% once I was done. I will say my box is still at 21% after using them for probably around 15-18 hours, so that's not bad at least.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds w/ Noise Cancelling
review_text: It works great! I bought it refurbished and it definitely an upgrade from the original Buds Pro! Better noise canceling, sound and better design as well! It does work with older models such as the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE. The case fells so nice but can easily get scratched if left in pocket with car keys and other hard objects. Battery life is not bad at all, as both buds can last 2+ hours or more, even if you you use it longer and the battery dies out, it charges super quickly. The case should charge the earbuds 3 around full battery cycles, more or less. I've read reviews  about the bad comfort from the Buds 3 so I chose this one, refurbished. Good as new!

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: About 5 years ago Samsung released the legendary Galaxy Buds Live in August of 2020I was fortunate enough to be able to receive buds live with an s22 ultra from Samsung in 2021, those buds have been my daily driver's since thenWe are talking all day long from work, to the ride home and throughout my night and even through sleep on some occasionsFinding a replacement for the buds live is challenging, I was not lucky enough to grab a new pair at retail before they were discontinued and my old buds have various issues between charging to audio quality but now is the time they get replacedThe new buds 3 were a somewhat confusing decision only due to Amazon having a separate more expensive version with a two year warranty and some issue with shipping but whateverAfter my first use I am very blown away, I have only turned them up to about 1/3 the max volume but they are noticeably louder than my buds live which have to be turned up until two notches past the volume warning to hear under certain circumstancesThe fit in the ear is much better due to the larger design and the speaker hole is also bigger so the sound isn't so cannedThe price was ok about 100 but I can't speak for the battery life or anything else yetIf there was one thing I don't like it's the stem controls but in comparison to the buds live with a touch sensor on the exterior that always didn't function correctly... Even with touches blocked it would still hang up calls so I had to use good lock to make a custom event where if I double tap the power button it enabled touches blocked but I had to do this Everytime I switch earphones or if I go from a video to answering a call it would re enable touchesI paired my buds with a locking case from Spigen. Not happy that you have to glue the top on but Spigen gives you a spare adhesive strip and so far it doesn't seem like it will come apart easily

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: These headphones are the best I've ever used.They have great audio quality, are very easy to use, and the battery can last all night.They are also very durable; I've dropped them several times and they still work perfectly.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: The Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 were described as brand new. I am very pleased with my purchase as they function perfectly due to their new condition. They connect via Bluetooth, feature noise cancellation, and are very comfortable to use. Additionally, they are easy to pair with the Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus. These Samsung buds are of high quality and operate flawlessly.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: TLDR; These are great, even at MSRP. I wish I bought these when they came out. Sale prices make these a no brainer, especially for those that don't want rubber tips in their ears. Battery life is decent and all play/pause and volume swipe functions work in Windows 11 without the app installed.This will include comparisons to AirPods 4 ANC:I've been using AirPods 4 on my PC for a while and they've worked fine.  My personal gripe is that the stem doesn't have the volume swipe gestures like the AirPods Pro 2/3.  Maybe Apple will add this for AirPods 5 in the future, but guess what these have now. That's right, I can now adjust volume as well.Fitment will depend of the person, like most earbuds, but these feel just slightly larger in general so in my case, they fit fine.Sound quality seems fine.  I'm no audiophile but these sound good with a hint more bass than the Airpods but I believe this can be adjusted.Wireless charging works like it should and I've got some Ringke cases on the way to get them to latch on to magsage chargers.Note, there is software for Windows 11 already and it looks basic but it seemingly gives you a better idea of the buds battery life instead of the built in Windows bluetooth page staying at 100% until you reconnect them to reflect the actual battery life. And speaking of, battery life is good.  Granted these are brand new but they seemingly went the full 5-6 hours when switching noise cancelling on and off.I initially thought these had a transparency mode but looks like these simply don't.  So the Airpods 4 ANC get a slight edge, but I'm taking the volume control over that.  I would love for these to come out in a variety of colors, not just because options would be nice, but since I've got two pairs, the different colors would make it much more obvious which pair goes where. That's another thing the Ringke cases will help with.Well done Samsung.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: Great sound quality but if you dont have average sized ears, they dont fit.. they are always falling out of my ears

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: I use these daily and have not been disappointed. I work construction and go to the gym. They have held up through the rain, sweat, dirt, drops off of ladders and just keep working, durable is an understatement. They connect right to my phone soon as I pull them out of the case. Volume and clarity is great. Sleek design and don't fall out of my ear.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: I dont agree with the reviews on here. Especially the one saying his Airpods worked better on his Samsung than these. Not sure what went on there but it's quite the opposite with me. These work 10x better with my z fold 7 than my airpods. All my issues went away and the audio is really good on these. Loud and clear with a little bit of bass. Not much.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones
review_text: The sound quality is amazing and overall quality is good. They connect well to my phone and the setup was very easy. Charge time is decent. The biggest downfall for me is that they don‚Äôt stay in my ears as well as normal earbuds.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: The Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro is the epitome of an amazing truly wireless earphone journey that users can ask for discerning sound quality, connection, and features.Upon unpacking these slim, shiny earphones that are the color of silver you will definitely notice the amount of effort Samsung has put into designing them. The redesign of the comfort fit means that these buds will stay intact even during the most rigorous workouts or prolonged listening to of music. The design of the headphones follows the contours of the head enhancing on noise cancellation thus providing the user with toch sound without interruption.When it comes to sound, and you will be hard pressed to find a better set of true wireless earphones than the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro. The 3D audio technology involved with the earbuds puts you in an immersive and spacious sound field when you listen to music, movies or podcasts. The sound optimization which is done through AI enhances the sound to meet your specific preference as a user. The end product is clear and dynamic sound that is at par with wired headphones‚Äô experience.This is complemented by the noise cancellation function integrated into these earphones. Just like all Samsung‚Äôs gadgets the noise cancelling feature is very much advanced and there was no interference of outside noise when I listened to my audio content. Even when all you need is to listen to your music/library, or if you have a work/business to attend to, you can exercise the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro noise cancellation feature.But more is still on store, in the lines of innovation. The real-time built-in interpreter will ensure that you don‚Äôt leave a meeting or during your foreign trip stranded for words during the meeting. It employs an AI algorithm that allows you to translate up to 16 languages from the location of your travel to avoid communication barriers.The other fact that differentiates the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro from another is the battery power of this accessory. To provide a small overall volume, these compact earbuds are equipped with efficient design and mighty battery that allows recording 29 hours of playback time. This means you can listen to any type of audio content for days without having to plug your earphones to a charger.With regards to connectivity, it‚Äôs got simple pairing and smart switching between devices in line with Bluetooth 5.3. If you have any other Samsung device, the company‚Äôs well-integrated experience guarantees that your Galaxy Buds 3 Pro will always be waiting for connection.Finally, a 2-year warranty exclusively available on Amazon also means that your beautific investment will serve shelter for potential flaws in the device.If you want to buy truly wireless earbuds, the Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro has that feature down pat, robust sound quality, additional bells and whistles, and ergonomic design of the earbuds. If you intend to find lose a pair of wireless earbuds that may serve your active lifestyle whilst providing the best sound quality, Galaxy Buds 3 Pro should definitely fit the bill. You won't be disappointed.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: Actually worth the price. The pinch function works great, the ANC is great, the volume is spectacular, and they fit in my ear for my 6 mile run today and didn't fall out even remotely (despite that i sweat a lot). The case is compact and everything is very well built, although the case feels a bit "plastic-y". Just be cautious with that. They are pretty comfortable as well, the M size nibs fit for me. The connectivity is of course very quick and took me less than a minute to set it up right. No fooling around with EQs necessarry either- for most. They sound fantastic out the box. If you're a bit of an audiophile like me, you'll appreciate the experience for all genres. I suspect if you like a lot of hip hop/rap/pop/electronic music you may want to hike up the bass and scoop the mids a bit. And for rock/metal/country/jazz/classical these will sound great as is but i lowered the 4k a bit and boosted the 63 and 125 to give it a slight bump in bass still for personal preference. Highly recommend overall, especially if you have a Samsung as it fits well into the ecosystem. No comment on battery life as this is just 1 good day of use,  but I'm assuming it will work for my purposes and just need to charge up daily/every other day (if that? Maybe better?) which is okay either way.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds
review_text: I‚Äôve used almost every iteration of the Galaxy Buds, and the Buds 3 Pro are a massive step up in terms of hardware. The soundstage is wider and the call clarity is the best I‚Äôve experienced on a pair of stems.The Pros:The Fit: They feel more secure than the previous 'bean' or 'bud' shapes. I can wear them for hours without ear fatigue.ANC Performance: The Active Noise Canceling is top-tier. It easily drowns out low-frequency hums like plane engines or office chatter.Sound Quality: Crisp highs and a punchy bass that doesn't feel muddy.The One Con: If you like to sing along to your music, turn off the Voice Detect/Adaptive mode. The AI is so sensitive that it thinks I‚Äôm trying to start a conversation whenever I sing a lyric, and it immediately lowers the music volume. It‚Äôs a great feature for an office, but a total buzzkill for solo jam sessions.Verdict: Incredible hardware. Just be prepared to dive into the Wearable app settings to customize the AI features to your liking.

product: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 FE (2025) True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds

The redesign of the comfort fit means that these buds will stay intact even during the most rigorous workouts or prolonged listening to of music. The design of the headphones follows the contours of the head enhancing on noise cancellation thus providing the user with toch sound without interruption.When it comes to sound, and you will be hard pressed to find a better set of true wireless earphones than the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro.
