product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: These work great. The sound quality is great & I love the noise canceling feature. Though you do need the Samsung Wear app to control them - activate / deactivate the noise canceling feature. Since I keep my phone's Bluetooth turned off, I love the feature where after you take the buds out of their case and put them in your ear, you get a message on your phone asking if you want to connect them. I don't have to manually turn on the Bluetooth. The only drawback it seems is that I can't really use them with my Samsung TV. Although they connect and I can hear the sound, after a bit the sound starts to make digital distortions. But, no such issues when connected to the phone. The battery life is great and lasts up to ~6 hours on the buds. The case can charge the buds a few times before it itself requires charging. The Wear app shows the percentage of charge remaining for both the buds as well as the case. And unlike some other types of buds, these are essy to take out of the case.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: The Galaxy Buds FE are a great value if you want solid sound and active noise canceling without paying flagship prices. The ANC works surprisingly well for everyday noise like fans, engines, and background chatter. Audio quality is clear with good bass, and call quality has been reliable for me.They‚Äôre comfortable enough for long wear and stay in place during daily use. Battery life has been solid, and pairing with Samsung devices is quick and seamless. The app controls are simple and responsive. Overall, these feel well built and dependable for the price.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: All I can say is wow. These have to be the best earbuds at this price point by far! Compared to the Airpod Pro's 2 and 3, you are getting by far the best bang for your buck here. Awesome bass and great highs and mids (the mids could be marginally better as opposed to Pro's 2 and 3) but not enough to justify 3x the price of these. Really nice that you can turn off ANC and check both earbud and cae charge level through your phone. My favorite part of these buds is that you don't have to have Bluetooth on to recognize they are near, your phone will automatically ask if you'd like to pair when opening the case, and switches Bluetooth on for you!

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: The SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Fan Edition (FE) SM-R400 are fantastic! The sound quality is crisp and clear, the fit is comfortable for long listening, and the battery lasts a long time. Easy to connect and use with my phone. A great choice for anyone looking for reliable wireless earbuds! My only negative remark is that it does not support wireless charging.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: Love them I have small ears and they fit great on the smallest bud. Would get another pair when I need to replace them.  I like how they fit all the way in and nothing hangs out in the front. I can keep my hair down and no one knows I even have them on especially when at work. Great sound and function.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: I bought the SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Fan Edition (FE), and let me just say, these are NOT your average earbuds. These are the superhero of sound, the Beyonc√© of Bluetooth, the James Bond of noise-canceling‚Äîbasically, they‚Äôre everything I never knew I needed in my life, and now I can‚Äôt live without them.The Pros:Active Noise-Canceling? More Like Active Life-Changing ‚Äì I thought noise-canceling was just a ‚Äúcool feature,‚Äù but NO. These babies don‚Äôt just block out the noise, they block out your ENTIRE LIFE. Kids yelling? Gone. Your neighbor‚Äôs dog barking at 3 AM? Not even a whisper. The sound of your own thoughts? Who needs them? These buds don‚Äôt let anything in‚Ä¶ except for your favorite jams.Earbuds that Fit Like They‚Äôre Meant to Be ‚Äì If you‚Äôve ever bought earbuds that feel like they‚Äôre trying to escape your ears mid-jog, then you know the struggle. These? Fit like a glove (except for your ears, obviously, but you get the point). No slipping, no adjusting, no awkwardly trying to pop them back in when you‚Äôre about to give a TED Talk on the importance of ‚ÄúListening to Your Favorite Playlist‚Äù (seriously, these fit that snug).Sound Quality That Makes You Feel Like You‚Äôre in a Concert Hall ‚Äì Every note is crisp, every beat is beyond satisfying, and I swear I could hear the microwave beep in a whole new way. These Galaxy Buds make your favorite music sound like it was made in a recording studio with actual magic. If you want to feel like a rockstar while doing your laundry, these are the buds for you.Touch Controls Are So Futuristic, I Feel Like I‚Äôm In a Sci-Fi Movie ‚Äì I didn‚Äôt know I needed touch controls until I had them. Want to change the song? Just tap the side. Volume too loud? Swipe down like you're controlling the volume of your future robot overlords. I can practically feel my IQ going up with every tap.Battery Life That Lasts Longer Than My Attention Span ‚Äì I‚Äôve used these buds for hours and hours, and they still had juice left. It‚Äôs like they run on pure, unadulterated energy. I‚Äôve forgotten to charge them overnight and still had a full day of listening ahead of me. The only thing they can‚Äôt do is remind me to charge my phone‚Ä¶ but that‚Äôs probably coming in the next edition.The Cons:I Might Become a Music Snob ‚Äì I never realized how bad my old earbuds were until I put these in. Now, I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄúOh, this song was supposed to sound like that?‚Äù It‚Äôs like hearing your favorite song for the first time all over again. Prepare to get snobby about sound quality and turn your nose up at anything less than ‚Äúactive noise-canceling perfection.‚ÄùOnce You Put Them In, You Might Never Leave Your House ‚Äì Seriously, I put these in while cleaning, and suddenly, I was two hours deep into a podcast and forgot I had even started the dishes. These buds make doing mundane tasks feel like you're in a high-budget music video. Be careful‚Äîyou might forget how to exist in the real world.Conclusion:The SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Fan Edition (FE) have elevated my audio game in a way I didn‚Äôt know was possible. They cancel noise, they amplify sound, and they make me feel like I could conquer the world (or at least my to-do list) while jamming out to my favorite tunes.If you want earbuds that make you feel like a VIP at a private concert, buy these. If you want to block out your neighbor‚Äôs questionable karaoke sessions, buy these. And if you just want to listen to your Spotify playlist like it was meant to be heard‚Äîyou guessed it‚Äîbuy these.TL;DR: These are the best earbuds I‚Äôve ever had, and I now believe they might be secretly part of a government experiment to make us all smarter, more productive, and significantly cooler. Highly recommend.

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: I'm a huge researcher when purchasing items online and I'm happy for that with these earbuds. In my opinion, these are a steal because they have the same quality sound, and noise canceling as the $300 ones at a fraction of the price. They stay perfectly in my ears and the battery life is over 6 hours even when listening at higher volumes nonstop. Save some money and go for these. You won't be disappointed

product: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400
review_text: Purchased for my daughter.  She has used them a lot and really likes them.  Good sound quality and fit.  She likes them better than the original Samsung buds she had prior to these.  Build quality is solid.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio MOMENTUM True Wireless 3 Earbuds -Bluetooth In-Ear Headphones for Music and Calls with ANC
review_text: So I waffled between the big 3 (sony, bose and these) b4 pulling the trigger on these since they went on sale. I originally thought I would try them, return them and then try the others, but these are so good for my needs, I am just keeping them.The good (which is almost everything):First and foremost, the sound is amazing. Its clear/airy has a very wide dynamic range and when properly sealed has plenty of bass and clear highs. The in app eq works well do dial in the sound to suit you. I saw some reviews about these not playing quiet enough, but I've not had that issue, the volume will get as quiet as you want them to. On the loud side, they can get WAY LOUD (thankfully). so many of these newer buds artificially limit the volume (probably to avoid being sued) its super annoying. These don't do that and will get as loud as you could ever need.I've only received a couple of calls on them so far, but call quality seems good to me and my wife could hear me just fine.Noise cancellation is very solid. I'm a woodworker and am in the shop most of the day everyday and these are dramatically better than any other buds I've used and even most of the over ear versions like the 3m work tunes and isotunes (plus way more comfortable). I use a lot of loud equipment like the planer, table saw, miter saw etc along with a shop vac, dust collector and large air compressor and these mute them all to low enough levels that I find myself now turning the music volume down a lot from previous buds. Best of all with these kinds of noises, you cannot tell the noise cancellation turns on, its just there. Turn transparency mode on and off and you'll quickly realize just how much its doing. The only time I hear the anc activate is when I'm using the air nailer. that pop, pop, sound gets muted, but you can hear the anc kick in when its doing it. Otherwise you don't even know its working, things are just quiet.If your view of noise cancellation is to be in the Cone of Silence, these might not be for you. I can still hear my machines running (barely) but they are perfect for the balance for me between hearing things are running for safety and quiet enough not to be distracting, even with multiple different machines running at the same time.transparency mode is solid, and quick with 1 tap on the left bud. It can pause music or leave it playing depending on how you set it up which is a nice feature. My last buds didn't have that, and I'm really enjoying that feature.Comfort is great. I had to switch to the large silicone ear piece and sealing ring, but aside from that they fit well and stay in place while working. I cant speak to how they would work when exercising or running, but even with me bending, stooping, walking around etc, they have never come loose. They're so light you forget about them.Lastly, the app is great with easy to use settings, pairing is quick and reliable and once you learn how to tap the buds to play/pause/turn on transparency mode etc, controls are easy to use and responsiveThe bad, mainly in the mildy irritating category:firmware update takes Forever. I'm not sure why it takes 20+ minutes to update the firmware on these little guys, but it does. Seems like they could do better.The "Bass Boost" is actually a more of a treble mute. while it does boost the bass a little, what it mostly does is mute the highs to make the bass more noticeable. turn the bass boost on/off a few times while music is playing and you'll quickly hear what I mean. You can eq the treble back in, but someone like Sennheiser should have a better solution than that with their software.The bluetooth range is not great with my Samsung S21 Ultra. With my old Jaybird Tarah pro's which are several years old, I could leave my phone in the garage and walk to the back yard and stay connected. with these I barely get to the end of driveway b4 they start cutting out (maybe 30ish feet or so). Not a big deal for me since I'm almost always near the phone when working, but if you are routinely farther away, might be something to consider.All in all they have been a great upgrade for me and I'm definitely hanging on to them.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio MOMENTUM True Wireless 3 Earbuds -Bluetooth In-Ear Headphones for Music and Calls with ANC
review_text: I never do reviews of products, but in this case I will because of the price of this product. In the past I bought  cheap earbuds. Mostly because I use them for the gym. In the car I usually connect my phone to the radio to listen to the music, so no reason to use while driving. The most expensive brand that I bought was the DR Dre powerbeats. Decent sound at a decent price and great for the gym because they have the hook and will not fall off when exercising. But almost immediately they started having issues with charging. So then I got the Jabra elite 75T. I still have them, no issues with charging, great Bluetooth connectivity, decent active noise cancellation and decent sound. Im happy with them and still work good for the price. I paid $179 in amazon. But I wanted more regarding the sound quality so I started looking at reviews on You Tube and found the Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 3. Great sound, decent ANC, decent battery and connectivity. I compared them to Sony, Bose and Jabra and decided on the Sennheiser. Well, here we go....-Sound is amazing, very happy with them- Battery is as expected, I imagine base on the size of the buds, and sound they are putting out.- Wind noise will affect this buds, even with the software that you install will not be able to adjust and get most of the wind noise out. The Jabras do a better job at that-Connectivity..... hahaha, In the gym I had issues when my phone was on the floor and I walked away for about 20 feet to get the wipes to wipe the chair and I had several machines in the way, pretty weird that I would loose connectivity, not cool-Then this really started to get on my nerves, while using the buds I started to get some weird noises, like some interference and after a few visits to YT, I found out the culprit, there is a very small membrane between the rubber attachment that goes into tour ear and the earbud. I have to remove them, clean them and very carefully reglue them in place. Problem solved for a few weeks.  Then the problem came back, I just remove them completely and the high pitch noise was gone-This is the nail in the coffin... I bought this in October 2022, in less that a year the left bud stop working, will not charge, cleaned the connections and nothing. Will not charge at all. Right bud continued working and charging normally. I used it for answering calls inside my car while driving in the military base I work. Its all hands free device inside the base. Unfortunately a few days ago it also stopped charging at all. Same problem as the left.So , my advice is do not buy, base on my experience and also others having the same issues on the internet.My Jabras are still going strong, not as good quality sound but they do the job.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: These were recommended to me by a friend and WOW. I have never used real noise-canceling headphones before and these make such a difference for school. The app is easy to use so I can just check to see if the noise-canceling feature is on or not, and turn it on/off easily. Very much worth the money if you are in noisy areas and are having trouble focusing. I did notice that they're best for humming ambient noise (machinery, laundry, fans). You definitely can still hear conversations around you, but they are much softer. One thing I'll do there is play white noise through the headphones with the noise canceling function on and that makes a huge difference.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: Haven't had any issues with the earbuds and their promised features.- Great fit in ear but bulky out of ear as you might expect so not great for sports.- sounds quality and customization is phenomenal- never have found battery to be a problem despite using frequently throughout multiple daysOnly feature I'd like, which is more a problem with my phone software, is an override to the default audio control in the sennheiser app. I generally find the lowest volume to still be loud and am currently using a volume equalizer at -15 dB. The audio balance in the earbuds has no audible loss in clarity and balance at this range too.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: So I ordered this from a refurbisher in the hopes that, being of Sennheiser quality, they would meet the standard; they don‚Äôt. Since I‚Äôve gotten these headphones, charging has been a downright pain in the backside. It will say it‚Äôs fully charged, but when you put them in your ear, it will tell you to charge. They will randomly not connect to both ears. I paid $200 for a useless product. Just buy direct. I‚Äôm not going to change this review, bc I‚Äôm not going to waste my time returning this product to a company that couldn‚Äôt get it right the first time. Atrocious

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: My hearing is fair‚Ä¶however,I‚Äôve yet to find bluetooth buds loud enough for my liking. These are no exception‚Ä¶except these have features to compensate for that.The SMART CONTROL app, used in conjunction with the buds, is a vital tool in customizing my listening pleasure.The ‚Äòtap‚Äô features are numerous and each bud has its own settings, but it is customizable via SMART CONTROL. The ‚Äòtap‚Äô feature can be disabled entirely if need be.The touch is very sensitive, so much so that removing them or stowing away the buds to the case can easily change settings.Ergonomically they are nice. They twist into ear and stay put thanks to the custom tips and grommets.The initial connecting to phone was a little challenging. Without SMART CONTROL, I‚Äôm not sure it would even be possible.Over all, they are well thought-out in design, function and aesthetic.After a few months, I‚Äôm wishing I had not gotten RENEWED. It‚Äôs been quirky.The right hand bud will only charge with case open.It would be great if the charging case was connected to the app via bluetooth without having to remove buds, connect, then re-cradle the buds.The charging is confusing and not user friendly.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: Most expensive set of earbuds I've owned, but the quality is out of this world for how small and light they are. Surprisingly deep bass available for these tiny buds after you mess with the equalizer settings and the built in noise cancelation and transparency are top notch. Battery life is pretty decent at about 4-5 hours of consistent play with noise canceling Active and works beautifully even in a loud automotive shop. Fits nice and snug in the ear if you follow how to put them in correctly in the manual and don't threaten to fall out. Well worth the investment and Sennheiser offers replacement parts on their website

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: Perfect.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: Love these. They have a great features.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: All that came was a charger cable. Absolutely scammed after waiting all day for a box full of nothing.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: I compared three earbuds in the same bracket:- Sony LinkBuds Fit- Bose QuietComfort Ultra- Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4Sony LinkBuds Fitüüä‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜThe tap controls are highly unreliable. When tapping a bus twice (carefully, directly on the earbud), it might register zero taps, one tap, or two taps. Thus, your two taps will randomly do nothing, pause the music, or skip the track. Frustrating. I perceived no improvement on sound quality over my old $50 Anker Space A40s. Furthermore, Sony's setup app is malware: it hides among the legal agreements an "Agree" to data sharing. I don't know what Wirecutter is smoking; I liked nothing about these.Bose QuietComfort Ultraüüäüüäüüä‚òÜ‚òÜI was so close to loving these. The noise cancelling is incredible. The "Immersive Mode" brings music to life in a way I hadn't experienced with earbuds. However, the deal killer was that the earbuds would disconnect from my phone every few minutes. This is apparently a common issue. Additionally, the tap controls are better than Sony's, but still bad: you're supposed to slide your finger along it to change the volume, but this often registers as a tap. All this said, you might nevertheless want to try these with your phone and cross your fingers that they can stay connected, because the noise cancelling and sound is that good. If they work for you, you've won the lottery, and you're a lucky bastard. Odds are, though, it will be glitchy and unreliable for you, too.Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4üüäüüäüüäüüäüüäGreat, reliable tap controls. Noise cancelling and sound is not quite as good as the Bose QuietComfort, but still sounds great. Stays connected. Doesn't force you to use a crappy app. Comfortable. Has a premium look to it. Ultimately, you want earbuds that sound good, stay connected, and aren't frustrating to use. This is it.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: This is my 2nd pair of Sennheiser earbuds and I will never buy any other brand. My last pair lasted a few years and that was with me using them practically at full blast every single day at work from 8-5 so the price is well worth it imo.My favorite thing about this brand is how customizable they are in both the fit and sound.My ears are an odd shape so it's hard for me to find earbuds that fit while also not being bulky and feeling like they're going to constantly fall out. The different tip and wing sizes they give are perfect for finding the right fit for any ear shape so they're comfortable enough to leave in all day.On the app you can also customize the sound you want based on your own desires or music style you listen to as well which is perfect for me. The transparency mode on these is also amazing so I can leave them in all day and just pause my music when I want to talk to someone and not deal with taking them out. And the battery life these things have is amazing enough for me to do just that!10/10 recommend these!

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: Let me start off with the pros.They sound great, and their app lets you personalize the audio however you wish. The fit is snug and the earbuds never fell out. They also last quite a while before needed to be recharged. And the quality LOOKS great.That‚Äôs about where the pros end, and the cons begin.First off they don‚Äôt sound much better than AirPod Pros, and yet they‚Äôre $50 more. Then comes the worst part - the reliability. I had these earbuds for roughly 2 months before they started having issues, specifically the right earbud. At first it would struggle connecting and wouldn‚Äôt charge at random point even though the left one was doing just fine. Then, roughly around the month and a half mark, the right earbud stopped working completely. Would not charge, play music, or even connect. It was completely dead. At around the 2 month mark, the left earbud followed suit. So I sent in the earbuds to one of their warranty claim centers, and it has been a downward spiral ever since.I‚Äôve have dealt with customer support many times before, but this has to be the worst customer support I‚Äôve ever dealt with. Here‚Äôs why:First off, finding their support number is not easy, as Sennheiser does not have a support center now that they are owned by Sonova. And to find their RMA website is even more difficult. Next, I never received any updates on the status‚Äînot even an email confirming receipt. I called shortly after the earbuds were expected to be delivered to check if they even received it and was told that they did but the facility is ‚Äúoffline‚Äù meaning they will only email you once the package has been sent back to you. On top of that, they informed me that it would take roughly 2 weeks (10 business days all in all) to get everything dealt with. I said okay and moved on.That wasn‚Äôt the end of it.Sennheiser finally emails me to ask me for proof of purchase, to which I quickly reply with a screenshot of the purchase details from Amazon. In the email it said that if I did not reply within 5 business days of the email, they would send back the earbuds. Now, 4 business days later, I receive an email saying that the receipt did not the proof of purchase details necessary, giving me less than a day to deal with this.Last thing to note, I did some research when I started seeing these issues and it appears that the malfunction I had with my earbuds has been around for a few years now, ever since their 2nd series of these earbuds. It‚Äôs clear that the issue hasn‚Äôt been fixed by Sennheiser since then.Overall, I would not recommend these by a long shot. I always heard everyone praise Sennheiser‚Äôs headphones and earbuds so I thought it would be a smarter buy than AirPod Pros. Unfortunately I am now regretting that decision as the AirPod Pros would‚Äôve lasted me far longer and Apple support would have dealt with any issues much more efficiently than these people have.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Black Copper
review_text: I compared three earbuds in the same bracket:- Sony LinkBuds Fit- Bose QuietComfort Ultra- Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4Sony LinkBuds Fitüüä‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜThe tap controls are highly unreliable. When tapping a bus twice (carefully, directly on the earbud), it might register zero taps, one tap, or two taps. Thus, your two taps will randomly do nothing, pause the music, or skip the track. Frustrating. I perceived no improvement on sound quality over my old $50 Anker Space A40s. Furthermore, Sony's setup app is malware: it hides among the legal agreements an "Agree" to data sharing. I don't know what Wirecutter is smoking; I liked nothing about these.Bose QuietComfort Ultraüüäüüäüüä‚òÜ‚òÜI was so close to loving these. The noise cancelling is incredible. The "Immersive Mode" brings music to life in a way I hadn't experienced with earbuds. However, the deal killer was that the earbuds would disconnect from my phone every few minutes. This is apparently a common issue. Additionally, the tap controls are better than Sony's, but still bad: you're supposed to slide your finger along it to change the volume, but this often registers as a tap. All this said, you might nevertheless want to try these with your phone and cross your fingers that they can stay connected, because the noise cancelling and sound is that good. If they work for you, you've won the lottery, and you're a lucky bastard. Odds are, though, it will be glitchy and unreliable for you, too.Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4üüäüüäüüäüüäüüäGreat, reliable tap controls. Noise cancelling and sound is not quite as good as the Bose QuietComfort, but still sounds great. Stays connected. Doesn't force you to use a crappy app. Comfortable. Has a premium look to it. Ultimately, you want earbuds that sound good, stay connected, and aren't frustrating to use. This is it.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Black Copper
review_text: This is my 2nd pair of Sennheiser earbuds and I will never buy any other brand. My last pair lasted a few years and that was with me using them practically at full blast every single day at work from 8-5 so the price is well worth it imo.My favorite thing about this brand is how customizable they are in both the fit and sound.My ears are an odd shape so it's hard for me to find earbuds that fit while also not being bulky and feeling like they're going to constantly fall out. The different tip and wing sizes they give are perfect for finding the right fit for any ear shape so they're comfortable enough to leave in all day.On the app you can also customize the sound you want based on your own desires or music style you listen to as well which is perfect for me. The transparency mode on these is also amazing so I can leave them in all day and just pause my music when I want to talk to someone and not deal with taking them out. And the battery life these things have is amazing enough for me to do just that!10/10 recommend these!

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: Loving them so far. The sound is great, they fit securely, and the ANC works well. Only things I'm not loving are that there is some buzzing in the ear sometime when I talk or move my jaw, and they are in ANC mode by default when first taken out of the case.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: These are just great. Long lasting battery, perfect fit and the sound is amazing.Bought again after I lost mine on a flight.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: Sound quality good, fitment issues but adjustable with the in ear piece and exterior segment.Case and charging able to see percentage in app, not clear if just looking at the LED (Green, red and flashing for both colors)After a week, one ear bud started to desync. After firmware update and reset no change. Return started because of this.When both earbuds were in use, ANC was good with wind filtering, and decent transparency.If it would've worked with both buds, would've been better but I don't have the time to sit with it to troubleshoot.Attempted fixes to remedy.Reset Bluetooth on phoneReset buds, refreshed firmware, charged fully and let remain in case.Reran fitment test in app.Repaired to device.Nothing. No change still stopped on only one bud.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: They sound great .

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: I am a very picky person when it comes to audio. I want the best. I had a tough time finding a good fitting bud that sounds really good. I ended up sticking with these. Apple AirPods Pro 3 kept falling out, other buds just don't sound good, but these are the ones. Excellent German engineering.They have come a long way since the first generation of these (I got those too). Everything has had significant upgrade (noise cancelling, quality, bluetooth connectivity esp. multi-connection between iPhone and Mac, etc)

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: excellent boost and noise reduction.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: The pair I received wouldn‚Äôt turn on, much less connect to my phone.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds with Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: Hard to give an in-depth review as I only used them for one hour. They performed well for sound  but the noise canceling was mediocre. Tried their EQ and I felt the differentiation wasn‚Äôt as noticeable as I wanted.Overall, they are worth a try on sale, but I would not pay anywhere near the retail cost as they aren‚Äôt earth-shattering.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio CX Plus True Wireless Special Edition
review_text: TL:DR - Best sub-$200 earbuds with great noise canceling, superb sound and better than Samsung Galaxy Buds in every way.I recently had my Samsung Galaxy Buds Plus (purchased fall 2020) finally stop working (thank you, planned obsolescence). In researching for new buds, I began looking outside Samsung as I've always wanted to try the Sony buds, and the new Galaxy Buds Pro do not stay in my ears (I tried my sister's pair). Some YouTube reviews pitted the Sony buds against these, and I knew Senheiser to be a reputable audio brand so I decided to give them a shot. Also, the Sony's were almost 2 years old and hard to find, and the new version was over $200.First, noise canceling: I've never used a pair of noise canceling anything before, so take what I'm about to say with a few grains of salt. My test was to try it in my living room with a TV on normal listening volume, furnace running (mine is fairly noisy, enough to need to crank the TV up a few notches), and normal conversation happening in the kitchen about 15 feet away with no walls separating it. I couldn't hear the furnace at all, the conversation was like a whisper, and the TV was only slightly audible. It was like having it on level 3 or 4 above mute which would be completely inaudible with the furnace running. Now, it did not filter out any harsh or loud noises, like a dog barking or dishes clattering, but the passive isolation is good enough that it wasn't a big deal.Second, sound: Senheiser has a good reputation for a reason. I'm a basshead who routinely listens to hip hop, heavy metal and some electronic music. As a former music major in college and amateur DJ, I also love to fiddle around with equalizers to find the perfect sound for me. Straight out the box with no EQ enabled, the bass is pretty flat and that worried me. But the mids and highs were excellent and FAR better than the Samsungs I used to have. Once I fired up my EQ app (Poweramp EQ on Android), my worries were gone. I was able to tune it so that the bass was like having 2 10-inch subwoofers in my ears without drowning out the rest of the music. I listen to a lot of podcasts as well, and they are excellent for voice-only content as well.Call Quality: Every time I've had a phone call on these buds, no one has complained that I was inaudible in any way.Connection and Range: I can make it further and through more walls/obstructions than my old Galaxy Buds. They perform excellent, and only cut out after about 50 direct feet and 2 home floors comprised of wood, carpet and finally a brick wall on my back patio. The available APTx bluetooth codec makes latency nonexistent.Fit: I mentioned that the new Galaxy Buds didn't fit me, and that was due to me having a larger outer ear shape. The Buds Plus I had used a wing tip that held it in place, but the new ones do not have that. I used the standard medium-sized tips that were installed on the Senheiser buds, and due to their square shape and how deep they go into my ear canal, they fit like a glove. I can headbang to Orbit Culture until I'm dizzy and sweaty and they won't budge.Verdict: you won't find a better pair of buds sub-$200 IMO, and if you don't find the sound to your liking, give a 3rd party EQ app (like Poweramp) a try before returning them.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio CX Plus True Wireless Special Edition
review_text: Loved the 'Black Friday' pricing on these, but love the fit, comfort, & sound quality even more!  I got the Special Edition version of these ear buds.Had been using Galaxy Pro buds that I bought along with my Galaxy phone.  They were decent, but uncomfortable for long periods, & sound quality was just not what I expected from an earbud that expensive & I wish I had realized it soon enough to return the Galaxy Pro buds :(These CX Plus buds on the other hand, are well worth the MSRP!So far only charged them once when I first got them & I have yet to run down the battery.  Longest I've used them continuously at one time so far is about 6.5 hours & usually it's just a couple hours here, a couple hours there.  Most of the time I have the volume pretty low, at about 25% - 30%.  But I do put them back in the case between uses.  I would estimate a total usage so far of about 20 - 22 hours.The only cons for me are:>  the "Transparent Hearing mode" which seems to amplify external sounds just a little bit too much.... if it were scaled back about 10% - 15% I think it might be perfect.> noise cancellation which seems to add background noise that is noticeable in between songs.>  tap controls can be tricky, sometimes when I try to skip to next song, it will instead pause & unpause, and occasionally just pause.EDIT Sept. 17, 2023:  Been using these a LOT lately, I'm hearing stuff in music that I've never heard before , songs I've listened to thousands of times on various systems.  Things like whispered words in the background of some songs, acoustic guitar fills in some songs, noise from guitar picks, short 1 or 2 second guitar overlays on the Right track of a Hendrix song, even potentially unwanted outside sounds captured during recordings, or maybe even those were there deliberately???  I cannot believe all the stuff I've missed in songs over the years, but glad I finally have speakers/headphones good enough that I can finally hear them.Battery life has proven to be phenomenal, possibly because I have no need to play these loudly to block out external sounds like my table saw & dust collector, or when I want to ignore the world around me.  Although I don't track it completely, it seems like battery life for me may surpass the 24 hour mark.  I have done a 5 day stretch without charging and without the ear buds dying,  2 days were 6-8 hours of listening, the rest were 2-4 hours, so I would guess somewhere between 20 & 26 hours.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio CX Plus True Wireless Special Edition
review_text: I bought this product 6 months ago and use it about once a week for a few hours on average. The last time I used it the left side was way more quiet then the right side. I know a lot of the times its because there are debris clogging up the earbud but i actually cleaned it up and the problem persisted. I am surprised and disapointed because sennheiser is usually a good company so there is a chance I just got a bad product. But the thing is, trying to get warrenty service seems to be a nightmare. I need to fill out a form and they request a bunch of info that i do not have such as shipping account number, invoice account number, and purchase order/reference. It states on the site that i must contact support fot the numbers if i do not have it, but there is no way to get in touch with any support reps. The customer service phone number leads to a dial tone and there is no live chat to be found anywhere on their website even though the support page mentions a live chat. Even searching "sennheiser live chat" on google leads to the support page with no live chat. Defintely one of the worst hardware experiences I've ever had so far. The product itself is fine other then it not working. The sound quality is above average and the ANC is decent. The case feels super cheap, the lid feels like it will snap off at any moment. No matter how good the product is, I cannot justify giving it more then 0 stars for something I paid $160 for and only lasting 6 months with low usage.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: If you‚Äôve always had issues with sennheiser‚Äôs fit on your ears with their smaller earbuds, this is the one for you.These are not for working out, for those momentum sport would be the equivalent.They sound almost perfect with the exception of not hitting the highest highs, and the majority of ‚Äúcomplaints‚Äù are probably because they somehow made it so these won‚Äôt hurt your hearing, so the gain is kept in check by its sound processing, which is a bonus honestly.They feature decent noise cancelling and some IPX protection for the buds only for light rain for your commute.Lastly, I think my favorite feature is multipoint connection so you don‚Äôt have to manage what it‚Äôs connected to though you still can manage that too through the app. They also have a wear sensor to pause if you take them out (can be disabled).The only issue for some might be that the touch controls have a very specific activation point which you‚Äôll either love or hate based on how much you have to take them off and how often (it makes it easier to take them off without activating them).Check the other specs to see if it meets your needs, I don‚Äôt use buds to take calls (that‚Äôs a terrible use case for any bud), and for that I‚Äôd recommend something with a boom mic.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Other than being a lil heavy and not fitting exactly, but I never have found any that do, these things get really loud, sync easily, and provide sounds that I don‚Äôt hear otherwise. Sound is top notch typical Sennheiser for me. Just wish the buggers would stay in my ears better! The mic is alright, although I dont use it much. It does not sound as good as the boom mic on a call center type Plantronics headset, but it‚Äôs usable.  Bettery life is good. I can easily listen to a whole Purple Rain Soundtrack, then Ritual de lo Habitual, and a few hours of YouTubes, then accidentally let it run out by taking them out and not putting them away properly or if I do, there‚Äôs still room for a little more Sneaker Pimps, UGK, or Nicolas Jaar before Damn! Gotta charge em again.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I got these after my 3rd set of Bose gave out after a year. It‚Äôs sad that no matter how much I spend, or how little, ear buds seem to only last 1 single year. But I digress. I decided to try the Sennheiser ACCENTUM. They fit great, sounded great with a noice canceling capability that was even above the Bose. A win win! Then, a week later‚Ä¶I began my day as usual and put in the earbuds. Something wasn‚Äôt right. The right side wasn‚Äôt working. Hmm ok I must‚Äôve seated it wrong to charge. I looked at the app and sure enough it seemed to be the case. Odd, but oh well. Then the next week, same thing except this time everything seemed ok but after wearing them for 5 minutes the built in voice told me to charge the headset. This has happened on an irregular basis but no less than 3-4 times a month. I had reached out to sennheiser, but to no avail. Customer service must not be a priority with them. I haven‚Äôt bothered simply returning them because I have an extra headset I can use while I reseat the buds and charge them for an hour. Call me lazy - I would.The other shortcoming I have to list is the shorter battery life, at least compared to the Bose quietcomfort. It doesn‚Äôt even last a full six hours. The Bose lasted over 8.In the long run, I wear them for the noise canceling. The sound is good but I only listen to podcasts and audiobooks so there‚Äôs that.The app is ok and does have a lot more features than the Bose does. But that‚Äôs not really a selling point for me.In conclusion, I wouldn‚Äôt really recommend these until the charging issues are fixed. From what I‚Äôve read in a few places, I certainly am not alone in having this issue.Why can‚Äôt there be a company that can produce something worthwhile. It‚Äôs not like the big names don‚Äôt have the experience. They just all want to make things substandard and over hype them. As if we are made of money. *sigh*

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: TLDR: My least favorite Sennheiser earbuds.I've been using Sennheiser earbuds for at least eight years now, and I've tried their full line by now. I'm not an audiophile, I'm only listening to audiobooks and taking calls, so please take my suggestions about audio quality with a grain of salt.I usually buy two of whatever earbuds at a time, and they get swapped when one runs out of battery, so technically this review is for a pair of these.1. Audio quality. Accentum seems fine, but IMO the CX series sounds better.  Mic quality seems good, but I've never had problems there with anything Sennheiser.2. The ANC and passthrough are absolutely terrible on Accentum. To the point where I can't easily tell if it's even on. It's not a feature I absolutely need, but do not count ANC as a major benefit on Accentum.3. Totally unscientific, but the battery life seems bad on Accentum compared to CX. It's possible this is because I have ANC on and don't notice it, but the practical effect is I hear "battery low" more times a day.4. The case is just asinine. It's lovely that it charges wireless, but why would you put the usb plug facing the same direction the thing opens? Also, it's not deep enough to reliably fit foam eartips -- the foam tends to push them up just enough over time that it triggers a new "connecting device".5. I got 3 months usage with one set before one of the buds cut out. idk what the warranty situation is, but I have some CX survivors that are over 2 years old. Yes, they're tiny delicate devices that I wear like 16 hours a day, but 3 months is too short.The only plus I'll give Accentum over CX is that it is nice having a slimmer profile on the earbuds. Personally I'd take better battery life over a slimmer profile, but that's up to you.After a short stint with Accentum, I'm switching back to CX.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These fit just like the older, discontinued Apple AirPods!  I have been on a search for something similar.  I don‚Äôt like the fit of the new ones.  If you liked the old fit, these are amazing.  The sound quality is excellent & I like that I can still hear surroundings.  They kept disconnecting, but I found online that if you triple tap the left earbud, auto pause will turn off. Now they‚Äôre perfect.  I hope they don‚Äôt discontinue these too.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Relaci√≥n precio calidad , buena

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: After the left side of my previous earbuds died, I needed a new pair and thought to go with Sennheiser since I have used their HD6XX at my PC for years now with no issues.Other than the one main issue mentioned in the title, these are solid. Fit is okay, I'm not a huge fan but they fit fine and aren't overly uncomfortable. Sound quality is pretty solid, though hampered by the open design (most low frequencies are inaudible). Battery life has also not been an issue at all, I have not had an earbud die while listening yet, even over some pretty long car rides.However, there is one absolutely massive, glaring issue that made me return these and give the 1 star rating. They keep randomly stopping. Sitting still at work, playing drums or guitar, walking at a normal pace on the street, it doesn't matter. During my 30 minute walk to work this morning, they randomly stopped playing 6 times. I think that it's a mix of two issues, the "removal detection" that paused music if you take the headphones out seems poorly tuned, and I believe the way these sit in my ears places the stems in the tops of my facial hair, and they are randomly pausing due to detecting those touches.For the price of these, I would most certainly hope for a better product, especially since there are really only 1-2 design flaws for an otherwise solid product. With better configuration these might still be usable, but they aren't for me

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Wanted to love them, but ended up returning them due to not being comfortable in my ears.Sound quality was fine, but I'm also not very picky or looking for the best sound so I'm easily appeased.Fit felt good at first, but after a couple of hours, I could definitely tell that they were causing a bit of soreness. Tried them again the next day but the soreness just continued and didn't disappear with use. Paaaaaain.Very lightweight and impressively so, but with how light they were, I kept having the notion that they were going to fall out and a few times that I didn't adjust, they did fall out. The falling out could be due to my ears just not being a good fit for these earbuds. They might work well for someone else, just not me.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Sound is reliable. The design is quite confortable. I like them not having those rubber rings. Battery is amazing and the voice sounds pretty much like talking on the phone. And they ARE Seinnheisers, top notch for a quite reasonable pricee

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These seem like an un-polished product. The sound is good, bass is good. But it has a lot of deal breakers that come down to product design.First of all, it's not one size fits all. I have a fairly generic ear size, and any time i bend down slightly or even so much as look down, they begin to fall out.Second of all,  the case has an extremely loose lid. I can close it by tilting forward, there's 0 resistance.If a loose fit and loose lid is ok with you, these are excellent for their price.There's no app, connecting them was super simple, and the build quality is good.When they release a more polished version that fixes the obvious issues, I'll be happy to purchase it and hopefully give a better review as I have a medical reason to use headphones that don't have any silicon.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Purchased for my work phone to use with meetings mostly. Easy to connect to my phone, and connects automatically once connected the first time. The ear buds are a bit large, but lightweight, similar to AirPods. Probably not ideal for small ears.They sound great. Good value for the money.

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM Open Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Decent for the cost

product: Sennheiser Momentum Sport
review_text: Fits well with my large ears (usually need a large or XL silicone tip to make isolation work).They are decently flush, do not sick out far.  I appreciate the custom tip and wing sizes.  I have not tried the Polar Watch Health Features that sync with this, but I can tell you that it is great to see Realtime heart rate and body temp (seems accurate when comparing with my other sensors) in the Sennheiser App.Because they fit snug, I do get a bit of ear fatigue but these are the only earbuds that stay in my ear with sports, eating, or moving.Noice Canceling is great, worked well on a pain.  "Wind mode" seems to work like transparency mode on other earbuds.  The sound... better than Pixel Buds Pro 2, possibly better than Bose... Nice highs and good balanced lows (not overpowering bass but there is an emphasis on base).  First pair of earbuds to have the treble be sharp and precise, I love the sound.A bit expensive at full cost but if you can get on a deal, I would recommend them if you need noise canceling earbuds and have hard to fit (always fall out) type of ears.

product: Sennheiser Momentum Sport
review_text: Three gripes: (1) touch controls, (2) noise cancelling and (3) comfort.(1) Touch controls don‚Äôt work properly, cannot be turned off, and are unintuitive.1/3 of the time they don‚Äôt respond to touch; they also trigger when they‚Äôre adjusted for fit, or even when chewing food or encountering a bump while driving.The app provides VERY limited ability to customize or disable touch controls, so I often hang up calls when simply trying to adjust them in my ear, and I cannot disable this.There are too many controls they trigger (e.g. hanging up, volume up, volume down, anti wind) via unintuitive touch patterns (I‚Äôm a software engineer in my 20s so I‚Äôm no stranger to technology).(2) Noise cancelling is sub par, particularly because it breaks and clicks very consistently when (a) riding over bumps in the road and (b) chewing food.(3) Fit/comfort is OK at best and it gets itchy when left in for long.Sound quality is fine and it stays in the ear well, but the touch controls and noise cancelling are so bad I cannot rate it above 1 star.I do not recommend this product.

product: Sennheiser Momentum Sport
review_text: Great sound. Stays in ear. Good price.

product: Sennheiser Momentum Sport
review_text: Sound quality is good anc works as expected.Thought there's very little control over the volume level especially on the low end. It goes from mute to comfortable listening volume. If I want to listen to something at a low volume I can only get the volume low enough by using developer options so the Bluetooth volume is it's not linked to the internal volume of the earbuds. For this I have to disable absolute volume and restart my phone. This works and I get the control of the volume on the low end but lose it on the high end. The maximum volume is now lower. So if I want to listen at a higher volume, I have to change the setting again and restart my phone. I tried using an app that changed the number of steps the phone volume has to 100. So one step is 1%. I'd still like to be able to get it quieter then it's is at 1% without having to use developer options to turn on and off the absolute volume. I've never had this issue with any other headphone, earbud, wireless speaker, or car audio. I tried using the EQ in the app to accomplish the same thing and of course it had no effect. The issue is that the sliders for the EQ in their app are relative to other slider positions. So if all of the sliders are brought down to -6b it sounds the same as if they're all in the center. I was able to use Androids EQ to bring the volume down a little bit lower.

product: Sennheiser Momentum Sport
review_text: I bought these looking for a better fit than my Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 4s. After some adjustments with the provided ear wings and buds, the fit is hands down better. However, I rate the sound quality a 3/5 compared to the Momentum 4s, which I rate 4.5/5. Everything else with the buds worked flawlessly for me, the sound is just subpar compared to other brands and other products from Sennheiser. Sennheiser has a phone app that allows adjustments for sound, outside noise, health notifications, etc

product: Sennheiser Accentum True Wireless In-Ear Headphones (Blue)
review_text: No sirvi√≥

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: These were recommended to me by a friend and WOW. I have never used real noise-canceling headphones before and these make such a difference for school. The app is easy to use so I can just check to see if the noise-canceling feature is on or not, and turn it on/off easily. Very much worth the money if you are in noisy areas and are having trouble focusing. I did notice that they're best for humming ambient noise (machinery, laundry, fans). You definitely can still hear conversations around you, but they are much softer. One thing I'll do there is play white noise through the headphones with the noise canceling function on and that makes a huge difference.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: Haven't had any issues with the earbuds and their promised features.- Great fit in ear but bulky out of ear as you might expect so not great for sports.- sounds quality and customization is phenomenal- never have found battery to be a problem despite using frequently throughout multiple daysOnly feature I'd like, which is more a problem with my phone software, is an override to the default audio control in the sennheiser app. I generally find the lowest volume to still be loud and am currently using a volume equalizer at -15 dB. The audio balance in the earbuds has no audible loss in clarity and balance at this range too.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: So I ordered this from a refurbisher in the hopes that, being of Sennheiser quality, they would meet the standard; they don‚Äôt. Since I‚Äôve gotten these headphones, charging has been a downright pain in the backside. It will say it‚Äôs fully charged, but when you put them in your ear, it will tell you to charge. They will randomly not connect to both ears. I paid $200 for a useless product. Just buy direct. I‚Äôm not going to change this review, bc I‚Äôm not going to waste my time returning this product to a company that couldn‚Äôt get it right the first time. Atrocious

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: My hearing is fair‚Ä¶however,I‚Äôve yet to find bluetooth buds loud enough for my liking. These are no exception‚Ä¶except these have features to compensate for that.The SMART CONTROL app, used in conjunction with the buds, is a vital tool in customizing my listening pleasure.The ‚Äòtap‚Äô features are numerous and each bud has its own settings, but it is customizable via SMART CONTROL. The ‚Äòtap‚Äô feature can be disabled entirely if need be.The touch is very sensitive, so much so that removing them or stowing away the buds to the case can easily change settings.Ergonomically they are nice. They twist into ear and stay put thanks to the custom tips and grommets.The initial connecting to phone was a little challenging. Without SMART CONTROL, I‚Äôm not sure it would even be possible.Over all, they are well thought-out in design, function and aesthetic.After a few months, I‚Äôm wishing I had not gotten RENEWED. It‚Äôs been quirky.The right hand bud will only charge with case open.It would be great if the charging case was connected to the app via bluetooth without having to remove buds, connect, then re-cradle the buds.The charging is confusing and not user friendly.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: Most expensive set of earbuds I've owned, but the quality is out of this world for how small and light they are. Surprisingly deep bass available for these tiny buds after you mess with the equalizer settings and the built in noise cancelation and transparency are top notch. Battery life is pretty decent at about 4-5 hours of consistent play with noise canceling Active and works beautifully even in a loud automotive shop. Fits nice and snug in the ear if you follow how to put them in correctly in the manual and don't threaten to fall out. Well worth the investment and Sennheiser offers replacement parts on their website

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: Perfect.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: Love these. They have a great features.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM True Wireless 4 Smart Earbuds
review_text: All that came was a charger cable. Absolutely scammed after waiting all day for a box full of nothing.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio CX True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I‚Äôve been reluctant to go wireless, mostly because of sound quality issues of Bluetooth. But I really like the idea of being free from wires while at work, I already have phone/meeting headsets that are Bluetooth and love them. These went on sale Cyber Monday for a good price so I thought I‚Äôd try them.I found them a little bit of a pain to setup. The ‚ÄúQuick setup guide‚Äù was lacking information. Once I downloaded the full manual I figured out what I was missing and then got them setup and working with my phone.  Sound is very clear and bass is excellent and not muddy. It does take a little tweaking of the EQ in the Smart Control app. Noise cancellation is very good considering its passive. These are generally comfortable but can cause a little fatigue if in for long periods. I‚Äôm in and out of meetings everyday so generally this is not a problem for me. I have found that I cannot position them the same in each ear. Everyone‚Äôs ears are different but unfortunately the only way to know is to try them. Battery life is good, though I stick them in the case when I leave my desk and the charge tops off on its own. Being Bluetooth, they do drain my phone a lot more than wired buds.  I can‚Äôt comment on failed bub issues yet, it‚Äôs too early, so we‚Äôll see.I didn‚Äôt intend for these to be used with phone calls but ended up taking a few calls while wearing them. I was surprised at how good the voice sounded. Warm and no distortion. The person I was talking to said it was pretty good. She had no trouble hearing me.A few complaints in the reviews I noticed of which have fairly simple solutions.1) Lack of bass. Make sure you are using the correct size ear adaptor and that it is snug in your ear. This is critical. They have the medium on out of the box. They seemed fine, but after a couple of days I took a chance and tried the large. Wow, dramatically better. I also found you have to wiggle it just a little to get the maximum effect. Also download the Smart Control app to get a bit more bass from the EQ. I suggest trying the Sound Check component of the app.2) For the units that are prematurely dying, I wonder if the contacts are dirty. The full manual specifies they do need to be cleaned from time to time. Also, they do have a 2 year warranty but you have to contact a Sennheiser partner.EDIT: I mentioned above that I got a little fatigued with them in for a while. After pulling out a couple of hunks of ear wax with the right ear bud, I decided to try some ear wax remover. Not only do the bud fit better, they are more comfortable. Something to think about if you are experiencing discomfort.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio CX True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I recently lost my AirPods on a trip and was looking for something to replace them. I didn‚Äôt want to pay what they wanted for the AirPod pros and I wasn‚Äôt really impressed with the sound quality of the AirPods, so I went looking for the best sounding sub 130$ wireless earbuds I could find. I settled on the CXs and received them today. I‚Äôll get to the sound quality at the end but first let me go over some other aspects. The set up was extremely simple, there are clear directions, I just pulled them out of the box removed the very obvious and labeled plastic covers on the battery contacts and then charged the earbuds for about an hour. Once they were charged they paired with my iPhone no problem I also downloaded the app which worked without issue. The fit is slightly less comfortable then the AirPods however they are not uncomfortable and feel quite secure. These buds lack ANC however I don‚Äôt think that will be an issue as they are very effective at blocking outside noise. The touch controls are intuitive and work smoothly. So far I have used them both together and one at a time and have taken them in and out of the case and have no issue with connectivity, you do have to reconnect to the app if you disconnect from Bluetooth  however the app does have to be running for the earbuds to work, only if you want to run the equalizer also reconnecting to the app is very simple. The only ‚Äúissue‚Äù I have had so far is when I updated the firmware; everything went fine however be prepared to have your phone and earbuds tied up for about 40 minutes while the firmware updates; during this process the app needs to stay open and the earbuds need to be close to the phone. It‚Äôs a little nerve racking because I was worried if for some reason the update was interrupted it could brick the earbuds, that being said it went fine just took a long time(the app does give a fairly accurate countdown so that helps a little). So how do they sound? There is no doubt these are the best sounding pair of earbuds I have personally heard in my life. I‚Äôve owned the AirPods, the Jabra 65t, first generation beats, and a couple different Chinese pairs; none of those are even in the same category. These where the first earbuds I‚Äôve had that do not sound like music is just being pumped into my ear canals; the music sounds like it‚Äôs naturally coming from the surroundings. Every instrument and vocal track are clear and separate. The bass and treble sound great and balanced and if you really like pronounced bass you can turn it up in the equalizer and it thumps. It‚Äôs really hard for me to overstate how awesome the sound is, I listened to a few songs that are now in lossless Dolby atmos on Apple Music and it‚Äôs nothing short of incredible. The best metaphor I can think of is all of my old earbuds were like Standard definition and these are 4K. So if your looking for the best sound for your money and probably the best sound for under 200$ these are the way to go.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio MOMENTUM True Wireless 3 Earbuds -Bluetooth In-Ear Headphones for Music
review_text: So I waffled between the big 3 (sony, bose and these) b4 pulling the trigger on these since they went on sale. I originally thought I would try them, return them and then try the others, but these are so good for my needs, I am just keeping them.The good (which is almost everything):First and foremost, the sound is amazing. Its clear/airy has a very wide dynamic range and when properly sealed has plenty of bass and clear highs. The in app eq works well do dial in the sound to suit you. I saw some reviews about these not playing quiet enough, but I've not had that issue, the volume will get as quiet as you want them to. On the loud side, they can get WAY LOUD (thankfully). so many of these newer buds artificially limit the volume (probably to avoid being sued) its super annoying. These don't do that and will get as loud as you could ever need.I've only received a couple of calls on them so far, but call quality seems good to me and my wife could hear me just fine.Noise cancellation is very solid. I'm a woodworker and am in the shop most of the day everyday and these are dramatically better than any other buds I've used and even most of the over ear versions like the 3m work tunes and isotunes (plus way more comfortable). I use a lot of loud equipment like the planer, table saw, miter saw etc along with a shop vac, dust collector and large air compressor and these mute them all to low enough levels that I find myself now turning the music volume down a lot from previous buds. Best of all with these kinds of noises, you cannot tell the noise cancellation turns on, its just there. Turn transparency mode on and off and you'll quickly realize just how much its doing. The only time I hear the anc activate is when I'm using the air nailer. that pop, pop, sound gets muted, but you can hear the anc kick in when its doing it. Otherwise you don't even know its working, things are just quiet.If your view of noise cancellation is to be in the Cone of Silence, these might not be for you. I can still hear my machines running (barely) but they are perfect for the balance for me between hearing things are running for safety and quiet enough not to be distracting, even with multiple different machines running at the same time.transparency mode is solid, and quick with 1 tap on the left bud. It can pause music or leave it playing depending on how you set it up which is a nice feature. My last buds didn't have that, and I'm really enjoying that feature.Comfort is great. I had to switch to the large silicone ear piece and sealing ring, but aside from that they fit well and stay in place while working. I cant speak to how they would work when exercising or running, but even with me bending, stooping, walking around etc, they have never come loose. They're so light you forget about them.Lastly, the app is great with easy to use settings, pairing is quick and reliable and once you learn how to tap the buds to play/pause/turn on transparency mode etc, controls are easy to use and responsiveThe bad, mainly in the mildy irritating category:firmware update takes Forever. I'm not sure why it takes 20+ minutes to update the firmware on these little guys, but it does. Seems like they could do better.The "Bass Boost" is actually a more of a treble mute. while it does boost the bass a little, what it mostly does is mute the highs to make the bass more noticeable. turn the bass boost on/off a few times while music is playing and you'll quickly hear what I mean. You can eq the treble back in, but someone like Sennheiser should have a better solution than that with their software.The bluetooth range is not great with my Samsung S21 Ultra. With my old Jaybird Tarah pro's which are several years old, I could leave my phone in the garage and walk to the back yard and stay connected. with these I barely get to the end of driveway b4 they start cutting out (maybe 30ish feet or so). Not a big deal for me since I'm almost always near the phone when working, but if you are routinely farther away, might be something to consider.All in all they have been a great upgrade for me and I'm definitely hanging on to them.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio MOMENTUM True Wireless 3 Earbuds -Bluetooth In-Ear Headphones for Music
review_text: I never do reviews of products, but in this case I will because of the price of this product. In the past I bought  cheap earbuds. Mostly because I use them for the gym. In the car I usually connect my phone to the radio to listen to the music, so no reason to use while driving. The most expensive brand that I bought was the DR Dre powerbeats. Decent sound at a decent price and great for the gym because they have the hook and will not fall off when exercising. But almost immediately they started having issues with charging. So then I got the Jabra elite 75T. I still have them, no issues with charging, great Bluetooth connectivity, decent active noise cancellation and decent sound. Im happy with them and still work good for the price. I paid $179 in amazon. But I wanted more regarding the sound quality so I started looking at reviews on You Tube and found the Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 3. Great sound, decent ANC, decent battery and connectivity. I compared them to Sony, Bose and Jabra and decided on the Sennheiser. Well, here we go....-Sound is amazing, very happy with them- Battery is as expected, I imagine base on the size of the buds, and sound they are putting out.- Wind noise will affect this buds, even with the software that you install will not be able to adjust and get most of the wind noise out. The Jabras do a better job at that-Connectivity..... hahaha, In the gym I had issues when my phone was on the floor and I walked away for about 20 feet to get the wipes to wipe the chair and I had several machines in the way, pretty weird that I would loose connectivity, not cool-Then this really started to get on my nerves, while using the buds I started to get some weird noises, like some interference and after a few visits to YT, I found out the culprit, there is a very small membrane between the rubber attachment that goes into tour ear and the earbud. I have to remove them, clean them and very carefully reglue them in place. Problem solved for a few weeks.  Then the problem came back, I just remove them completely and the high pitch noise was gone-This is the nail in the coffin... I bought this in October 2022, in less that a year the left bud stop working, will not charge, cleaned the connections and nothing. Will not charge at all. Right bud continued working and charging normally. I used it for answering calls inside my car while driving in the military base I work. Its all hands free device inside the base. Unfortunately a few days ago it also stopped charging at all. Same problem as the left.So , my advice is do not buy, base on my experience and also others having the same issues on the internet.My Jabras are still going strong, not as good quality sound but they do the job.
