product: Sennheiser Momentum 4 Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: Got these on black friday sale for $180, which was a complete steal. For that price, no-brainer instant buy. Even for the 'regular' sale price of $230-250, these are great. The app is good, adjustable EQ that you can save as presets, connects reliably, battery life is absurdly long, pretty comfortable, and the sound quality is great. Rich deep bass and detailed highs. I vastly prefer the sound to the WH-1000XM5, Bose QC35II, and like it slightly more than the AirPods Pro 3. The ANC is not amazing like AirPods Pro 3, but not bad either, better than I expected.Basically, if you want headphones with great sound quality that are wireless and have good enough ANC to give you the best listening experience in a low to moderate noise environment, these are a great pick. I'm rarely going to reach for my Sennheiser HD6XX now that I have these.

product: Sennheiser Momentum 4 Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: The Sennheiser Momentum 4 Wireless are great wireless headphones. I find them to be really easy to use and they sound great. At lower volumes, the sound is v-shaped. But if you bump up the volume a few clicks everything is pretty much even-sounding and not v-shaped. The bass is great, better than my HD600s. The mid-range is lush and full and the treble is just enough to not be harsh. I was using a desk-based system with a topping 7-series dac and amp and the Sennheiser HD600s for a while. The momentum 4 give me portability which is a plus when doing house chores. The touch panel on the right earcup doesn't work that well so I turned it off in the app. The app you need to do firmware updates and control the features is called "Sennheiser Smart Control Plus" and it's available for android and iOS. A nice feature is that the headphones turn off when removed from the head, saving battery life. They sound pretty astounding and in my opinion don't even need EQ although it's available in the phone app. They fit a little snug but comfort is top notch. The clamping pressure is not bad and I don't even need noise cancellation since the seal is so good. The price on amazon is great for these when they're roughly half off retail. If you're looking for the classic Sennheiser quality and need something portable the Momentum 4 are a must buy.

product: Sennheiser Momentum 4 Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: I gravitated towards these set of headphonesüéß because of the reputation of the brands name and just by the appearance alone. I‚Äôm in love with the color scheme that they‚Äôve chosen üòç.  White and gray never looked so amazing.The touch controls are a nice feature too. I enjoy using them. It‚Äôs not complicated not one bit in my personal opinion and experience.The sound quality is pretty good.I don‚Äôt know how to intelligently break down frequencies so you‚Äôll have to find an expert who heard these babies to go into detail.I did check out some of my favorite Southern Rap songs to hear how that bass hit and I can say that I wasn‚Äôt disappointed and the highs were jamming right too while listening to hi hats in TRAP MUSICBut I am a bit worried about the longevity of these very pricey beauties.The R, L, and headphone name that are locating inside of the ear cup will eventually wear off and that‚Äôs the very least of what I worry about. I‚Äôm also knowing that the ear cups themselves will wear out as well and start to rip and tear apart just like the other headphones that I‚Äôve spent over $100+ bucks on! Limited warranty‚Äôs usually don‚Äôt cover replacing worn out ear cups as long as there‚Äôs no shortage in them which could cause you to not be able to hear equally out of both of them.The connectivity issues also can be so annoying at times and these are my second pair by the way!I returned the first pair because of connectivity problems.The headphones may often disconnect wirelessly while I‚Äôm listening to music or watching something on YouTube.I get so aggravated about it!REVISED UPDATE (1/4/24):I gravitated towards these set of headphonesüéß because of the reputation of the brands name and just by the appearance alone. I‚Äôm in love with the color scheme that they‚Äôve chosen üòç.  White and gray never looked so amazing.The touch controls are a nice feature. I enjoy using them. It‚Äôs not complicated not one bit in my personal opinion and experience but sometimes the functionality is not very accurate.There‚Äôs been times I‚Äôve pressed or tapped on the right cup and it would not pause the music especially after the headphones üéß randomly disconnects for some reason and I would have to power them off and power them back on then reconnect them AGAIN for them to do some type of reset.The connectivity isssues can be so annoying at times and these are my second pair by the way! üôÑI returned the first pair because of connectivity problems.The headphones may often disconnect wirelessly while I‚Äôm listening to music or watching something on YouTube then I would have to hold the button that under the right ear cup until the headphones says connected, smh ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èThese headphones are too pricy to have this kind of bug issue I MUST SAY!!!!The sound quality is pretty good, though.That‚Äôs why I bought them again after I returned the first pair hoping that I just had a bad set of headphones but I‚Äôm currently facing the same problem.I don‚Äôt know how to intelligently break down frequencies so you‚Äôll have to find an expert who hear these babies to go into detail.I did check out some of my favorite Southern Rap songs to hear how that bass hit and I can say that I wasn‚Äôt disappointed üëåüèæThe lows, mids, and highs sound really great in my opinion.I am a bit worried about the longevity of these very pricey beauties.The R, L, and headphone name that are locating inside of the ear cup will eventually wear off and that‚Äôs the very least of what I worry about. I‚Äôm also knowing that the ear cups themselves will wear out as well and start to rip and tear apart just like the other headphones that I‚Äôve spent over $100+ bucks on! Limited warranty‚Äôs usually don‚Äôt cover replacing worn out ear cups as long as there‚Äôs no shortage in them which could cause you to not be able to hear equally out of both of them.I was thinking about returning them again and I was going to try another color and see if I would experience the same problem. ü§îI was also thinking about getting a refund and exchanging them for the Sony WH-1000XM5‚Äôs and so I could test them out.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM 4 Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: Got these on black friday sale for $180, which was a complete steal. For that price, no-brainer instant buy. Even for the 'regular' sale price of $230-250, these are great. The app is good, adjustable EQ that you can save as presets, connects reliably, battery life is absurdly long, pretty comfortable, and the sound quality is great. Rich deep bass and detailed highs. I vastly prefer the sound to the WH-1000XM5, Bose QC35II, and like it slightly more than the AirPods Pro 3. The ANC is not amazing like AirPods Pro 3, but not bad either, better than I expected.Basically, if you want headphones with great sound quality that are wireless and have good enough ANC to give you the best listening experience in a low to moderate noise environment, these are a great pick. I'm rarely going to reach for my Sennheiser HD6XX now that I have these.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM 4 Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones
review_text: The Sennheiser Momentum 4 Wireless are great wireless headphones. I find them to be really easy to use and they sound great. At lower volumes, the sound is v-shaped. But if you bump up the volume a few clicks everything is pretty much even-sounding and not v-shaped. The bass is great, better than my HD600s. The mid-range is lush and full and the treble is just enough to not be harsh. I was using a desk-based system with a topping 7-series dac and amp and the Sennheiser HD600s for a while. The momentum 4 give me portability which is a plus when doing house chores. The touch panel on the right earcup doesn't work that well so I turned it off in the app. The app you need to do firmware updates and control the features is called "Sennheiser Smart Control Plus" and it's available for android and iOS. A nice feature is that the headphones turn off when removed from the head, saving battery life. They sound pretty astounding and in my opinion don't even need EQ although it's available in the phone app. They fit a little snug but comfort is top notch. The clamping pressure is not bad and I don't even need noise cancellation since the seal is so good. The price on amazon is great for these when they're roughly half off retail. If you're looking for the classic Sennheiser quality and need something portable the Momentum 4 are a must buy.

product: Sennheiser MOMENTUM 4 Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: I've had these for more than 2 years now and they are still going, sound quality is great (as expected from Sennheiser). The battery doesn't last too long now but it used to be like 4 hours, now is more like 2. The case gets dirty easily and the "lid" broke. I would still buy them again

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: As much as Iike the sound, and I so like it, this is my third. But guess what, like the first two, momentum 2 and then 3, and then this 2 again, it is already destroyed. Didn‚Äôt even last for 6 months! What a waste of money. Sennhizer, what‚Äôs up? What a terrible quality your products! I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one, but you seem to not get bothered about this issues?

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: The first time I ordered these I must say I was extremely disappointed in these! But after checking the first pair out there was something very wrong with them! After returning and Amazon switched them out quickly and sent new pair before I sent bad pair back! Which I thought was pretty awesome!!! Now the next pair I received was totally different they sounded awesome and were pretty loud!! Loud enough and I use them while I mow the lawn but they were so loud I couldn‚Äôt hear zero turn mower crank up. So noise cancellation was pretty good on these Senheiser earbuds. Sound was great and clear! Very good earbuds!

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: Superb sound quality and build as you would expect from Sennheiser.Almost plug and play.You must pair with phone first and then with the app.Location on the phone needs to be turned on as well.I guess the app is kind of buggy as it took several attempts to pair the earbuds after downloading the firmware.After that inconvenience,everything was as it should be.I really like how the earbuds lock into your ears.You put them in and give them a slight twist and they are firmly secured.Highly unlikely they would ever fall out.This also makes a good seal for noise isolation and solid bass response.After trying several other high end brands,I'm really impressed with these and will be keeping them as daily drivers.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: These headphones sound really good but there is a major issue with the connectivity. They will not reconnect every time you take them out of the case. BIG problem for $300 headphones.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: We bought these after we spent too much money replacing raycon earbuds. I wanted to find a good product where my husband could work without hearing the noise around him. He absolutely loves them. They fit his ears, they are very clear, and they are great with noise cancellation. Great product. Worth the price

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: The sound quality is wonderful. The eartips were not the best, but I ordered a pair of fitting foam tips. Seals great, and I can really enjoy the music.The first version of the True Wireless does not have sound canceling, leaving that as a note for anyone unaware.

product: Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless in-Ear Headphones (M3IETW/Black)
review_text: The sound was ok, I guess.  Not really my flavor.  You‚Äôll either like it or you won‚Äôt.Functionally:The battery test light stopped working in a day.The charge probably didn‚Äôt last two hours.It took forever to recharge.The right bud would charge before the left in a quite uneven fashion, so the left often wouldn‚Äôt play on a ‚Äúquick charge.‚ÄùThis was my first experience with Sennheiser and I hope they are counterfit.  I had better experience with my old Bose in every way mentioned.I will be returning them.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio Sport True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These are exactly what I wanted - a high quality ear bud set that will be my main workout pair (including running or mountain biking, so they need to be extra secure), but that I could also use in place of my "casual listening" pair in a pinch if the sound was good enough. I feel like a lot of these reviews don't understand the basics of using ear hooks, or the necessity of using the app to flip between the two sound modes depending on the open ear tips or closed ear tips.If you're going to use the open ear tips (which have a couple tiny holes to let in some outside sound - not much, but enough that you can have a conversation without removing them), the Sennheiser app adjusts the base profile to make everything sound great. Same with using the closed tips.  I tried using the "wrong" settings on purpose to see the difference and wow, it changes the sound signature quite a bit to account for the open/closed earspace.  And they nailed it in keeping it sounding consistent depending on which ears tips you're using.PS - You also need to do the firmware update in the app.  Some nitpicks have long been addressed, it seems.Anyhow, I FINALLY found my workout pair.  It's been years of searching.  Definitely better sound than my Beats Fit Pro (very solid performer and almost perfect, but not great enough to justify the extra $100) or Earfun air pro 2s (which sounded awesome and are a great value, but I had to put an aftermarket silicone ear wing attachment on them every time i used them to keep them in, but which wouldnt fit back in the charging case if the tip was still attached).  These Sennheisers sound better than those two.  These sound comparable to the Jabra Elite 85T and might actually have more crisp bass response.  Loving the very robust battery life for a TW style earbud.  No issues at all so far.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio Sport True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: 10/10 on every dimension. Sound quality is spectacular. Very full, clear, rich, and balanced sound.  Great for every kind of music. Volume is perfect. The rubber attachments make for a very comfortable fit. Its easy to forget yoyre wearing them.  The interactivity is quite fun and useful.  I never had ear buds that were so handy.The waterproofing is great.  I regularly wear them under ear-muffs during outdoor work and they work great even when wet for hours.Also, they work great as an indoor phone headset. Can talk for hours on them without audio problems.Batteries last forever.Also, my first pair failed randomly back in 2023, and Sennheiser repaired them for no charge. Since the repair, theyve been working great (2+years). I've used these things for 3900+ hours at this point and they are still like new in every way.It's rare nowadays to buy something like this and have them work so well for so long. Truly a premium product. Worth every penny. Ty Sennheiser!

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio Sport True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I have only used the earbuds about a dozen or so times.  Mostly for jogging which is 15-20 minutes.  A couple of times for bicycling around for a few hours.THE GOODThey have an IP rating for water resistance.  Great for working out and resisting a few rain drops.  The sound quality is pretty good, especially the bass.  They are comfortable in the ear for a somewhat extended period of time, but not all day.  Eventually my ear gets tired and hurts from them.  So under 2 hours of use is ideal.  Your mileage may vary.THE MEDIOCREThese are not extremely loud when using outside in a busy street, such as walking, jogging, bicycling, or any outdoor activity with heavy vehicle traffic around.  I'm sure they are perfect for hiking, skiing/snowboarding, mountain biking, or the like, where there is some quiet.THE BADAfter a few uses, the left earbud has begun lowering the volume by itself after a few minutes of use, becoming inaudible, making only the right earbud produce proper sound level based on the volume level of the connected device.  I can barely hear the left earbud.  I have to go through the ritual of disabling all Bluetooth devices, manually restoring the earbuds to factory settings, re-paring them with each other, using the Sennheiser app to also perform a factory reset, putting them into the charging case to turn off, take them out of the charging case, reconnect them to device, sacrificing various animals and praying to some undead god beyond the cosmos, just get both earbuds working properly.  And it only lasts for a few minutes, maybe 10-15, before it does it again.  This is garbage.MY RECOMMENDATIONIf you have some money that wants to be liberated from your possession, buy these earbuds, use them a few times, and cherish each of those times it works.  Then subsequently smash them with a hammer, because they will be more useful as broken pieces of plastic and electronic innards, then keeping it around, frustrating you to no end as to why the damn earbuds don't work properly.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio Sport True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I have a Samsung S21 phone and wanted to get new wireless earbuds to replace my old wired ear phones.  I purchased and tried three other brands and I sent them all back due to either poor sound quality (not enough bass) or horrible battery life.  I was nearly ready to give up, when I tried these.  They sound FANTASTIC (I am a bit of an audiophile and sound quality is very important to me).  These earbuds have the very best sound I have found for any earbuds.  The fit in my ear is fantastic.  The software and pairing process is super easy.  My only criticism is occasionally one of the earbuds will lose it's Bluetooth connection - it only happens occasionally, but it is annoying.  It's easily fixed by touching the earbud once or twice to turn them on and off - the connection is then reestablished.  Overall, I love them.

product: Sennheiser Consumer Audio Sport True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Best headphones i have ever had. I've had these headphones since Nov 2023 and still using them today. They work perfectly im very happy with them, great noise cancelation. I forgot to take my headphones out my pocket and accidently went to the washing machine and still worked like it never happened

product: Sennheiser ACCENTUM True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: No sirvi√≥

product: for Huawei Honor 30 Pro Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 Headphones with Charging Case
review_text: Muy bueno

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: So I can say this, the dime evo has great battery life for the earbuds and the holder of the earbuds.Noise cancellation is really good but may attenuate some of the high frequencies, but that could be just my ears.Tap three times on the left earbud and you hear sound around you.Tap again three times and you‚Äôre back into noise cancellation.I have to say that I‚Äôve been very impressed by this model in all aspects.They fit my ears very well and for someone who has very small ear canals I‚Äôm very impressed and how well they fit.I could be jogging or in a full run, and I have no worries of them ever falling out! so if you‚Äôre looking for some earbuds that have really good clarity very easy to control your volume on them. Good mic, quality when you‚Äôre talking to someone on the phone battery life noise, cancellation I‚Äôm telling you these are really a nice set of earbuds to get in for the price you really can‚Äôt go wrong.

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Amazing quality for an amazing price just as good as my old bose that i had before these. My bose lasted me a good like 10 or more years they still work but are falling apart so I got these I can confidently say these are just as good if not better than my bose very comfortable in my small ears and the sound quality is top tier!! They also have better noise cancelation than my bose and no sound leaking out for other people to hear. I like how portable these are with a clip on the case so I can clip them on my jeans instead of putting them in my pocket which was my issue with my bose because the case is really big. They were really easy to connect through the app I was also able to connect them without the app but I personally like using the app because it tells you information like the batery of each earbud and lets you cusomize the sound along with other things.

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Pros and cons.These things stay charged forever, and their case recharges them quickly. I can go a week without charging the case, though I usually only use one at a time in public.The sound is amazing and they fit in my ears comfortably.The only negative is that the outside plastic piece fell off of one of the buds within a few days. I'm careful with them and don't remember dropping it or anything. It doesn't affect the function, just makes the button harder to push. Small negative that I just wanted to mention.All in all, they are incredible earbuds when considering the price,volume, sound quality, and especially battery life. The clip is also very handy

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These earbuds are great. They connect seamlessly and can even connect to two devices at once, which is great for me when I am working on both my laptop and work PC. They don't have active voice canceling, but their sound blocking is so good that people have had to tap me on the shoulder to get my attention even when I'm only listening at low volumes. Sound quality is also good! Battery life is also decent and can last me a full day wearing them.

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These are the best earbuds I‚Äôve ever had. Period. As someone who has gotten through SEVERAL pairs of earbuds over the years, no company has provided the best value like Skullcandy does on the dime products. I‚Äôve had the dime 3 for over a year now as my go to and I upgraded to the dime evo today, the difference in features is wild considering this pair is $60, only a few dollars more than the dime 3. They sound great and neutral, work seamlessly with 2 devices at once, and thy have the app to control the equalizer. I honestly can‚Äôt ask for more and I thank Skullcandy for creating an amazing product for an insanely great price.

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: these headphones are awesome for the price. i accidentally dropped of of the earbuds in the toilet i was worried that it would break it or make the audio sound worse. but after i managed to get it out and clean it off it sounded perfectly fine and it didnt mess with the charging process either. they are in fact noise canceling if you have both earbuds in with a high enough volume. sound quality is crisp you can hear every instrument and beat. very good headphones if on a budget

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I love these earbuds, i use them for work and they fit well without falling out as i move alot and the charge lasts well over 10 hours. Also the case is super handy. Definitely worth more than what they cost.

product: Skullcandy Dime Evo Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I love these, they have good audio and block out the noise pretty well. They connect easy and the battery life is impressive. I generally hook them onto my belt loop.

product: Skullcandy Method 360 ANC Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I'd used many models in the Samsung Galaxy Buds lineup, the last being a couple pairs of the Buds 2 Pros. While I liked the Samung earbuds, I put about 30 hours of use on the headphones weekly and they never held up for more than 3 or 4 months. One earbud (most always the right) would lose volume and quality until it failed to produce listenable sound at all. I'd use the Samung warranty, then the extended warranty that I'd purchased, then buy another pair and start over. Which each new model I'd hoped Samung had fixed the durability issues, but they never had, so I finally decided to try something new.In comes the Method 360s. I've been using these guys for nearly a year now and they haven't lost sound volume or quality in the slightest. While the higher frequencies might not be quite as clear or expansive as the Buds 2 Pros, I think they sound great for the price and I love their punchy bass. The volume on the highest setting also seems to be a little louder than other earbuds that I've had, which can be nice.I'm not impressed with their ANC. I hardly notice it compared to my Bose over-the-ear headphones, but it's not an issue when paired with their passive noise cancelation and I wasn't impressed with the Buds 2 Pros ANC, either. I have some connectivity issues here and there where one bud won't pair with my Samsung phone out of the case. I'll put the earbud back in the case and take it out again and then I'm good to go. I've never lost Bluetooth connection once paired.All in all, I think these are good buds for a good priceI finally decided to try something else and that's where these

product: Skullcandy Method 360 ANC Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I love the sound of it. Lots of bass!!! Great noise cancelling. I‚Äôve been struggling to find a phone that is comfortable enough and don‚Äôt fall of my ear during activities. This earphone sits very well on the ears and stay stuck until you want them loose. Definitely this thing is a masterpiece for the price and potential competitors.

product: Skullcandy Method 360 ANC Wireless Earbuds
review_text: So these are like Bose QC earbuds II same design and feel to them so if you ever seen or used them that's how it out of the case. The case is a bit weird it's a long case that slides up and down and each side is marked with R and L to tell which side each earbud goes to. The positives are the sound is amazing and anc is very good I use them at 40 to 50 percent volume and it blocks out a lot of sound. The charging is pretty fast about 20 minutes and I get an hour and some minutes back to listen to them again and these are very comfortable and come with 3 size options and are able it a good amount of colors to purchase and it has an option to connect to your email for fast connection to any device that uses that certain email which is cool. Another great thing is single earbud can use anc option which I use daily since my job only allows one earbud in and works great.Negatives are small in my opinion one is the battery life is a lie with anc on it lasts about 6.5 hours not 9 like it was registered on the list and I know because I usually work long shifts and about half way I have to charge up and second issue is with both earbuds in is stuttering this comes up at small intervals and it's annoying hearing skips in songs or video if you're in crowded place or on a walk and I think it has to do with Bluetooth connection not going through multiple channels and skull app is useless so I tried to fix by using their methods to attempt a fix and it still happens so I think it's a bad Bluetooth connection and I looked online and seen other people complaining about this issue.So in the end if skullcandy could fix the connection stutters and their own app to get this small issue to go away I would rate them 5 out 5 but it ain't it gots some issues like I mentioned above but it's like a good alternative to a cheaper version of the Bose QC earbuds II

product: Skullcandy Method 360 ANC Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Sounds quality is great, fitment is great, and connectivity for me was a breeze with no drops at all.I hit the gym with these 3 days in a row now with zero issues. The fitment is snug and no need for readjustment during my 1.5 hour gym sessions which also includes running the treadmill. The earbud silicone pieces do not get stuck in my ears or slide off the earbuds at all. I'm assuming people who complain about the silicone coming off/undone must be user error or improperly installed.Bluetooth connection for me has been solid on my Google Pixel 7 Pro, including my friends iPhone 16 Pro Max. I did download the Skullcandy IQ app which prompt me for an update that I did. No connectivity issues at all so far.My battery life is currently at 97% with 3 days worth of gym use at about 1.5hrs per day at medium to medium/high volume with ANC turned off (from fully charged).The case is on the bulky side, however, it's easy to use. People complaining about how difficult/annoying it is to put the earbuds back in the case are simple minded. All you have to do is literally look at the orientation of the ear buds upon removal and put them back the exact same way. I guess people need something to complain about.I'd absolutely recommend these earbuds, especially over the air pods, beats, or SoundCloud. Wait for a sale or buy them used like I did.

product: Sony WF-C510 Truly Wireless in-Ear Bluetooth Earbud Headphones with up to 22-Hour Battery
review_text: Comfortable and easy to wear for hours without my ears hurting. Sony has nailed the design for long term wear for all wireless Bluetooth earbuds I've owned. Does not fall out easily and fits ergonomically. I am confident I won't lose these easily. I love the large button pressed to control music, calls, etc. I enjoy that it's not touch-sensitive like Samsung earbuds, which have been falsely set off by my hair or beanie. My complaints: these buttons are not programmable: what type of madman want people to press 4 times to change volume up/down? I would also love a "Find Earbuds" function if they are connected to a device, but the owner isn't sure where they placed them.Noise cancellation is non-existent, but you have ambient sound (listen to your surroundings) if you wish to have both music and some situational awareness. The case is *slim*, much slimmer than Sony's previous cases. Sound is very decent for the price. With the latest iterations of Bluetooth, these earbuds can be connected to 2 devices at a time, but they cannot play sound from both sources at once. All in all, I recommend if you need a decent and comfortable pair of earbuds with which to listen to music and audio for hours. Sometimes, I use them for more than 6 hours and I'm surprised the battery still goes strong. I've been using them for 5 months now, and like other Sony earbuds I've owned in the past, I expect their longevity to last years.

product: Sony WF-C510 Truly Wireless in-Ear Bluetooth Earbud Headphones with up to 22-Hour Battery
review_text: 1) The sound of the WF-C510 is really good right out of the box without EQ. I listen to a lot of music, various genres, and everything is balanced and in control. Punchy bass, treble that's crisp and doesn't make my ears bleed, and decent mids. I definitely trust Sony when it comes to audio products.2) Fit and comfort are amazing! I can leave these in all day. No joke, after 5+ hours of use, I feel zero discomfort. Not only are these earbuds the most comfortable earbuds of all time, but getting a good in-ear seal is effortless. Just set them and forget them, zero hassle. Just to note, there's no ANC but I don't mind; I use these at home where it's already quiet. Further, there's a feature called Ambient Sound Control, kind of the opposite of ANC, that lets outside noises in (press button on left earbud). Obviously, the volume has to be pretty low for this feature to be useful.3) I rarely ever use playback controls on a pair of earbuds, as I just use my phone for that stuff. However, the physical buttons on the WF-C510 work like they should and it's always nice to have actual buttons over touch controls, mainly because there's less chance for accidental inputs, a common occurrence on my other earbuds.4) The battery life seems to jive with Sony's claims of 11 hours in the buds and another 11 in the case. I'm getting a 50% battery level after 5+ hours at a volume level above half with the "Sony Sound Connect" app installed on my phone. I'll admit, the 11 hour battery claim was the #1 factor for my purchase.5) The app gives you a ton of stuff to play around with. There's a bunch of EQs, 360 audio (more app downloads and payment required, I think), information regarding battery levels, and more.6) A couple of oddities: The charging case confuses me. Does the orange light turn off when charging is complete or does it stay lit? I've experienced both scenarios and both times the app said the earbuds and case were at 100%. The instruction manual was no help. Also, for some reason I had to re-pair the earbuds to my phone's Bluetooth after shutting it off, which was super annoying. I was testing to see if an older device (without the app) would pair, so to avoid interference I turned off my phone's Bluetooth. The older device paired with the earbuds just fine without the app, so it isn't required. I plan on deleting it; it's probably a major battery hog anyway.7) Minor issues aside, the Sony WF-C510 delivers premium comfort and pleasing sound. and they're super affordable. Get yours today! lolUpdate 3/25 -- Checking in to mention that the orange charging light on the case does in fact shut off to indicate that charging is complete and I'm still very happy with my purchase.

product: Sony WF-C510 Truly Wireless in-Ear Bluetooth Earbud Headphones with up to 22-Hour Battery
review_text: My experience with the Sony (WF-C510) has been great. They are not too bulky to carry around.  Their transparency mode is solid. They don‚Äôt have a noise canceling mode but just wearing the buds block out a good amount of noise. They are comfortable and fit right in and have never fell out on their own. I haven‚Äôt had any issues with the mic during phone calls; I am told I sound clear.I use them at work. They pair with my computer and my phone at the same time. That‚Äôs one of the main reasons I bought these. The audio quality is really good. Way better than my AirPod pro 1st gen. I like the EQ settings on the app. Battery life is never a worry for me. I can go a few days with a full charge.Only a few complaints. One is the app should have a setting where it lets you customize what the taps do.Second is when on call, it goes into transparency mode which I don‚Äôt like but not a deal breaker.Overall for the price I paid I would recommend these. I will update my review if I have any issues.

product: Soundcore P30i by Anker Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I had a pair of the AirPod Pros for a couple years when I blew out the left one when my sound was accidentally turned to max one day.  They were out of the Apple Care warranty period and I was waiting until they went on sale over the holidays to replace when I saw the positive reviews on the Soundcore P30i.  I thought for less than the price of just the Apple Care warranty alone that I‚Äôd give them a try so I picked up a pair in black.  I was shocked with the quality of the earbuds build and performance, WOW!  It paired easily with my iPhone Pro and sounded great, but it wasn‚Äôt until I downloaded the Soundcore app that I realized their full potential.  In the app you can set up the functions of each earbud and also select your choice of sound quality.  For me the surround sound option blew my AirPod Pros out of the water.  Unbelievable!  And the bass is spectacular.I was so thrilled that I immediately purchased another pair as a backup and have since purchased two pairs as gifts for friends at the gym who had Beats and AirPod pros and they were both blown away.  Finally, we all agreed that these earbuds stay in your ears better too, once you find the best fit among the three choices provided.  And the battery life is great.  There is also a function to use with more than one device, so I often use them with my iPad as well.  Just Google the easy to follow directions for easy pairing of two devices.In conclusion, my Soundcore P30i earbuds are by far my best discovery on Amazon over the years, not only for the insane savings over AirPods (for less than the cost of Apple Care alone), but the excellent sound quality, which IMHO is far better.  And for the price, these make an amazing gift as well.

product: Soundcore P30i by Anker Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I have tested many earbuds and for the price I‚Äôd consider these better than any wireless earbuds on the market like AirPods, skullcandy, and Bose. I‚Äôve only had to charge them twice in 4 months. They sound really good with the adaptive noise cancellation and custom equalizer. The microphone quality could be better, but the value for price is INSANE. The different sized tips fit any ear and the functionality it overall the best I‚Äôve seen.

product: Soundcore P30i by Anker Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: For pure sound quality, I recommend the Moondrop Space Travel TWS Earphone Bluetooth 5.3 Noise Canceling True Wireless Stereo IEMs(Black) over these. They are an off-brand, but popular, semi ‚Äúin ear monitor‚Äù quality earbud. However, these Soundcore P30i are a lot easier to set up, change modes, an use, while not giving up much in terms of everyday music and video quality. Especially when watching tv and movies, you won‚Äôt likely notice any difference.So, let‚Äôs start with a ‚Äústrong average‚Äù rating for these earbuds. No bad habits. No annoying faults. No weird emphasis on one part of the sound spectrum.How is set up? Well, be prepared for NO pairing button on the case or inside the hood. These enter paring mode automatically the first time you pull them out and remove the little plastic tabs off the charging spots. They will automatically pair with the most recently paired device IF it is on. Otherwise they go into pairing mode. If you really want to move them to another device, please delete from your old device first so you know what‚Äôs going on. (No probblem if your phone is stolen and you want to re-pair to your new phone).There is another step that I recommend. Download the Soundcore app. Use it to customize your settings. Especially you need to deal with ANC - activve noise cancelling. Do you want it On, Off, or Automatic? And set up the desired right and left ear ‚Äútaps‚Äù for usual stuff like activating a voice assistant or answering a call.THE AUTOMATIC ON-OFF FOR ANC IS SOMETHING I HAVEN‚ÄôT SEEN BEFORE. It doesn‚Äôt activate in my apartment even when noisy trucks go by. I assume if activates automatically on airplanes, where the engine and airstream noise are constant (other reviewers have flown and confirm this. HOWEVER, given the new menu on the control panel, make sure your earbuds are in Automatic mode; when these first shipped (I have early release and current release firmware versions) they were Automatic only, with no way to ‚Äúforce‚Äù ANC as with other ANC earbuds. I think these should ship in Automatic mode, but they seem to ship in ANC-off mode now; use the app to select Auto mode, and to set the taps you want to use to cycle through the three ANC, Normal (silicone tips block some external sounds), and Transparent modes (Transparent uses the mics to relay external sounds through to your ears, as though you don‚Äôt have silicone noise blocking tips in the ear canal).Finally, the current firmware adds a chime to the three modes as you cycle through them.I would like to see a set of XL for extra large ear tips. Apple has started doing this. It is a challenge for some earbud designs since the cup holding the tip would need to be larger so the earbuds fit, but then the stem with the charging pads might wobble. Apple and Beats seem to be the only makers with the XL option.With L tips on, I have a good, but not snug, fit. On other earbuds with ANC test modes, I need noticeably snug earbud tips or I don‚Äôt bass the onboard ANC test.I intend to keep the app on my device for my next flight and test out Automatic and forced ANC modes and see if there is any difference. Also, to compare to the original Beats (not the later Plus) version) earbuds. I don‚Äôt need high fidelity inflight, just enough ANC so I can actually hear dialogue over the cabin roar.Finally, I have a drawer of varioius ANC options. Why did I invest another $30 in these? Disposability plus Anker assurance. In terms of disposability, keep in mind these don‚Äôt have a necklace - if one wiggles loose from yawning or eating and rolls away, it‚Äôs probably toast. No shrill alarm mode to help find it. Anker assurance? With the exception of a recalled powerbank, Anker has meant solid middle of the field design and reliability. Better audio than pre-Bose Skullcandy, actually comparable to the Solo Buds from Beats, but best value taking into account price, featrures, and quality. Heck, even without noise cancelling I would have bought these. With ANC they are a steal.Then add in the neat built in phone stand, and killer battery capacity for 14 hour flights? No brainer.

product: Soundcore P30i by Anker Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: The Soundcore P30i by Anker are pretty solid for what they cost. The sound quality is clear, and they stay comfortable even after wearing them for a while. They connect fast and the battery life is actually better than I expected.My only real complaint is the volume control you can‚Äôt turn it up quickly, and it takes a few taps to get it where you want it. Not a dealbreaker, just annoying when you‚Äôre trying to adjust on the fly.Other than that, they work exactly how you‚Äôd hope budget earbuds would. For the price, they get the job done and sound good doing it.

product: Soundcore P30i by Anker Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I ordered these to have a reliable pair of noise-cancelling earbuds, and I am honestly blown away by the value. The sound quality is fantastic, the bass is punchy and powerful without drowning out the mids and highs. The noise cancellation works surprisingly well for this price point, blocking out a good amount of background noise when I'm working or commuting.One of my favorite features is actually the charging case. The built-in phone stand design is such a clever touch; it‚Äôs super handy for watching videos on my phone while I'm eating or traveling.The battery life is excellent (I haven't had to charge the case in days), and they are comfortable enough to wear for long sessions. If you want great sound and a functional design without breaking the bank, these are a solid choice.

product: Soundcore by Anker A20i True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I‚Äôd like to preface by saying that I just barely got these, so this is a first impression review (and also the only review I‚Äôve ever felt compelled to make on Amazon). But I‚Äôve gotta say, I already love these a lot. I‚Äôve never been able to afford good quality earbuds, so I‚Äôm constantly looking for better, cheaper options - usually to no avail. But the sound quality of these for the price are FANTASTIC. Easily the best sounding earbuds I have ever owned, coming from somewhat of an audiophile. Not only that, but I also have small ears and tend to avoid earbuds all together due to the fact that earbuds generally really hurt my ears‚Ä¶but these? Light weight, they fit nicely in my ear, and they provide smaller ear cushions as well, which I would usually have to take advantage of and I haven‚Äôt had to change them - at least not yet. The app that pairs with them is really nice as well. It has an equalizer that you can utilize to adjust the audio to your own preference - which I personally haven‚Äôt had to use, as I actually find the audio out of the box really balanced - and you can also actually reprogram the gestures to pause/play/etc to your liking if you don‚Äôt like how they come. The app also has different audios you can listen to, from white noise, to rain, to the ocean, to a forest, etc., which I think is a great, considerate thing to add to the app. Incredibly easy set up as well. You take them out of the case, they blink for a second, and then immediately show up in your list to connect to in your bluetooth settings right out of the box. Nothing complicated at all. They also came fully charged which I was pleasantly surprised with. No having to wait around for them to charge to be able to actually try them upon receiving them. If I had to be nitpicky (as I know I‚Äôve been only saying positive things) I‚Äôd say the only thing I‚Äôm not overly pleased with is just the fact that the charging case feels a little bit cheap, plastic wise. That being said, I really like the strap that comes attached to the case to put on keys or a carabiner or something of the like (and yes, you can take it off!), and it‚Äôs not like I expected the case to have the feel of an airpods case - you get what you pay for. It doesn‚Äôt feel like it would break easily, though. Just a bit cheap-feeling to the touch, which isn‚Äôt a big deal. Overall I would say that, so far, these are definitely a steal for their price. I happened to get them on sale for $18, but even the list price of $30 is worth it. If you‚Äôre wanting good quality wireless earbuds that won‚Äôt break the bank, these are definitely them. I‚Äôll make sure to update/edit if my feelings on these change, but as of now, no real complaints! 10/10!!

product: Soundcore by Anker A20i True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: Battery life is longer than 9 hours. I got them at 630pm charged em for maybe n hour put em on around 730ish and fell asleep with em in and they were at 10% at 10am the next morning. I'm really impressed with the battery life and the fact that I can use either my right or left earbud by themselves and that function isn't only for the right one was a very nice surprise because I use them while at work and can only typically use 1 at a time so when one dies I can just use the other. Haven't bought a pair that does that yet so it's new to me. I enjoy the sound quality and noise cancelling. The sound quality in my honest opinion isnt crazy out of this world but it is really decent. I'm actually impressed by these little things I love the way they fit in my ears, I was contemplating getting over the ear ones because of the way in the ear ones feel and fall out but these ones fit really nicely n snug in my ears so it adds a decent element to the noise cancelling. I love the app and that I can choose what each bud does for the tapping feature. Love the white noise options and how clear the phone calls are. Honestly a W for the price and the quality. You really cannot go wrong for $20. I highly recommend if your on the fence about it these are a solid choice for real.Update 3 weeks laterBoth still work perfectly. I found the battery life is just insane. I start wearing them around 7am and don't get the "soundcore buds battery at 10%" alert until literally 9 or 10pm. I also found that I can leave my phone inside take my dogs outside and they don't disconnect. Really sweet range and I have not had one single sound glitch or issue at all. For $20.. I'm incredibly happy with these. Usually with other earbuds I've bought for $40 or more the left one dies within the first week. I end up having glitches and the range is always dog shxt. I barely walk out the door and they disconnect and the battery life seems to die on the other ones more each week. It's like I can wear them n hour less and now they barely last 2 hours and takes forever to charge only 3 months of having them. I'd say the soundcore earbuds blow the more expensive ones out the water. The charging case charges quickly and hold charge incredibly well. I maybe have charged them 3x. If you drain em til dead and charge the case for like 10-20 mins they'll last you til the next day it's crazy. I Highly recommend you literally cannot beat the quality for the price.Update Sept. 2025 5months later.Everything above still applies. Both buds still work and I way overwork these things. I'm not exaggerating when I say I have an earbud in more in a 24 hour period then I do not my wife constantly tells me how horrible it is for my ears to wear them and fall asleep with them in the way I do lol and I only charge them once a day, I could probably go once every 2 days if I forgot to charge them once but I choose to charge the case fully for work at night and I've never had the charging case even blink red. They're literally working all day and I switch them back and forth. Not a glitch or anything and the battery life is still top notch and sound quality has not dipped at all. I'm even more baffled that I use them the way I do and they still work like new 5 months later. I actually came here to buy another pair so I can leave a pair at work and one at home so I'm not using one pair to death the way I currently do. Buy em. I have a buddy who has the 10mm driver's and they're not as good as these. If your doom scrolling through Amazon looking for the right ones I'm telling you try these. It's barely $20 if you don't like em you only spent $20 but I'm 100% honest with my review and highly recommend buying these.Your welcome

product: Soundcore by Anker Life A1 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: So far I gotta give these 5 stars the sound is amazing and they do not fall out like airpods which is exactly how I would end up loosing them. I like how you can adjust the equalizer on the soundcore app to your liking, the wireless charging for the case is an amazing feature on budget ear buds. It was very easy to set up and pick the correct wing size for better comfort. The design of these is amazing at first I found them to be a bit bulky but you end up getting used to it. Amazing now I gotta see if they last tho but so far they‚Äôre syncing perfectly.

product: Soundcore by Anker Life A1 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: These have been the best earbuds I've come across so far. I do not know why the ear wings aren't on all earbuds, they are so comfortable and clearly keep them from falling out of your ear, which is my biggest nuisance with a lot of them, as you start to feel it sliding out. These fit perfect, can't fall out. Now onto the sound.....the bass on these are so gooood! The overall sound quality for these earbuds are amazing. When I use these I don't feel I am missing out in comparison to over the head headphones. I use these with my Ipod Nano and sometimes through my phone, been perfect to pair it up and sounds great with both. Being able to wirelessly charge them is also really cool. The case is great. Literally zero complaints while I've had these so far for a couple of years. I had some Jabra's before and it was lacking a lot with bass, was blown away by how much punch these had. I was worried it would either be only a little extra or maybe some kind of distorted bass, but it is super crisp and punchy.If looking for some great sounding earbuds, that is super affordable on top of it....I don't see how anyone would be disappointed with these.

product: Soundcore by Anker Life A1 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: First, please know that I purchased these earbuds in May of 2021. They are now over 4 years old and still working fine for my needs. Here's how I felt using these earbuds roughly 3-4 times a week for hours per occurrence.Pros- Doesn't break the bank but isnt as cheap as those 20 dollar no name ones you can get on Amazon that change their name but remain the same product.- Sound quality is good, not great. Bass is there but not to a point where I was impressed. I would say overall they sounded passable for music. For podcasts, which I listened to mostly with these, is fantastic. Voices are crisp and cut through any background noise.- Noise cancellation, don't really notice it, not sure if it doesn't even have it or I just haven't turned it on.- Battery life was great for the first few years, as of now 4 + years in, a single charge of the carrying case and buds inside will get me about 20 hours of podcasts at a loud volume.Cons - the rubber ear tips. Not the ones that go into your ear canal and cover the speaker, I'm referring to the ones that sit on top of the earbud and assist with keeping the earbud in place. They are an AMAZING addition. I mean, I could play pick up basketball games with these in and they'd be rock solid the entire time. The bad part comes into the picture now, a few years later. They've stretched out to a point they don't function like they should and the buds fall out easily.  I went to purchase a replacement and Anker is sold out for the past month. It's a damn shame I'll have to replace a perfectly good part of earbuds because Anker doesn't support their products properly post sale.Tldr: Good earbuds for podcast and some music, company support for replacement parts sucks.

product: Soundcore by Anker Life A1 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I love these earbuds! They fit in my ears really well, they're lightweight, and they actually stay in place. The noise cancellation is amazing. They literally drown out everything else. The sound quality is great, too‚Äînice and sharp. There's different equalizer modes based on the type of music you're listening to, as well, and you can even set the touch controls exactly the way you want them. Definitely worth the price!

product: Soundcore by Anker Life A1 True Wireless Earbuds
review_text: I bought these to replace my Bose Sport earbuds. While I wanted something that would give me great audio, I didn't want to spend what I paid for those previous earbuds; these Soundcore Life A1do not disappoint, in fact, they are exceeding my expectations.Bluetooth Pairing: Open the case, go to bluetooth settings on the device and select the Life A1 buds. Done. Literally took me less than 15 seconds. Once my devices were paired, as soon as I take a bud out of its case it's already connecting to the last device I used, and by the time I have it popped in my ear, it's ready to go.Comfort and Fit: These buds come with several sizes of plugs, and three sizes of wings. After a little trial and error to get the right fit for my ears, these are so comfortable, I forget I have them in after a while. They are lightweight, they don't pinch anywhere, and I can easily wear these for an entire day at my desk without any discomfort whatsoever.Controls: Like many earbuds these days, you can control several common functions by pressing the earbuds (play/pause, volume up/down, answer/reject calls, Siri, etc.). One thing that surprised me is that these are actual buttons, and not just a touch-control like some other buds have.Build Quality and Design: Both the case and the earbuds are light, but at the same time, feel like they are made to last. Nothing feels "cheap" or "flimsy". The case has a solid magnetic closure design, there is no play in the hinges of the case lid. The buds themselves are riding that fine line between lightweight and feeling substantial enough to feel like a quality earbud.Battery Life and Charging: I can easily go all day long with these buds. I used them continuously for 9 hours on one single charge. The case and the buds themselves charge quickly. And as an added bonus, not only can you charge the case via the USB-C charging port, you can also use a wireless charger.The App: There is a Soundcore app you can download that offers some additional options. It allows you to customize the button controls although your only options of functions to assign to button presses are volume, play/pause, next/previous, Siri, or no action. The app also offers equalizer settings, but you are limited to their 21 presets; 20 equalizer configuration presets and a "Soundcore Signature BassUp". While these presets will most definitely do the trick, I was slightly disappointed there was no option for a custom EQ preset the user can make on their own.Overall, I am incredibly impressed by the value, less than $40 for all of this? And to be honest, these sound at least as good as my previous Bose earbuds.

product: Soundcore Liberty Buds by Anker
review_text: Soundcore (a division of Anker Tech along with Eufy) has become my go to reliable source for fairly priced, great sounding, well-designed audio equipment, and these Liberty Buds are no exception. The fin designed to hold each bud in the ears works perfectly for me using the default medium size. I'm trying to use buds that are not "in ear" to help protect my hearing and these accomplish that while still sounding great. The noise cancelling is good at best, but because these are neither over nor fully in the ear, I wasn't expecting more. Sound is very good, especially bass response given the design, with the mids well represented and treble sweet and without sibilance. At the introductory 20 off price these are a no brainer, and even at full price they're easy to recommend.For millions of people, Anker has become synonymous with quality, feature rich, stylish products and an excellent price point. The Liberty Buds continue that trend and are a welcome addition to the family.

product: Soundcore Liberty Buds by Anker
review_text: Short version. These are great if you like open earbuds, as I do. The sound is great, they are comfortable, and unlike the Apple AirPods which still fall out of my ears frequently, the Liberty Buds offer a very secure fit. My only complaint is that I did not find the ANC to be very effective compared with the Apple AirPods 4 ANC.The Apple ANC is amazing, especially considering they are also open earbud design. The Apple ANC does not eliminate the background noise, but significantly lowers the volume on background noise. The effect of the ANC on the Liberty Buds was better than nothing, but significantly less effective than the Apple ANC.Whether or not comparing these Liberty Buds to the AirPods 4 ANC is fair or not depends on the price. This Christmas, the AirPods 4 ANC were widely available for $99. However, normally the Apple Air Pods 4 ANC are nearly twice the price of the Libery Buds. Thus, the fair comparison may be against the Apple AirPods with no ANC to the Liberty Buds with minimal ANC. In this case, some ANC is better than none and the Liberty Buds offer better fit and better controls. The only other issue is whether you are part of the Apple ecosystem.Although marginally improved, I still hate the way that Apple AirPods fall out of my ears. The Liberty Buds are very secure, yet very comfortable. I have fallen asleep and still had them in my ear. I also like the ability to customize the controls as well as the ability to have one of those controls set to control the volume on the buds. Compared to my previous Soundcore products, I love the ear detection. I can pause whatever is playing by simply pulling a bud out of my ear. Great for when you need to listen or talk.

product: Soundcore Liberty Buds by Anker
review_text: This is Soundcore's best headset yet... It is similar to the Airpod 4 / Samsung Galaxy Bud 3 with an open fit... The sound is extremely loud when on phone calls and listeners say I'm very clear. It blocks out a good amount of sounds. It is extremely light and comfortable. I forget it's there. It edges out the Airpod 3 and Samsung Galaxy Bud 3 because it comes with a "fin" that prevents it from falling out of your ear. You will be happy. They are offering $20 off as an introductory offer. You will be happy with them.

product: Soundcore Liberty Buds by Anker
review_text: I own a number of SoundCore products including A20 and A30 sleep buds and I've had extensive experience with both the tech and customer service sides of Anker's business. While I'm used to in-ear buds I hoped that the design of the Liberty buds would be less likely to irritate the inside of my ears while still delivering decent sound. The idea would be to have buds that can function well in different environments including the gym while not being stuck inside the user's ear canal. Here's my quick review:-The sound quality is quite good and actually better than I expected. The quality if very good, connectivity no problem and the range of the buds from the app on your phone is better than either Bose or Apple. As with other SoundCore products the app is pretty intuitive and the number of features is excellent. It's apparent that Anker is focused on constant updates of their software and actually listens to customer feedback to their engineers.-Part of the attraction to the buds was the language translation feature and with limited use I found that the translation delay does work pretty well with minimal delay. It's clear that Anker is working to become competitive with Apple and Bose at a lower cost for this feature.-Now for the deal breaker (at least for me). The other SoundCore buds have a very good design that uses different size "fins" to fit inside the interior of your ear while not being "inside" your ear canal. I've had very good luck with both the A20 and A30 sleep buds fit and expected the fin design of the Liberty buds to be similar. Nope, not so much.  The fin design is much different and despite a few days of trying to find the right fin and trying to insert the bud correctly in my ear I realized that the Liberty buds were simply not for me or my ear design and both the comfort and sound quality are both negatively affected by how loose the buds are inside the user's ear. In addition, unless the fit is 100% right the feeling is that the buds will fall out.-I'm not sure why SoundCore chose to use this design or what the overall use profile is (for me certainly not the gym or on the bike) but that is certainly because of the fit issue for me. While SoundCore's customer service is excellent there's really no way that they can help fine tune fit over the phone or online. Perhaps my expectations and use profile don't fit the Liberty buds but because of my previous SoundCore experience I hoped for a better design. I'll have to stick with my old Bose Sport Buds for the time being.

product: Soundcore Liberty Buds by Anker
review_text: Incredible battery life and sound quality. Got these and AirPod pros and these were $150 less and are a much superior product. Returned the AirPod pros. Huge fan of Anker Soundcore products. Run a lot and spend lots of time in the gym, these have never been less then 50% charged. Only charged them once a week and they stay charged and automatically connect to iPhone. Great product!

product: Soundcore Liberty Buds by Anker
review_text: I really enjoy the wingtip style earbud design.  This one can be worn comfortably for hours and feels very secure.  Sound quality is good, probably a 3.5/5, but it can depend on your seal.  Great transparency mode, but only average in noise cancelling.  Battery seems average.  Easy to set up and connect with the app.

product: Soundcore Liberty 4 Pro by Anker
review_text: I've been using these since March 2025. I normally am not a fan of earbuds, I find them uncomfortable to wear after more than 30 minutes. However I ordered memory foam earpads has the ear pads that come with this headset didn't quite fit. With that one small $5 purchase of memory foam ear pads these earbuds turned out to be amazing. They have excellent noise canceling property, they are extremely comfortable to wear for hours at a time and I even forget I have them inserted.Sound quality is amazing, I'm a big fan of hearing bass when I listen to music and these do not disappoint. You can download an app for your phone to use them which is optional, but by downloading the app you can utilize a fit test to see how well the noise canceling is working.Telephone calls, no problem with the listener hearing me and vice versa.Not that it matters but the aesthetic is excellent because I like blue and I chose that model color.Battery life is highly impressive, once you charge the case you can use it for multiple recharges to the earbuds before you have to recharge the case. A bonus is that the case will work on a wireless charger and a wired charger depending on what you prefer to use.Overall, the price point is amazing considering that these are not some of the top of the line models that you may have heard about yet these perform at top of the line. I see no reason to purchase name brand earbuds for something that does the job if not exceeds the ones that are at the top of the line.

product: Soundcore Liberty 4 Pro by Anker
review_text: I am a serious music listener, and own many top-tier IEMs. My experience has always been that wireless IEMs are far inferior to wired. I purchased the Liberty 4 Pro as a replacement for my AKG N400 TWS set, which have gone kaput. I bought the Liberty 4 Pro on sale for $89, so I expected them to be functional, but not exceptional. My mistake.While these don't rival my best sets, they are a tremendous performance/price set. On a scale of 1-10, where my top set (ISN Audio EST80) is a 9, these are a solid 6.5. That's huge. My old AKGs were a 4 at best. Everything about the Liberty Pro is amazing. The sound is wonderful, really. But it's the sophistication of the electronics that makes them really shine. Let's talk about that.The case is excellent and charges the IEMs rapidly. One word of caution - if you change the eartips to a non-OEM pair, be certain they fit the case properly, or your IEMs may not charge. Onward --The app is where all the stuff happens. There are hearing tests to help you design a custom EQ profile along with 22 built-in EQ profiles. If there isn't one there that tweaks these IEMs to you liking, check your hearing. These are all well designed, and very effective. There are so many options to customize your listening experience. I'm really impressed.The ANC is superb and, unlike my old AKGs, the quality of the sound doesn't change as you increase/decrease the ANC. That really impressed me.All in all, these are not just excellent TWS IEMs, but excellent IEMs all around. Depending on your music choices and listening habits, these might just be the only IEMs you need.

product: Soundcore Liberty 4 Pro by Anker
review_text: Premium buds at an affordable pric. Very good sound quality, excellent battery performance and noise cancelling. The dual pairing is the feature that was lacking in lower models of Soundcore buds. This is the 4th pair of these that i have bought. Not because the others have failed, but because i use them in different places for different things and just love them. One pair at the office paired to my phone and computer. One in my home office again paired with phone and computer. One in my workshop paired with the TV and phone and one for travel paired with my phone and tablet. They just work, are very comfortable and the noise cancelling is spectacular. I knocked one start off for the tips themselves. I like the "mushy" tips and have tried several replacement ones but they never seem to fit in the case so prevent charging. Finally gave up and just got used to the included tips and have been happy ever since.

product: soundcore by Anker Liberty 4 NC Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: Let me start out by saying that this is a very solid/compelling product in this price range.  The Liberty 4 NC's do a lot of things well for it's price point.  The Noise Cancelling for it's time was among the best(better than the Earfun Air Pro 4 in my experience) in class, the sound quality is decent out of the box(they offer EQ via the app if you want to tune it), battery life is superb(I can use it for hours in a single session), and the build quality is decent.I believe for it's price segment (varies throughout, but I'll pick the price point of say $60-70), it's a very strong contender and you can't go wrong with this product for the right price.However, I do have 2 qualms.. one of them is specific to me though so your mileage may vary:First, the fitting.. the shape of the earpiece does not fit my ear too well, I do not have large ears per-se, but I use the largest ear tips in order to get a better seal.  Not only do I have issues with getting a proper seal in my ear canal, but they also don't seat well in my ear, as they tend to fall out more easily.  I don't seem to have this issue with some other earbuds(like the Earfun Air Pro 4), but I do have this issue with the Liberty 4 NC's.  I will say that it's not necessarily a deal breaker though, just an annoyance, something to watch out for as it depends on your ears.Second qualm is the mic performance is just mediocre, though it is adequate for it's price class.I don't use transparency mode very often, but they seem to work ok.  I'm glad that these have a transparency mode at least.---I also wanted to note, as I alluded to earlier, that I have both the Soundcore Liberty 4 NC and the Earfun Air Pro 4's.  In my opinion, other than the fitting issue(these don't seat well in my ear, and the eartips struggle a bit to get a good seal.. perhaps due to the angle of the shape of the earbuds), the Liberty 4 NC's are a notch better as a product compared to the EAP4's, especially when it comes to Noise Cancelling.  I have tested both of these in a noisy cafe, and the Liberty 4 NC's noise cancelling is noticeably superior to the Earfun Air Pro 4's.  So depending on your priorities, I'd still say overall, I prefer the Liberty 4 NC's.

product: soundcore by Anker Liberty 4 NC Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I've gone through several pairs of cheap and mid-price ear buds (< $100).  Three I like are the earfun pro 3, 1more comfobuds pro, and now the Anker Liberty 4NC.  Overall the Ankers win hands down.  I think they have the best sound and by far the best wind resistance.  After you load up their app and connect to the buds it gives you a hearing test to give a base level of response, then gives a bunch of A-B comparisons to a piece of music asking which one you prefer as it tweaks the response curve.  I think the end result is great, but I'm no audiophile and am 65, so take that for what it is worth.  The other two are good, too (I rate the 1more buds above the earfun's, but I like them all).  I got the 1mores first, and if I were only going by sound quality I'd have stopped there (glad I didn't, but I didn't know that at the time!).I usually listen to them when I ride my bike on a local rails-to-trails path.  The downfall of the 1mores is that there is a lot of wind noise that comes through.  Noise cancelling overall is good, but not for wind.  So I saw the earfuns on sale, so tried them.  Much better wind noise reduction, but still more than I'd like.  Finally I saw these and bought a pair on their launch.  As I mentioned above the sound is great, and the wind noise reduction is very, very good.  I hear a little from time to time, but most of the time I feel the wind on my face but can only hear it if I am really looking for it.  They have a lot of modes you can set it too, but the one that works the best for me against wind is manual mode, maximum (level 5) noise cancelling with wind reduction on.They remember their settings no problem after you take them out of their case.  The earfuns seemed to turn off sometimes (go back to non-cancelling mode).  The worst thing about that in the earfun case is that in order to connect to the buds with their app you MUST have an internet connection.  This was a problem on my last flight as you might imagine.  The 1mores were great on the flight -- and no issues about connecting to the app  in flight.  It was a transatlantic flight and they ran out of juice so I switched to the earfuns for a while so they could get enough charge back into them.  With the 1mores the engine noise and other extraneous airplane sounds were almost gone and I enjoyed my music.  I have not flown with the Anker's yet.  Hopefully they will do as well as the 1more's there (but I'll have the 1more's along just in case!).  Supposedly the battery lasts longer in the Anker's, but only ride for about 3 hours at a time so I have not tested that.One final GREAT thing about the Ankers vs the others I've tried is that you can disable the on-bud controls.  I always have my phone on my bike, so if I need to change modes I can do so.  Since I found settings I like I don't need to anyway....  In the app you can select what every combination of taps does individually.  And every combination has a do nothing setting.  You'll still get a beep if you trigger the setting while inserting or wiggling the bud around, but it has no effect.  Just what I want.  If I want to skip a song my phone is right there, usually with the app up that is playing said songs.Sometimes I start hearing wind, and that just means the buds have slipped a bit.  A quick twist or wiggle and the wind is gone.  They've never fallen out, but I'm riding a recumbent so I'm just sitting in a lawn chair while I pedal.I use these only for listening to music.  My wife called me when I was out while using the earfuns and she said I sounded fine.  I have not used these so far to talk on the phone while I ride so I cannot speak to that.

product: soundcore by Anker Liberty 4 NC Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds
review_text: I ordered 3 different earbuds all within a similar price range(+\- $30) to figure out which one I liked the most - Soundcore Liberty 4 NC, P40i, and JBL Vibe Beam. Here are my notes and comparisons.The Liberty 4 NC is my favorite but there is one aspect I don‚Äôt like.They Liberty‚Äôs are very clear with good bass and their app allows you to customize EQ settings which is deal breaker for me. (All three pairs have custom EQs within their respective apps). The noise cancellation on the Liberty‚Äôs is great, comparable or even better than AirPros 2 and the fit is superb and on par with the P40i.The JBL Vibe was less comfortable but more so than JBL Tune(ordered these a while back). The JBL Vibes are not noise canceling and I knew that before hand so I‚Äôm not knocking it.The JBLs are fine for the price point but not the best for quality as they use 8mm drivers vs 11mm drivers for the Soundcore.The one thing I don‚Äôt like with the Liberty‚Äôs is the slightest white noise I get when between songs or silent parts. The P40i‚Äôs don‚Äôt have that problem. The P40i have great bass and fit just as well but they lack in higher frequencies and that‚Äôs important for audiophiles. The P40i also have a much friendlier app interface with many more preset features. BUT the Liberty‚Äôs have an option to set up your ‚Äúideal listening EQ‚Äù and that is a great feature as it adjusts to your preferred sound through samples and takes the guess work out.Overall the Liberty 4 NC‚Äôs took the cake with respect to comfort and sound quality. To me, it was worth the extra $. I can‚Äôt speak on longevity as I received all three and have been testing them individually the past couple days.Not knocking any of these, just trying to give an honest opinion to those who are debating  price/quality
