product: XIAOMI Redmi Buds 4 Active
review_text: I recently purchased the Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active and I‚Äôm absolutely impressed with them. For the price, they deliver exceptional sound quality, comfort, and functionality that I didn‚Äôt expect at this price point.Sound Quality:The 12mm dynamic driver produces clear, balanced sound with deep bass and crisp treble. Whether I‚Äôm listening to music, watching videos, or taking calls, the sound quality is rich and immersive. The audio is loud enough to block out background noise, but still clear and precise, which is great for workouts or commuting.Bluetooth Connectivity:The Bluetooth¬Æ 5.3 connection is super stable and ensures there are no drops or interruptions, even when I‚Äôm walking around or moving my head. The connection pairs quickly and smoothly with my phone and other Bluetooth devices. The Google Fast Pair feature is a convenient addition, allowing me to connect the buds to my phone instantly.Battery Life:The 28 hours of listening time with the case is impressive. Even after long listening sessions, I don‚Äôt need to worry about charging them constantly. I can go through an entire workday or long trips without having to charge them, and when they do need a charge, it‚Äôs quick and easy with the compact case.Comfort & Fit:The buds are lightweight and fit comfortably in my ears. They don‚Äôt feel heavy or bulky, and they stay securely in place even when I‚Äôm on the move. I can wear them for hours without discomfort, which is important for my long listening sessions or calls.Design:The Graphite Black color is sleek and modern, with a nice matte finish. The case is compact, making it easy to throw into my pocket or bag without taking up too much space. The overall design feels premium, especially considering the price.Conclusion:Overall, the Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active are a fantastic choice if you‚Äôre looking for affordable yet high-quality earbuds. The sound quality, Bluetooth connection, and long battery life make them an excellent value. If you're looking for reliable wireless earbuds for everyday use, I highly recommend these.

product: XIAOMI Redmi Buds 4 Active
review_text: I recently purchased the Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active for my wife and myself, and I am extremely impressed with their performance! The sound quality is exceptional, with crisp highs and deep bass thanks to the 12mm dynamic driver. Whether I'm listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls, the audio experience is clear and immersive. The Bluetooth 5.3 connection is super stable, and I‚Äôve had no issues with connectivity or dropouts.The fit is incredibly comfortable. The earbuds come with multiple ear tip sizes, ensuring a secure and snug fit for different ear shapes. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort, and the noise isolation is great, blocking out most external sounds, which enhances the listening experience even more.The battery life is impressive as well. I‚Äôve been able to use them for several hours on a single charge, and the charging case provides plenty of additional power for multiple uses. The touch controls are responsive and make it easy to adjust volume, skip tracks, and take calls without having to pull out my phone.Overall, these earbuds are an incredible value for the price. The Xiaomi Redmi Buds 4 Active deliver on sound quality, comfort, and battery life, making them a perfect choice for anyone looking for high-quality wireless earbuds. Highly recommended!

product: XIAOMI Redmi Buds 4 Active
review_text: I had previously been using truck stop earbuds (several different types), and they are all terrible. When I bought this item I was like "I like my other Xiaomi products, let's try this one". Audio quality is _great_. That's both "listening to music" audio quality and also "other people say that they can hear me perfectly on phone calls" quality. Battery life is also great. The device paired instantly with my Pixel and setup was basically zero steps. Three sizes of ear cushions are included, the default ones fit me without any need for swapping. I was really amazed at how other people on the phone said "Sure I can hear you fine, why are you asking?" Never had that experience with the cheap earbuds :) Thoroughly recommend these, at least for Android users - I haven't tried on iPhone.

product: XIAOMI Redmi Buds 5 Wireless Earphone
review_text: these are my second pair. these are great earbuds for the price, great quality of sound, feel really comfortable on the ear and not like they're going to fall, and they do include three sizes of silicone tips to fit different ears. if you live outside the US (or have a VPN) you can download the app for useful features, my favorite being find my earbuds which lets you track the case, or each earbud separately by making them play a loud sound. the noise cancellation is great, I ride bikes as a passenger a lot and these help tune out all the traffic noise, and the microphone picks up your voice even in those loud scenarios. the battery's amazing, it can last the whole week using with the case, and I haven't had my earbuds die on me even after 4 - 5 hours.  I know this can be bought separately, but I would love to see a protective case included, as you can see, mine are a little scuffed because of having them in drawers, bags or sometimes dropping them. on that same topic of dropping those, I'm very clumsy, and I have dropped them a few times and they still resist the impact, especially the case which with some other earbuds has broken for me. I do own a Redmi phone so I've never had any compatibility or connectivity issues, they connect really fast and rarely get disconnected by moving around.

product: XIAOMI OpenWear Stereo Hi-Res LHDC Earbuds
review_text: These Xiaomi OpenWear Stereo Hi-Res LHDC Earbuds are comfortable to wear, and the sound is pretty good...but for several reasons, I was torn between giving them three stars or four.  I'm going to preface my review by mentioning that I'm using them with a Xiaomi phone (13T Pro) because the experience of pairing and using them will likely be different on non-Xiaomi devices and because Xiaomi phones have a following here but aren't widely used in the United States.As soon as I opened the charger case and took out the headphones they were recognized by my phone and a pop-up menu came on my display to pair them.  I didn't need to go into the Bluetooth menu or Bluetooth Pairing Mode first, but that's almost certainly because I'm already using a Xiaomi phone.The pop-up menu may suggest that you go to the Play Store to download the Xiaomi Headphones App.  A bar code for the app is also included in the packaging of the headphones.  The problem if you live in the United States is that the Xiaomi Headphones App is indeed available in the Play Store, but not for download here.  You can download the Android app directly from Xiaomi's website in Taiwan or likely find it on an APK Site, although downloading it directly from Xiaomi is probably the safer choice.If you already own a Xiaomi smartphone running HyperOS, then you don't need the app because all of the menu options available in the app are baked directly into HyperOS.  If you go into the list of paired Bluetooth devices on your phone and click the right arrow a menu with headphone options  (see pics) comes up that's identical to the interface from the separate headphones app.You can specify what happens when you single, double, and long press the right and left earbuds, choose between using AAC and SBC Bluetooth codecs (more on that particular setting in a moment--but if you read no further, NEVER USE THE AAC BLUETOOTH CODEC ON  AN ANDROID DEVICE), and manually enable the ANC which does very little on my phone--possibly because it isn't compatible with the AI Features in HyperOS.  I can tell when ANC is turned on and off, but it has so little practical effect in terms of reducing ambient noise that activating it is pointless.  In the menu options ANC shows up under Laboratory  Functions as Comfort and noise reduction and needs to be manually enabled every time you connect the headphones.  Since this is a Laboratory Function, that probably means it's either experimental or still in active development.  The other possible reason it's not part of the main controls may be that the ANC works better on some devices than others, since it's a function that relies heavily on AI to work.To be fair to Xiaomi---the ANC in Bluetooth headphones from Bose, Sony, and Samsung also relies on AI to work, unlike older wired headphones, where the ANC functioning was completely hardware-based and built into the physical body of the headphones themselves.  Bluetooth ANC headphones often require an app and attempt to leverage the AI Capabilities built into your smartphone CPU to do most of the noise-cancelling heavy lifting.Earbuds don't offer sound quality comparable to over-the-ear headphones at the same price point, but you're sacrificing great sound for convenience and portability.  As far as earbuds go, these Xiaomi OpenEar sound quite good with nice definition and a balanced range that keeps trebly music from sounding shrill or bass-heavy music from sounding muddy.  I own earbuds from Skull Candy, Sony, Xiaomi (from their cheaper Redmi line), and Zipforce and these easily sound the best.I also appreciate the ear hooks because I have trouble with fit and comfort with some earbuds.  These stay in place over the ear, and I don't have to worry about them popping out and losing one or both.  Since they sit just outside of the ear, wearing them causes no discomfort or ear irritation over extended periods of use--problems that I often encounter with in-ear style earbuds.So if these sound good and are comfortable, why was I strongly tempted to give them three stars instead of four?The gesture commands don't work as well as they should.  Using a single tap to raise or lower volume is fine although I wish a single tap didn't change the volume quite so much--but the double tap commands to stop and restart music don't work reliably to the point where I've given up on even trying to use them--if I'm at a register or in another situation where I would normally want to pause music I turn down the volume instead because turning down the volume actually works.  Using the double tap on either earbud more often than not gets registered as two separate taps to change the volume or as a single long tap to access Google Assistant (Gemini) but since accessing the assistant makes it ready to listen, I didn't realize that the assistant on my phone was being activated.While the ANC does little on my phone call quality is good even in noisy environments and people at the other end of calls can always seem to hear me so there is some kind of noise cancelling going on with phone calls that does work well.Now a quick warning about AAC:In the Audio Menu for the headphones under Audio Quality you can choose between AAC which is listed as High Quality and SBC which is listed as Standard Quality.  That's not an accurate description on Android.  SBC has been capable of high definition sound since Bluetooth 5.0 and AAC is an Apple Bluetooth codec that works very poorly on Android devices.  Even if you're listening to a music source with the AAC Audio Codec you shouldn't use the AAC Bluetooth codec thinking that it passes through the sound.  Despite sharing the same name the AAC Audio Codec and Bluetooth codec are two separate things.  The AAC audio codec is capable of reproducing full CD-quality sound.  The AAC Bluetooth codec is not.  The AAC Bluetooth Codec re-encodes audio rather than passing it through even on Apple devices.The menu toggle for the headphones allowed me to switch between AAC and SBC on the fly while listening to songs.  With a lot of music, you can barely tell any difference between the two.  But with songs that are difficult to reproduce because there are multiple instruments playing simultaneously or music that uses reverb to create atmosphere and space the AAC Bluetooth Codec cuts off audio frequencies well within the range of normal human hearing.  Sound is clipped and songs have noticeably less range.Final Verdict:  If having effective ANC is an important feature, then I definitely can't recommend the Xiaomi OpenWear Stereo Hi-Res LHDC Earbuds.  The tap gestures beyond single taps to change volume also work poorly.  But these are very comfortable to wear, they sound nice, and if you're using a Xiaomi phone running HyperOS, all of the headphone controls from the separate headphones app are baked right into the OS.  For me, these were worth the money, but they may not be the best choice for everyone--especially in the United States, where Xiaomi phones aren't that widely used.

product: Xiaomi Portable Mini Bluetooth Speaker Sound Pocket
review_text: This Xiaomi Mini has easily the best sound of any compact Bluetooth speaker I've used.  Sound is clear and balanced, and also surprisingly full for a speaker this size.  My tastes run towards new wave and power pop, and this speaker does a nice job with delicate acoustic guitar, plucked strings, and percussive synth notes, preserving the character of the music without allowing the individual instruments to blend into mush, which is what usually happens with speakers this small.Some people may not be satisfied with the level of bass--but the only way to deliver thumping bass without making the overall sound muddy is to have a woofer or sub-woofer separate from the main speaker reproducing the bulk of the instruments.  A speaker this size can deliver heavy bass or it can deliver a balanced sound, but it can't do both--for most music, balanced sound is far preferable.You can also answer phone calls with this speaker, but that's not something that I tested or have any interest in.With an IP 67 rating, this speaker can get wet without being damaged (which is why the product image shows splashing water surrounding the speaker).  The rating means the speaker can be submerged in water for 30 minutes, which is something else that I didn't personally test and really wouldn't recommend.  I did test water contact in the shower, and the speaker held up fine to that.Final Verdict:  For the price and size, this is a pretty amazing speaker.

product: XIAOMI Portable Bluetooth Speaker Bluetooth 5.4
review_text: I bought one a little over a year ago. It‚Äôs such a great portable speaker, I just bought a second one to take advantage of the stereo pairing option. Sound quality is amazing for such a small speaker. Working as a stereo pair, with eqMac for slight corrections in my home studio, they sound like an expensive pair of studio monitors.Very durable and serviceable too: my first one fell from the top of a shelf and the battery, and a connector came loose, not allowing it to charge and rattling with bass-heavy music. Long story short, with simple tools I was able to open it up, repair the damage, and put it back together.It‚Äôd be perfect if it had USB-C playback ‚Äîor even a 3.5mm jack, but I don‚Äôt see why the whole thing can be hacked once the battery dies.

review_text: Great smartwatch for the price! The screen is bright and clear, the battery lasts days, and it‚Äôs very comfortable to wear. Tracks steps, sleep, and workouts accurately. Simple, fast, and perfect for everyday use. Highly recommend!

product: XIAOMI Redmi Watch 5 Active Smartwatch
review_text: I‚Äôve always been a fan of Xiaomi products ‚Äî I actually had two of their phones back before they became really popular. I don‚Äôt currently have one, but I might go back to Xiaomi after this experience. The Redmi Watch 5 is a nice and simple smartwatch for the price ‚Äî you really can‚Äôt expect premium features when it‚Äôs not even $100, but it definitely holds its own.It does take a little time to get used to, especially figuring out how to unlock it, navigate the features, and connect it to the app on your phone. But once you get it set up, it works well and does what it‚Äôs supposed to. Overall, it‚Äôs a good, reliable watch for everyday use.

product: XIAOMI Redmi Watch 5 Active Smartwatch
review_text: The Redmi Watch 5 delivers an excellent balance of performance, design, and value. The display is bright and sharp, the tracking features are accurate, and the battery life easily lasts several days on a single charge. product: XIAOMI Redmi Watch 5 Active Smartwatch
review_text: The watch itself is very nice,  good size, battery life and features.  What I don't like is how or why I cannot get it to stop receiving my calls.  All of my phone calls while i m in and outside my car always default to going to this watch.  I have made some many changes but none worked.  My first option would be the car's audio,  and if i m not in the car,  I like using my speaker phone to talk.  But everything goes to the watch.  Even on my phone,  I would try to switch over to speaker phone,  car's audio,  but it wont' let me.
